description:
Title:

Senior Level Full Stack Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Around here, we define the future.
We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

Note: This position is contingent upon contract award, customer approval, and funding availability.

Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a government background check
Citizenship Requirement: Applicants must be U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents 
 

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

About the Role

A senior level full‑stack developer passionate about building user‑centric web apps and map‑based UIs. You thrive in collaborative environments, love solving complex problems, and want your work to make a real‑world impact in science and technology programs.

You will have:

Strong hands‑on experience with React (SPA patterns, hooks, state management) and MapLibre for interactive web mapping.
Proficiency across JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Python.
Experience designing and maintaining database‑driven applications (PostgreSQL).
Ability to build secure, performant, and accessible front ends and robust APIs/services.
Excellent collaboration, communication, and time‑management skills.
Bachelor’s degree in a software/computing field and 8+ years of relevant experience.

The role

As a Software Engineer – Full Stack, you will design, build, and support advanced web‑based mapping and data visualization tools. You’ll work on geospatial applications and data products used across environmental science, natural resource management, and other mission‑driven domains.

What you’ll do

Develop interactive React applications featuring MapLibre maps (vector tiles, layers, sources, styling, controls, and performance tuning).
Build and maintain full‑stack features using JavaScript/TypeScript, React, HTML/CSS, Python, and XML.
Implement server‑side services/APIs and integrate with PostgreSQL.
Apply software engineering best practices across design, testing, documentation, and security.
Partner with teammates and stakeholders to iterate quickly and deliver high‑quality solutions.

Preferred experience

MapLibre ecosystem expertise (style JSON, sprite/glyph pipelines, vector/raster tiles, performance profiling); familiarity with Mapbox‑compatible tools.
Framework experience with MVC frameworks.
Requirements gathering and design analysis.
Git‑based workflows and configuration management.
GIS tools (commercial or open source), spatial ETL, and tile generation.
Understanding of OGC standards (WMS, WFS, WCS, WPS) and OGC APIs.
Knowledge of spatial data formats, projections, and reference systems.

Who we are — the impact we make

At KBR, we are thinkers, creators, explorers, and problem‑solvers. Our teams support missions that protect the planet, advance scientific understanding, and deliver innovation to communities around the world. When you join us, you join a global organization committed to excellence, inclusion, and meaningful impact.

Ready to make a difference? Apply today.

Bring your React and MapLibre expertise to a team that values innovation, collaboration, and purpose. Apply now and follow KBR on LinkedIn to stay informed on news and opportunities.

title: Database Engineer (RDS PostgreSQL & OpenSearch)
description:
Title:

Database Engineer (RDS PostgreSQL & OpenSearch)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Around here, we define the future.
We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

Note: This position is contingent upon contract award, customer approval, and funding availability.

Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a government background check
Citizenship Requirement: Applicants must be U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents 
 

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Database Engineer with deep expertise in Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL and Amazon OpenSearch Service. The ideal candidate will be capable of architecting scalable data solutions, optimizing performance, and troubleshooting complex production issues across relational and search engine workloads. This role supports mission critical systems and requires a strong background in AWS cloud services, database internals, and distributed data architectures. 

Key Responsibilities 

Architecture & Design 

Design and implement scalable, highly available database architectures using Amazon RDS (Postgres) and OpenSearch. 
Create schema designs, index strategies, and data models optimized for query performance and storage efficiency. 
Evaluate and recommend tools, patterns, and best practices for data pipelines, ingestion, search indexing, and replication. 
Develop secure, resilient architectures aligned with cloud-native and DevSecOps principles. 

Performance Optimization 

Conduct in-depth performance tuning including:  
SQL query optimization 
Indexing strategy improvements 
Vacuum/analyze planning 
Connection pooling and load balancing adjustments 
Optimize OpenSearch clusters for indexing throughput, shard/replica strategy, query performance, and log analytics workloads. 
Monitor performance using CloudWatch, Performance Insights, OpenSearch Dashboards, and custom telemetry. 

Operations & Troubleshooting 

Lead troubleshooting of database and cluster issues including failovers, replication lag, slow queries, cluster imbalance, and node-level failures. 
Perform root cause analysis and implement long term corrective actions. 
Maintain backup, restore, and disaster recovery strategies for both Postgres and OpenSearch. 
Support automation of administrative tasks using InfrastructureasCode (Terraform, CloudFormation) and scripting tools. 

Security & Compliance 

Implement and maintain IAM policies, encryption at rest/in transit, security groups, and audit logging. 
Ensure database and cluster configurations meet organizational security standards and regulatory requirements. 

Backup & Restore 

Define Recovery options (RPO/RTO) and setup appropriate backup strategy. 
Create plans for backup service management including schedules and disaster recovery options. 
Implement procedures to restore operations for point-in-time-recovery (PITR) and disaster recovery. 

Collaboration & Communication 

Work closely with application teams, cloud architects, DevOps engineers, and data stakeholders to support existing systems and plan new capabilities. 
Provide guidance on database best practices and mentor junior engineers. 

Required Qualifications 

5+ years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, including advanced SQL, performance tuning, query planning, and replication. 
3+ years of experience with Amazon RDS (Postgres) in production environments. 
2+ years of experience managing and tuning Amazon OpenSearch clusters. 
Strong understanding of AWS services including EC2, IAM, VPC networking, S3, CloudWatch, Lambda, and KMS. 
Experience with Terraform, CloudFormation, or other IaC tools. 
Proficiency with scripting languages (Python, Bash) for automation and diagnostics. 
Solid understanding of distributed systems, search indexing, and data lifecycle management. 

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience supporting mission critical or high throughput environments. 
Knowledge of log analytics pipelines (e.g., FluentBit, Logstash, Firehose). 
Familiarity with containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD pipelines. 
Certifications: AWS Solutions Architect, AWS Database Specialty, or similar. 

Why This Role Matters 

This engineer will play a key role in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of core operational datasets and search capabilities that underpin critical applications and services. Their expertise will directly contribute to improved system stability, faster analytics, and more efficient data operations. 

Ready to make a difference? Apply today.

Basic Compensation:

$107,700-$161,600

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Field UX Researcher
description:
Title:

Field UX Researcher

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Around here, we define the future.
We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

Note: This position is contingent upon contract award, customer approval, and funding availability.

Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a government background check
Citizenship Requirement: Applicants must be U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents 
Travel: Up to 50-60% domestic travel

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

About the Role

KBR is seeking a Senior UX Researcher to support mission‑critical Science & Space programs. In this role, you will uncover user needs, validate product decisions, and drive research‑backed insights that shape roadmap priorities and technical implementation.

You will work closely with highly specialized users—including scientists, engineers, and operations personnel—whose work underpins national infrastructure, space operations, and environmental monitoring. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in complex domains and wants to influence systems that have real national impact.

Why Join KBR?

Innovative, High‑Impact Work

Contribute to advanced systems powered by modern DevSecOps pipelines, cloud‑native architectures, containerization, automation, and real‑time data workflows supporting critical scientific missions.

Collaborative, Multidisciplinary Environment

Work alongside product managers, engineers, designers, scientists, and mission specialists in a culture that values iteration, innovation, and continuous improvement.

Meaningful Mission

Your insights directly influence systems that support satellite missions, national alert systems, geospatial analysis platforms, and other essential technologies.

Key Responsibilities

User Research & Discovery

Conduct mixed‑methods research (interviews, observations, surveys, usability studies, analytics review).
Perform on‑site fieldwork at scientific or federal facilities with minimal disruption to operations.
Apply both qualitative and quantitative approaches to uncover root problems and define user needs.
Develop research plans, scripts, and protocols aligned with product goals.

Analysis, Synthesis & Strategy

Translate findings into actionable insights, clear problem statements, workflows, and journey models.
Communicate insights that influence roadmap priorities and design direction.
Facilitate alignment across product, engineering, and stakeholder groups.

Design Collaboration & Validation

Partner with UI/UX designers on concept validation and iterative user testing.
Collaborate with engineering teams to implement analytics for continuous learning.
Conduct formative and summative usability tests to evaluate product solutions.

Advocacy & Leadership

Mentor junior researchers or designers.
Support development of research operations, experience metrics, and team best practices.
Promote user‑centered thinking across cross‑functional teams.

Required Qualifications

U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Bachelor’s degree in human‑Centered Design, Psychology, Behavioral Science, IT, or related field
6+ years of UX research or UX design experience in complex, large‑scale systems
Proficiency with research and design tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, InVision, Axure)
Experience with collaboration/versioning tools (Zeplin, Storybook, Abstract)
Strong understanding of Agile processes and integrating research into iterative workflows
Excellent communication, facilitation, presentation, and storytelling skills
Ability to rapidly understand technical domains and explain insights to diverse audiences
Demonstrated ability to balance user needs, business goals, and technical constraints
Portfolio showcasing research process, depth, and measurable impact

Desired Qualifications

Experience in scientific, government, aerospace, defense, or similarly complex technical domains
Familiarity with enterprise SaaS, responsive web apps, or cross‑platform systems
Working knowledge of HTML/CSS, JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Angular), REST APIs
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Python)
Experience with modern research platforms (e.g., Dovetail, UserTesting, Lookback, Maze)
Leadership experience in facilitation, mentoring, or guiding design direction

Join Us

If you want to apply deep human‑centered research to systems that advance the nation’s scientific and space missions, we’d love to meet you. Your contributions will help deliver reliable, resilient, mission‑ready solutions that make a real impact.

$75,500-113,200

title: Sr. Metrology Technician
description:
Title:

Sr. Metrology Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Sr. Metrology Technician is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards and taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests. Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  Calibration of metrology lab standards as required.  The position requires fluency in calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up test equipment calibration systems.  Metrology Technician may be required to provide assistance to entry level technicians as they learn new measurement procedures and processes. This role will report to the lead technician and lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of electronic and physical/dimensional measuring and test equipment according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Calibrate and repair equipment such as Multimeters, frequency counter, timers, oscilloscopes, Thermo-hygrometers.

Calibrate standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.

Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.

Interpret and create uncertainty budget in accordance with ISO 17025:2017

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Complete all other duties as assigned.

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with 7+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 5+ years of experience.

Working knowledge of one or more of the following voltages, current, resistance, capacitance, time and frequency, signal conditioning, blueprint and drawings, dimensional tooling and hand tools, pressure controllers, pressure dead weight testers, force gages and load cells, etc.

Ability to interpret, validate, modify, and create uncertainty budgets in accordance with ISO 17025:2107

Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.
 

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal systems.

Familiarity with laboratory measurement and calibration equipment.

Experience in calibration of mass and weights, and/or the use of mass comparators.

KBR Benefits

title: MCPP: Electronic Technician
description:
Title:

MCPP: Electronic Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Installs, tests, troubleshoots, repairs, modifies and completes associated administrative documentation on various types of electronic equipment such as ground common radio equipment, digital wideband and multiband networking communication equipment, and related electronic devices. Must be able to lift 50 pounds.  Provides technical assistance, guidance, or training to lower level technicians and assists higher level technicians.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

Complete the Military Basic Electronics Course and the Ground Transmission Systems Repair Course, or other service equivalent. 
Five years of directly related work experience. 
In lieu of military courses/experience, a combination of an AA degree in electronics or equivalent certification from a technical/vocational school, and directly related work experience may be considered, e.g., DOD 8570 IAT level II certification or FCC General Radio Telephone Operator License.
Demonstrate basic and some advanced technical knowledge required to solve routine problems by interpreting technical manuals or similar documents. 
Working knowledge required to adjust, repair, and maintain radio transmitters and receivers to include operating procedures, radio wave propagation, radio practice, electrical principles, circuit components, practical circuits, signals and emissions, and antennas and feed lines.  
Familiar with the interrelationships of circuits and possess judgment required in planning work sequence, in selecting tools and testing instruments.
Ability to obtain and maintain a tactical vehicle operator license as necessary, comply with all accepted practices, established methods, safety standards, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.
U.S. Citizen.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance and Base Access.

description:
Title:

Mid-Level Full Stack Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Around here, we define the future.
We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

Citizenship Requirement: Applicants must be U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents 
 

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

About the Role

A mid‑level full‑stack developer passionate about building user‑centric web apps and map‑based UIs. You thrive in collaborative environments, love solving complex problems, and want your work to make a real‑world impact in science and technology programs.

You will have:
Strong hands‑on experience with React (SPA patterns, hooks, state management) and MapLibre for interactive web mapping.
Proficiency across JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Python.
Experience designing and maintaining database‑driven applications (PostgreSQL).
Ability to build secure, performant, and accessible front ends and robust APIs/services.
Excellent collaboration, communication, and time‑management skills.
Bachelor’s degree in a software/computing field and 3–7 years of relevant experience.
The role

As a Software Engineer – Full Stack, you will design, build, and support advanced web‑based mapping and data visualization tools. You’ll work on geospatial applications and data products used across environmental science, natural resource management, and other mission‑driven domains.

Primary Location: Sioux Falls, SD
Remote Work: Remote candidates may be considered in certain circumstances
Work Authorization: U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident

What you’ll do
Develop interactive React applications featuring MapLibre maps (vector tiles, layers, sources, styling, controls, and performance tuning).
Build and maintain full‑stack features using JavaScript/TypeScript, React, HTML/CSS, Python, and XML.
Implement server‑side services/APIs and integrate with PostgreSQL.
Apply software engineering best practices across design, testing, documentation, and security.
Partner with teammates and stakeholders to iterate quickly and deliver high‑quality solutions.
Preferred experience
MapLibre ecosystem expertise (style JSON, sprite/glyph pipelines, vector/raster tiles, performance profiling); familiarity with Mapbox‑compatible tools.
Framework experience with MVC frameworks.
Requirements gathering and design analysis.
Git‑based workflows and configuration management.
GIS tools (commercial or open source), spatial ETL, and tile generation.
Understanding of OGC standards (WMS, WFS, WCS, WPS) and OGC APIs.
Knowledge of spatial data formats, projections, and reference systems.
Who we are — the impact we make

At KBR, we are thinkers, creators, explorers, and problem‑solvers. Our teams support missions that protect the planet, advance scientific understanding, and deliver innovation to communities around the world. When you join us, you join a global organization committed to excellence, inclusion, and meaningful impact.

Ready to make a difference? Apply today.

Bring your React and MapLibre expertise to a team that values innovation, collaboration, and purpose. Apply now and follow KBR on LinkedIn to stay informed on news and opportunities.

title: Senior Technical Professional - Field Engineering
description:
Title:

Senior Technical Professional - Field Engineering

Program Summary:

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Job Summary:

Senior Technical Professional - Field Engineering Position

The principal technical professional supports the F/A-18 engineering Fleet Support Team and supports the daily operations of aircraft maintenance. This position supports the Naval Aviation Enterprise by ensuring on-time modiﬁcation efforts for the F/A-18 E/F & EA-18G Service Life Modiﬁcation (SLM) program and the F/A-18 C/D High Flight Hour program.
This role provides direct Subject Matter Expert team support, technical guidance, and program/project coordination with internal teams and external stakeholders to optimize maintenance execution, inspection quality, and overall aircraft readiness. Supports management and execution of pre-modiﬁcation corrosion identiﬁcation inspections and mitigation efforts to reduce repair growth and improve modiﬁcation turnaround time. The position ensures efficient workﬂow management, drives data-informed technical solutions, and maintains the highest standards of safety, compliance, and operational performance in accordance with Naval Policies.
The candidate will have proven Naval Aviation maintenance management background;  well-versed in F/A-18 & EA-18G systems and structural components; experience in Service Life Modification (SLM) initiatives; extensive knowledge of corrosion mitigation processes; expertise in fleet flight line operations, systems knowledge of databases such as IETMs, DECKPLATE, MRO, and Depot Issue Reporting (DIR); strong data analytics skills; proficient in conducting overall maintenance inspections, as well as possess technical directive knowledge.
Must have excellent communication skills (verbal and written)

Role and Responsibilities:

Serves as the program advisory lead for the F/A-18 Fleet Support Team (FST) Engineering Maintenance Readiness Team (MRT), providing technical expertise for highly time-critical projects or tasks requiring specialized knowledge in technical and modiﬁcation areas.
Supports the SLM Integrated Product Team (IPT) and SLM Program Integrators (PI) in executing SLM analytics, supports internal and site teams overseeing Pre- and Post-SLM inspections, and coordinating corrosion data collection to optimize aircraft modiﬁcation efficiency. Position contributes to the creation of technical requirements for Pre- and Post-Service Life Modiﬁcations to improve repair quality, minimize modiﬁcation costs, and reduce turnaround times.
Provides program/project management support to drive completion of the F/A-18 C/D High Flight Hour and E/F Service Life Modiﬁcation (SLM) programs, ensuring timely and effective team contribution to the F/A-18 aircraft full-service life extension goal of 10,000 ﬂight hours.
Coordinates with engineers to provide technical advice and assist with problem resolution, particularly in support of aircraft service life modiﬁcations, Life Limited Repairs and inspection processes.
Provides oversight, guidance, and coordination across multiple stakeholders to optimize program outcomes, inspection quality, and maintenance efficiency.
Assist the government assess the technical sufficiency, quality, and timely delivery of program deliverables.
Collaborates with NAVAIR PMA-265, FST Engineering, TYCOM, Depot personnel, and squadron leadership to ensure effective execution of F/A-18 pre- and post-SLM inspections.
Assist FST Structure Engineers in the management of the Life Limited Repair Program, ensuring timely completion of inspections that reduced maintenance delays and increased aircraft availability for scheduled operations and deployments.
Provides support in the development and reﬁnement of Depot tools (Depot Issue Reporting) to improve data collection and analysis for aircraft repair and upgrade activities. Assists in creating Focus Area Lists (FAL) to identify high-impact areas that drive better planning, reduce repair growth, and enhance overall program efficiency.
Advise on acquisition and program management activities, offering guidance to government leadership on challenges related to modiﬁcation, service life extension, delivery planning, and integration efforts. Contribute technical insights during system program reviews to ensure alignment with program objectives and readiness requirements.
Assist in the coordination of aircraft service life event planning and process execution for efficient and effective completion of work and expeditious return to ﬂight status.
Ensure teams comply with CNAF 4790.2 series policies and consistently apply IETMs and NAVAIR engineering information, including drawings, publications, and bulletins, to support accurate, high-quality maintenance and modiﬁcation work across all sites.
Ensure currency of all DoD and NAVAIR Data Management policies, procedures, and industry standards.
Participate in ongoing efforts to improve operational processes, sharing best practices and supporting initiatives that enhance quality, cost-effectiveness, and team performance.

Basic Qualifications:

Clearance: U.S. Citizen. A current active Secret clearance is required. 
Candidate must have 12 plus years of relevant technical experience (required).
Bachelor’s Degree is preferred but a combination of education and experience that provides knowledge and exposure to the fundamental theories, principles and concepts within speciﬁc discipline can be utilized.
Computer skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and the capability to learn, use, and master the position's required computer applications.
Well-versed in F/A-18 E-G systems and structural components, have experience in Service Life Modification (SLM) initiatives, and have extensive knowledge of corrosion mitigation processes.
Expertise in fleet flight line operations, systems knowledge of databases such as IETMs, DECKPLATE, MRO, and Depot Issue Reporting (DIR), along with having strong data analytics capabilities.
Proficient in conducting overall maintenance inspections, as well as possessing technical directive knowledge.
Must be familiar with USN/USMC programs and NAVAIR data source applications.

Primary Location: San Diego, CA (onsite at customer location.)

Compensation: $117,370.00 - $176,000.00.  The salary range posted is for California locations. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (AFSOC Unit/Ft Bragg, NC)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (AFSOC Unit/Ft Bragg, NC)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

The Special Operations Clinical Psychologist will provide technical expertise, guidance, and direct clinical service to special operations forces (SOF).

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• May develop, plan and initiate resiliency programs for preventing and treating behavior health issues to support all aspects of a service member readiness and resiliency.

• Conduct psychological evaluations utilizing information from clinical interviews, psychological testing, and collateral sources, as appropriate.

• Practice within the guidelines of their state licensing board, American Psychological Association Ethical Principles and Code of Conduct, and MTF privileges.

• Establish psychiatric diagnoses according to the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Disorders including providing psychological treatment for individuals and groups, helping medical and surgical patients deal with illnesses or injuries, and assisting in rehabilitation of patients.

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

• Position requires U.S. Citizenship.

• This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.

• Doctorate of Philosophy (PhD) or Doctorate of Psychology (PsyD) from an American Psychology Association accredited college or university with a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology.

• Successful completion of an Internship/Residency in psychology accredited by the American Psychological Association.

• • A minimum of two (2) years peer-reviewable practice of clinical work in a mental health setting. 

• Providers must be able to meet clinical competency requirements specified in the Service-specific credentialing instructions.

• Licensure: Current, full, active, and unrestricted license to practice as a psychologist in any U.S. State, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico or U.S. Virgin Islands.

• Obtain practice privileges from the servicing military medical treatment facility. 

Standard Company Requirements: 

• Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.

• Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.

• Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.

• Responsible for completing all required training.

• Perform other assignments and duties, as required.

Desired Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

• Experience working in a government setting such as DoD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.

title: Special Operations Psychological/Mental Health Technician (27 SOW/Cannon AFB, NM)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Psychological/Mental Health Technician (27 SOW/Cannon AFB, NM)

The Psychological Mental Health Technician shall assist with the management and treatment of outpatient behavioral health activities.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Primarily responsible, under the supervision of a licensed psychiatrist, social worker, psychiatric nurse or psychologist, for providing a wide range of behavioral health interventions from prevention to treatment to individuals and who assigns work by defining objectives, priorities, and deadlines, and provides guidance on assignments that do not have clear precedents.
Under the supervision of a credentialed provider, conduct intakes, assist with care and treatment of psychiatric, drug and alcohol patients, and counsel clients/patients with personal, behavioral or psychological problems.
Accomplish work on a substantially independent basis, performing a full range of standard and nonstandard work assignments and resolving a variety of non-recurring problems encountered on own initiative. Extensive guidelines are available; however, the contractor must use judgment in locating and selecting the most appropriate guideline for application to the work situation at hand. Unusual matters, which may not be specifically covered by policy statements or published regulations, shall be referred to the Government supervisor.
Observe patients to detect behavior patterns and reports observations to licensed behavioral health staff.
Lead prescribed individual or group therapy sessions as part of specific therapeutic procedures under the guidance of a licensed mental health professional.
As needed, complete initial intake interviews and complete required forms for new patients on behalf of the licensed mental health provider.
Collect and maintain monthly statistical data assigned work place.
Conduct intake interviews under the supervision of a licensed mental health professional.
Administers psychological tests, compiles data and prepares reports for psychological testing under the supervision of a licensed psychologist.
Administer psychophysiological tests and assessments under the supervision of a licensed medical/mental health professional
Populate and maintain a computerized database that will contain the listing of all units within the HQ organization and identify the number of service members assigned to each unit/Directorate in order to compile monthly training statistics.
Prepare daily correspondence (i.e., training agendas, meeting agendas, purchase orders, clinical appointments).
Collect and maintain monthly statistical data assigned work place.
Prepare and maintain attendance rosters and statistical data for all active duty personnel who attended Social Work/Behavioral Health services.
Assist in developing program-operating instructions, works with providers to uncover inefficiencies, and makes recommendations for corrective action.
Make comparison reviews, to include office time sheets, to ensure program operations are managed within budget.
Be responsible for the development and implementation of appointment templates for clinical providers.
Place physical maintenance work orders and maintain hand receipts for physical property and inventory. Ensure proper supply stock levels and reorder as necessary including specialized behavioral health forms and tests.
Duties also involve assisting or independently gathering data for various presentations such as process improvements initiatives, longitudinal statistical tracking, hospitalizations, and discharges. Manipulates data and presents it using off the shelf software applications. Provide information via telephone and in person to the members of the Command, the professional staff, civilian and military personnel in response to inquiries regarding appointments.
Interface frequently with the Command’s family support organizations.
Maintain competency folders in accordance with program policy.
Coordinate attendance and agenda at Case Review Committee with military and civilian agencies.
Coordinate and reserve meeting location, verifies attendance and prepares current and tentative following weeks agenda.

Prepare open and closed case reports for required special handling of outpatient medical records in accordance with regulations.
Maintain a resource library for use by professional staff and customers. Library materials are selected with the intent of providing knowledge, ideas and support to practitioners in the fields of education, clinical social work and family studies.
Provide services to families desiring information on healthy family life and parenting skills.

Required:

Must have, or be able to obtain a Secret Clearance.
An associate degree or commensurate level of training, e.g. military mental health technician, for a psychiatric technician or mental health program assistant. Education requirement may be met by military or comparable training. If military trained, the individual’s specialty must be as a mental health technician / specialist.
The contractor shall have no less than 3 years’ experience as a psychiatric technician.
Must attend psychiatric technicians’ training which will provide a sound foundation / basis to psychology and/or social work to ensure the tech is prepared for the types of individuals and potential illnesses that they will likely deal with. This training shall also address the basics of conflict management, how to de-escalate crisis situations and individuals who are agitated, violent or potentially violent and/or suicidal.
Must attend training to learn how to intervene and, when required, to restrain violent or potentially violent or suicidal patients by verbal or physical means.
Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) as certified by the American Heart Association.
Must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation.

title: Ground Systems Software Engineer
description:
Title:

Ground Systems Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking an SME in Broomfield, Colorado to perform SETA functions in an exciting opportunity within a Systems Program Office within the Customer Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) Office. The candidate will be an integral participant in ground system command and control software requirements development, design analysis, coding, and verification.  Key areas of focus include ground system full life cycle software procurement from requirements identification and development through system test, sell-off delivery, and installation at operating location.  Requires an understanding of DevSecOps for building software to deploy into the Cloud.  Must be familiar with computer architectures from both hardware and software perspectives in order to provide analysis and recommendations for ground command and control operations and maintenance and ground system network long-term supportability.  Track ground system software development issues and upcoming events – provide status updates to the customer as needed.  Identify and assess emerging risks and develop & evaluate proposed burn-down plans.  Review developer’s readiness to proceed into factory and site test and evaluation.  The candidate will also be an integral part of software requirements definition, development, allocation, design, and verification. 

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Provide expert advice/analysis on ground systems software requirements, design, installation, test, and operations support for the ground system’s command, control, configuration.

Monitor and ensure overall system software adhere to systems requirements, program ground system requirements, assess verification methodologies and coordinate developer’s CONOPs with stakeholders.

Assess evolving Information Assurance standards in the context of planned product obsolescence.

Provide day-to-day support to customer lead.  Develop and assess briefing packages for SPO engineering, risk, and program-management reviews.

Support relevant ground system software and hardware specification development and test planning activities.

Monitor the development, installation, and transition to operations of a cloud-based, satellite command and control system.

Monitor developer completion of ground segment specification sell-off, along with other verification and validation activities to include cross-organizational thread-lead support for ground segment requirements sell-off.

Provide expert advice concerning software development – review software interface definition for accuracy to ensure requirement allocation documentation is complete and accurate.

Coordinate with spacecraft bus development team and ground systems software.

Coordinate across the Program Office for any proposed specification changes and facilitate integration of changes into the baseline.

Coordinate Discrepancy reports and assist in the prioritization and communication of reports to the Government.

Develop productive relationships with development contractor counterparts, functional counterparts, and other spacecraft, payload, and ground subject matter experts.

Advise and mentor customer personnel regarding Segment architecture, specification, and verification and validation.

Basic Compensation:

$137,000 - $188,000 USD annually

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Required:

Active/Current TS/SCI with Poly.

BS Degree required.

9+ years of experience with a BS degree, 6+ years of experience with an MS degree.

Prior ground system experience in a major satellite program office or commercial SATCOM office.

Demonstrated knowledgeable of DevSecOps.

Must be familiar with agile software development processes and associated metrics.

Demonstrated knowledge of acquisition, development and O&M practices for large, complex systems.

Experience in DoD/IC acquisition process and program management milestones.

Familiarity with Customer software security best practices for software code implementation and design.

Excellent interpersonal, leadership, team building and problem solving skills with demonstrated ability to be effective in a USG/Contractor team.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Presentation Designer & Video Maker/ Editor Engineer (PMC role)
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Presentation Designer & Video Maker/ Editor Engineer (PMC role)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR Abu Dhabi is currently looking to fill a position of Presentation Designer & Video Maker/ Editor Engineer (PMC role) for our Offshore Client. The role is to be based in Abu Dhabi in Client office.

Profile matching below criteria only will be contacted.

Role Purpose

The Presentation Designer & Video Maker/Editor will create high-impact presentations, motion graphics, and video content to support executive communications, stakeholder engagement, and project storytelling. The role combines advanced PowerPoint design with hands-on video editing and simple animation to translate complex technical concepts into clear, compelling visuals that align with brand and quality standards.

Key Responsibilities

Presentation Design

Design executive-level and stakeholder-ready PowerPoint presentations with a strong visual hierarchy and narrative flow.

Translate complex technical and project information into clear, visually compelling slides, diagrams, and infographics.

Develop custom visual elements (icons, charts, illustrations, templates) and maintain brand consistency across assets.

Standardize and continuously improve presentation templates, master slides, and a shared asset library.

Video Production & Editing

Plan and edit short-form videos (explainers, interviews, project updates, teasers, and event highlights).

Create motion graphics, text overlays, lower thirds, transitions, and simple 2D animations as needed.

Perform color correction, audio balancing, subtitling/captions, and overall quality enhancement.

Support scriptwriting and storyboarding; coordinate with stakeholders for assets, approvals, and timelines.

Collaboration & Governance

Work closely with leadership, engineering/project teams, and communications to clarify objectives and target audiences.

Adhere to brand guidelines and information sensitivity requirements; ensure accuracy and confidentiality.

Organize and maintain project files, templates, and asset libraries for efficient reuse and scalability.

Skills & Experience

Design & Software

Advanced PowerPoint (layouts, master slides, custom themes, charting, and visual storytelling).

Adobe Creative Cloud: Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, and After Effects (essential).

Ability to produce infographics, custom graphics, and simple 2D animations.

Video & Motion

Demonstrated experience editing corporate, training, or promotional videos.

Competence in motion graphics, titling, transitions, and visual effects suitable for corporate standards.

Optional but beneficial: basic camera operation and on-site shooting coordination.

Professional Attributes

Exceptional attention to detail and high quality standards.

Strong time management; able to prioritize multiple concurrent requests and meet tight deadlines.

Clear communicator with a collaborative mindset and service orientation.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, Multimedia, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

3–7 years of relevant experience spanning presentation design and video editing/motion graphics.

Experience in corporate/consulting/agency settings; exposure to energy or industrial sectors is a plus.

Portfolio/showreel demonstrating presentations and video work (required).

KPIs / Success Measures

Quality and clarity of visual storytelling in executive and stakeholder materials.

On-time delivery against agreed timelines and ability to manage multiple briefs.

Stakeholder satisfaction and adherence to brand and confidentiality standards.

Efficiency improvements via templates, reusable assets, and streamlined workflows.

Submission Requirements

Submit an updated CV for each candidate.

Provide a portfolio/showreel with links to presentations and videos (or PDF/MP4 samples).

Confirm software proficiency (PowerPoint, Adobe CC) and workstation/specs details.

title: RF Hardware Engineer
description:
Title:

RF Hardware Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking an RF engineer to support one of our government customers.The RF engineer will be required to provide expertise to the the Government in the design, performance, and acquisition of a major program. The job is in a new program office that is working on a challenging schedule.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Execute characterization of RF signals for inclusion in automated signal databases.

Supports major milestones, technical, and testing events by review of requirements and test documents then reviewing the performance and testing results.

Advises the Government on success or failure of the test and design.

Responsible for supervision of contractor design, performance testing, analysis, and verification.

Participates in design reviews and advise the Government on performance and design risks.

Performs on a team that oversees all aspects of design and build of the RF mission payload.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: >10-20% within the United States

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required Qualifications:

Active/Current TS/SCI with Polygraph clearance required.

14+ Years of relevant experience with a BS in Engineering, Scientific, or Technical discipline or 12+ Years of relevant experience with a MS in Engineering, Scientific, or Technical discipline or 9+ Years of relevant experience with a PhD in Engineering, Scientific, or Technical discipline.

Experience with the system design trade process, assessing system design options, analyzing mission requirements, monitoring system development, test development/execution.

Experience in design and evaluation of RF HW design Experience with Customer mission programs and enterprise.

Desired Qualifications:

3+ years experience with Customer space and RF systems acquisition and/or sustainment.

Understanding RF systems engineering, acquisition, and operations best practices.

3+ years experience with Customer space and RF systems acquisition and/or sustainment.

3+ years experience with RF hardware design.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

locations

description:
Title:

Commissioning Superintendent (Rotating)

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

KBR is looking for a Commissioning Superintendent (Rotating) with Offshore Site experience in MEGA EPC projects to be based in Abu Dhabi for PMC project.

Experience required:

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering is a MUST. Having a minimum of twenty (20) years of relevant experience in the commissioning / operation readiness position with experience in GCC region as preference. Must have at least (5 ) years of experience in a similar position in Oil & Gas or Petrochemical projects with preference of commissioning sour gas ,Hydrogen production, Hydro-

desulfurization projects.

Sales gas & Condensate Commissioning Lead shall provide guidance to his

commissioning Team, EPC contractor, Sub-Contractors within his area of responsibility.

Coordinate with Licensors and Vendors to ensure close monitoring of commissioning

activities are within Licensors and Vendors guiding procedures.

Responsible for the progress of commissioning activities of sales gas and Condensate

area.

Review pre-commissioning and commissioning Procedures. Provide the required advice and support for Sr. Commissioning Manager a. Review commissioning manuals issued by EPC Contractor or Vendors. Verify mechanical completion certificates requirements for various systems and

subsystems.

Participate in commissioning meetings and other related meetings. Participate in troubleshooting analysis to resolve commissioning obstacles. Verify the readiness of systems/subsystems for MC and RFSU certificates issuance. Monitor and approve the close out of punch lists in his area. To ensure completion and handover methodology is proceeding in compliance with related contractual documents.

Interested and suitable candidates please apply for the role. Suitable candidates will be contacted directly.

title: Senior Quantity Surveyor
description:
Title:

Senior Quantity Surveyor

Simply put, at KBR, we do things that matter.

Every day, our people work together to deliver solutions that are helping solve the great challenges and opportunities of our time, including climate change, national security, energy transition and security, cybersecurity, space exploration, and more.

We are seeking an experienced and driven Senior Quantity Surveyor to support a major infrastructure programme in Scotland.

You will be responsible for estimating, monitoring, and managing the costs associated with construction projects. You will work closely with project managers, architects, engineers, and contractors to ensure projects are completed within budget and in compliance with relevant regulations and standards. Your expertise in cost estimation, contract administration, and financial management will be instrumental in the successful execution of construction projects.

What Do We Need

You must have experience with NEC Contracts and a proven track record of working on large-scale infrastructure projects, ideally within the defence sector.

Strong cost management and commercial acumen, including budgeting, forecasting, and risk management.

Experience in procurement and contract administration, including variations and claims.

Ability to lead and mentor junior surveyors, ensuring compliance with project and client requirements. Excellent stakeholder engagement skills, working with clients, contractors, and multidisciplinary teams.

Proficiency in CEMAR.

Qualifications

Ideally Degree qualified in Quantity Surveying

Member of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (MRICS)

Location

The role is Hybrid where 3 days per week will be spent in the office in Glasgow City Centre.

Occasional site visits will be required so having your own transport is essential.

Security Requirements

SC Clearance

Due to the secure nature of this project, restrictions in relation to UK residency and nationality will apply.

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR Abu Dhabi is currently looking to fill a position of Lead Commissioning Engineer – Mechanical System - ( WHT's subsea cable & piping) for an Offshore Well Head Tower/ Platform Project to be based initially for some time in Abu Dhabi in Client office or Contractor’s office and later move to Fabrication Yard and then to Offshore Site on 6 weeks/ 3 weeks rotation ( as per client requirement).

Profile matching below criteria only will be contacted.

Requirements

Minimum Overall 20+ years of experience in Oil and Gas industry.
Having experience working in Well head Tower, Subsea cable & Piping within Brownfield Modification projects is an added advantage.
Having minimum 5+ years of previous experience working in ADNOC Projects.
Must have worked at least 5 years of experience in similar position for mega oil and gas FEED/ EPC project ( more than US$ 1 Billion)
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering is a MUST.

title: Senior Materials & Corrosion Engineer
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Senior Materials & Corrosion Engineer

Job Requirement
This opening is for Senior Materials and Corrosion Engineer who will be based in KBR Abu Dhabi Operating Center, UAE. The candidate will be part of a growing team of Materials and Corrosion Engineers supporting various Oil & Gas projects in the Middle East. 

The candidate should have proven experience in Front End Engineering Design (FEED) and Detailed Engineering Design (DED), and Concept Select of medium to large scale projects. Good knowledge and understanding of the most prevalent degradation mechanisms in the Oil & Gas Industry and relevant corrosion mitigation strategies with the ability to manage complex projects. Key responsibilities will include preparation of FEED/Detailed Engineering Design philosophies/Design Basis, Material Selection Reports, Material Selection Diagrams, Corrosion Control Documents, etc. Good knowledge and experience in Cathodic Protection deliverables including CP Design Calculations. 

Key Skills & Technical Competencies:
•    BSc. /B.Eng. Degree Materials, Metallurgy, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. 
•    12(+) years of experience in Oil & Gas Engineering Projects
•    Knowledge of Cathodic Protection design will be an advantage.
•    Experience with Middle East projects particularly ADNOC is important. 
•    Experience of preparing Project Specifications including Corrosion Monitoring, Coatings and Painting Specifications, 
•    Good knowledge of Integrity Operating Windows and Corrosion Monitoring. 
•    Good skills in writing comprehensive technical reports, presentation, communication, and collaboration across engineering disciplines.
•    Good knowledge of relevant industry codes, standards, and recommended practices. 
•    Knowledge and application of the latest corrosion modelling software tools including ECE.
•    Ability to solve complex technical problems and provide practical solutions.

Job Responsibility and Requirement
•    Prepare Material Selection Reports, Material Selection Diagrams, Materials Selection & Corrosion Control Philosophies, Corrosion Monitoring & Chemical Injection Philosophies, Cathodic Protection Scope of Work, Material Take Off and Design Calculations.
•    Perform corrosion rate modelling using industry recognized corrosion modelling software such as ECE 5.8 (minimum) as part of the material selection process.
•    Produce calculations and technical reports as per project requirements. 
•    Application and Knowledge of the relevant Industry Standards/Recommended Practices such as NACE MR0175/ISO 15156, MR0103/ISO 17495-1.
•    Good knowledge of Corrosion Risk Assessment studies and Material & Corrosion Audit process. 
•    Define corrosion control and mitigation strategies as part of the material selection process.
•    Providing materials and corrosion input to other disciplines deliverables, including static equipment datasheets, rotating equipment datasheets, Piping Material Specification, Piping MTO’s, P&IDs. 
•    Provide input to proposals and prepare the manhours’ estimates relating to the Materials & Corrosion Deliverables. 
•    Keep abreast with the latest trends and advancements in material science and corrosion engineering, proactively integrating new technologies and methods into design processes.


Experience required:
•    12 (+) years of Oil & Gas Industry experience required.
•    At least 6 years of experience in FEED/DED projects

Key Relationships:

•    Department Manager, Materials & Corrosion Engineering
•    Materials and Corrosion Engineers and Graduate Engineers
•    Project & Engineering Managers
•    Other disciplines (Mechanical, Piping, Process, Pipeline, etc.)

Mandatory:
Bachelor’s degree in Metallurgy/Materials Science/Mechanical Engineering from a recognized institution.
Interested and suitable candidates please apply for the role. Suitable candidates will be contacted directly. 

What We Offer:

•    Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
•    Engaging and collaborative work environment with a commitment to safety and sustainability.
•    Access to KBR online learning, which enables you to grow, develop and advance your skillset.

title: MCPP: SHIPBOARD MOTOR TRANSPORT MECHANIC
location:
locations
Jacksonville, Florida
Fort Cavazos, Texas
MCAS Cherry Point, North Carolina
Kings Bay, Georgia
Camp Lejeune, North Carolina
description:
Title:

MCPP: SHIPBOARD MOTOR TRANSPORT MECHANIC

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

The Marine Corps' Prepositioning (MCPP) Program is based on Blount Island in Jacksonville, Florida, WITH DUTY ASSIGNMENT ABOARD A SHIP IN GUAM, SAIPAN, OR DIEGO GARCIA.  We provide maintenance and logistics services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) and U.S. Navy.  We are seeking a Shipboard Mechanic (Motor Transport).

Job Summary

Maintains, services, inspects and repairs combustion-powered automotive vehicles, over-the-road trucks, and comparable vehicles such as light combat vehicles, and trucks as well as other motor transport equipment.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school graduate or equivalent.

Certificate from a vocational school or other recognized source with a major study in electrical or automotive repair is preferred. In lieu of formal course work, a combination of college credits, on-the-job training, other formalized training, or experience may be considered.

Must have 4 years directly related work experience.   

Completion of the basic automotive mechanics course, or equivalent. 

Completion of the automotive organizational maintenance course, or equivalent.

Completion of the automotive intermediate maintenance course, or equivalent. 

Completion of the advanced motor transport maintenance courses. 

Must maintain a valid passport.  

Possess a valid State Motor Vehicle Operator License. 

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.

Must be a U.S. Citizen. 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access. 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Process Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Process Engineer

Job Responsibilities:

Conduct Process engineering and design, including process configuration and optimization studies

Perform Process simulations, prepare Process/Utility Flow Diagrams, Heat and Material Balance, and Utility Balances

Create Piping and Instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs)

Prepare datasheets for process equipment and instruments

Conduct relief and blowdown studies, analyze relief load scenarios and calculate flare network requirements

Perform process calculations for equipment sizing and line hydraulics

Create Process design philosophies and operating guides

Collaborate on Concept Studies, Front- End Engineering Design (FEED) and detailed design projects

Job Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Chemical Engineering

At least 7 years of relevant engineering design experience

Good experience with Offshore FPSO, Oil and Gas, and LNG terminal projects. Experience on Energy transition projects will be an advantage

Leadership experience in managing process teams for Hydrocarbon projects

In-depth understanding of process design, heat and material balance, and P&IDs

Preference will be given to candidates with Lead / Area Lead Engineer experience

Familiarity with international codes and standards, software and tools

title: Principal Engineer – Mission Integration
description:
Title:

Principal Engineer – Mission Integration

About KBR:

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries. 

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver. 

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity

The Principal Engineer is a senior technical leadership role within the Mission Integration Operating Unit, responsible for assuring the technical integrity, governance, and quality of engineering outcomes across complex Defence programs and capture activities. Acting as Technical Authority, the role provides strategic and operational direction across Mission Integration, ensuring engineering capability, assurance, and professional standards are consistently applied and aligned with KBR and customer regulatory frameworks.

The role leads the development and governance of engineering processes, technical assurance, delegations, and quality systems, working closely with program and project engineering leads, Chief and Principal Engineers, and broader Operating Units. This includes oversight of engineering deliverables, review of designs and technical artefacts, and provision of expert guidance to projects operating under both KBR and customer systems and procedures.

The Principal Engineer also plays a key role in shaping the professionalisation and development of the engineering workforce, including workforce planning, learning and development frameworks, and career pathways. Working in partnership with People & Culture, the role drives technical excellence, capability sharing, and continuous improvement across the Mission Systems portfolio in a highly regulated Defence environment.

Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but are not limited to:

Provides leadership and technical direction as Technical Authority across the Mission Integration Operating Unit

Works closely with Operational Unit and program/project engineering leads and their staff.

Assume responsibility for defining and governing requirements and adequateness of competences and professionalisation of the engineering and technical workforce within Mission Integration OU to meet the needs of the business.

Develops and maintains Mission Integration Operating Unit and ADSS engineering processes and procedures that interface with the broader KBR Quality system.

Manage process for delegations and approves delegations to Engineering Leaders as well as approval of the technical assurance process that covers subdelegation to the engineering and technical workforce.

Manage the delivery of the Technical Assurance functions, including quality assurance, audit, analysis, corrective action. reporting and lessons learnt.

Provide leadership and assistance to programs and projects on an as required basis including technical advice and direction, and sourcing internal or external expertise as required.

Provide direction and guidance with developing and maintaining a framework for technical learning and development.

Work closely with Operational Units and People and Culture in developing the careers of technical personnel including training and professionalisation needs, and potential roles.

Attend project status reviews.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Essential:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline (equivalent to a 4-year Washington Accord accredited program), along with relevant professional certifications to enable professional registration.

Registration or immediate eligibility for registration as a Professional Engineer with an Australian professional institution e.g. Engineers Australia or Professionals Australia (FIEAust, CPEng, PE).

Registration or immediate eligibility for registration as a Professional Engineer in Australia to satisfy the requirements of the Australian State based Acts (as applicable) and/or any Australian Federal regulations.

Experience of Senior level delegation with responsibility at Design Engineering Level or Compliance Verification.

Experience of leading large engineering teams (>12 engineers) in an operational role.

Professional Engineer with 15y+ of experience in digital systems, including significant experience of Defence Engineering across multiple domains and programs. This should include direct experience of systems engineering development, design, validation and verification and certification across a number of complex programs.

A good understanding of the regulatory environment of one or more domains of Air, Sea, Land, Space and Cyber of the Australian Defence Force.

A good understanding of software dominant systems integration and certification of assured software.

Experience of working closely with Australian Customer organisations such as Capability Acquisition and Sustainment Group and Naval Shipbuilding and Sustainment Group, Guided Weapons and Explosive Ordnance Group and Defence Science and Technology Group.

Experience of working with ASDEFCON suite of contract documentation with an excellent understanding of the intent and content of the Engineering series of documents.

Experience of demonstration compliance to regulation for engineering capability including Test and Evaluation and Certification.

Proven experience as an Engineering Leader of assured and critical systems within a Defence context, aerospace, or other highly regulated environments.

Demonstrated understanding of systems engineering principles, including full lifecycle management and the application of engineering and technical disciplines across complex systems.

Demonstrated understanding of configuration management within systems engineering, including the establishment and control of baselines and the effective management of engineering change.

Have or be eligible for Australian Government Security Clearance (NV1 or higher).

Desirable:

A Masters degree in a technical or relevant subject will be valued.

Full system lifecycle experience across multiple program contexts, including assessment of engineering change.

A strong understanding of relevant regulations for compliance with assured systems.

A strong understanding of System Safety Assurance and Assessment, including Compliance Verification

Full lifecycle experience with focus on requirements design, validation and verification

Strong experience in demonstrating Design Assurance and Certification.

Experience in leading innovation and managing uncertainty.

Experience of maturing new capabilities through People, Process and Tools dimensions.

Experience of software environments is beneficial such as DevOps Agile and/or SAFe frameworks as well as familiarity with popular coding languages (eg. Python, Javascript).

Ability to work within a complex, dynamic technology environment and be comfortable with iterative approaches and challenges of emergent capability.

Experience with Software and Hardware Integration such as data bus interfaces, real-time processing, and sensor fusion.

Good understanding of secure, resilient, and interoperable communication systems.

Knowledge of cyber resilience, threat modeling, and secure systems design is an advantage.

Experience of Modular Open Systems Approach (MOSA) for open interfaces and modularity is an advantage.

Benefits of KBR

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work (Aus, India, UK & US)

Flexible working conditions

Competitive salary (including annual reviews)

Paid Parental leave

Paid Reservist leave

Income protection

Corporate rewards

Salary packaging/Novated leasing

Discounted employee stock purchase plans

Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts

Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now! 

KBR acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and their continuing connections to land, sea, community and culture. We pay our respects to Elders past and present.

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.
