title: Chief Engineer (Process Safety)
description:
Title:

Chief Engineer (Process Safety)

Job Responsibilities:

Independently develop/oversee design safety philosophy, HSE Plan, and specifications for fire protection systems (active and passive), HFE, etc.

Lead/participate in process hazard reviews and analysis, including HAZOP/HAZID/SIL studies, and be responsible for action close-outs.

Lead/chair the HAZOP/HAZID/SIL workshops, if required.

Review third-party safety studies, including FERA, dispersion analysis, EERA, ESSA, dropped objects study, QRA studies, etc. (not limited to). Capable of independently carrying out similar safety studies, as required.

Independently design active and passive fire protection systems and prepare Hazardous/H2S Area Classification documentation, safety and firefighting layouts, escape route and lifesaving equipment layout, and other safety drawings.

Carry out safety critical elements performance standards, RAM, fire and gas detection mapping, etc., based on project requirements.

Act as Package Engineer, if required, for safety and firefighting equipment.

Manage and guide Junior/Senior Engineers and Designers on Concept/FEED/Detailed Engineering projects.

Provide health and environmental inputs (including health risk assessments such as chemical exposure, noise and lighting, ergonomics/human factors engineering, environmental impact assessments, etc.) to projects.

Interface/coordinate with other engineering disciplines and clients, and take the lead in resolving technical matters related to safety aspects.

Deliver project safety deliverables as per the project schedule.

Provide inputs and support to projects in all safety aspects, including progress reports.

Provide advisory support and oversight to the Process Safety Team for their activities and deliverables and ensure technical integrity and quality.

Provide support for new bid proposals, including deliverable lists/manhour estimates, etc.

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent from an accredited university.

Minimum 22 years of relevant design engineering experience, including as a Technical Advisor.

Good HSE engineering experience in the oil and gas industry, in process safety/technical safety, with a minimum of 5-7 years in a lead position on similar projects.

Involvement in pre- Feed, Feed, Detail design projects for offshore (FPSO/platforms) and onshore (refineries, LNG facilities, storage terminals, etc.).

Experience in a minimum number of offshore projects (FPSO/platforms).

Good knowledge of oil and gas process facilities, local and international process safety codes and standards, and regulatory/marine codes and standards (MODU, SOLAS, DNV/Lloyds Register).

Hands-on experience in plot plan review, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL classification/verification, and other safety reviews (e.g., SIMOPS, ALARP).

Good working knowledge of PIPENET Vision, Flaresim, and other consequence modeling software such as DNV PHAST, etc.

Ability to influence designs to achieve optimal HSE outcomes.

A team player with leadership potential and proactive inter-discipline communication skills.

Good HSE engineering experience in the oil and gas industry, in process safety/technical safety, with a minimum of 5-7 years in a lead position on similar projects.
Involvement in pre- Feed, Feed, Detail design projects for offshore (FPSO/platforms) and onshore (refineries, LNG facilities, storage terminals, etc.).
Experience in a minimum number of offshore projects (FPSO/platforms).
Good knowledge of oil and gas process facilities, local and international process safety codes and standards, and regulatory/marine codes and standards (MODU, SOLAS, DNV/Lloyds Register).

Title:

Senior Technical Advisor – Engineering (Capability Manager)

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

The Opportunity: 

The Senior Technical Advisor is responsible for developing and growing KBR’s engineering capability to meet current and future business needs. The role leads capability maturity across people, process, tools and data, driving initiatives that strengthen engineering delivery and organisational performance. Working closely with defence clients, internal teams and industry partners, the role supports the evolution of digital engineering infrastructure, including collaborative environments and systems integration capabilities.

This is a permanent full-time opportunity and can be based in either Adelaide, Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

The successful candidate must be eligible to hold a AGSVA security clearance.

Responsibilities: 

Build and mature engineering capability across people, process, tools and culture to meet current and future project needs
Assess capability maturity, define metrics and address capability gaps across the organisation
Collaborate with technical teams and stakeholders to uplift capability enablement and delivery effectiveness
Develop and maintain best-practice engineering frameworks, architectures and artefacts within the Engineering Management System
Evaluate and integrate internal and external models into enterprise and engineering frameworks
Define end-to-end architecture solutions aligned to business needs, technology standards and roadmaps
Grow and maintain the digital engineering knowledge base to support reuse, adoption and delivery efficiency
Engage with defence clients, project teams and industry partners to shape technical strategies and roadmaps
Ensure compliance with defence standards and cybersecurity requirements
Capture user feedback and continuously improve models, environments and tools
Integrate supplier and customer models into broader system and enterprise architectures
Produce clear technical documentation and reporting on capability status and performance
Support the deployment and ongoing enhancement of digital engineering environments, infrastructure and services

As the ideal candidate you will bring: 

Essential:

BSc/BA in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field and commensurate certifications with relevant professional body.
8+ years’ experience in systems engineering, including digital design, integration and architecture in defence, aerospace or other regulated environments
Strong understanding of systems engineering lifecycles (e.g. waterfall, agile, spiral) and modern delivery concepts such as speed to capability and minimal viable capability
Proven ability to develop and document architectures, models, processes and engineering artefacts
Experience working with operational concepts, models and stakeholder inputs to deliver high-value outcomes
Sound knowledge of configuration management, engineering change and related technical disciplines (e.g. system safety, cybersecurity)
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, including mentoring technical teams
Knowledge of defence engineering standards and eligibility for Australian Government security clearance (NV1 or higher)

Desirable:

Postgraduate qualification and/or professional accreditation (e.g. CPEng, ACS, RPEQ)
Experience with MBSE methodologies and tools (e.g. SysML, UML)
Exposure to capability maturity models, metrics and performance indicators
Experience across multiple defence domains (air, land, maritime, space or cyber)
Evidence of technical leadership, authorship or working effectively in complex, uncertain environments

All candidates will be required to hold and maintain an active NV1 Defence Security Clearance. Only candidates holding a NV1 Clearance or above should apply.

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Systems Engineer

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a senior systems engineer that has experience working with PATRIOT Ground Support Equipment (PGSE) hardware and applied US Military standards. Candidates must possess relevant engineering experience in the development and fielding of Military Ground or Air Defense Systems. The engineer in this role will be part of senior engineering staff supporting the Program Acquisition Executive (PAE) Fires - Integrated Fires Mission Command (IFMC) Project Office. This candidate will be responsible for shaping and directing future engineering concepts and current efforts to meet warfighter and Army Acquisition objectives in an ever-changing threat landscape.  This role is critical for ensuring USG success in fielding upgrades and modernization at the highest systems engineering level for the PGSE program.

Roles and Responsibilities

The senior systems engineer selected will lead obsolescence mitigation strategies, new technology integration, and capability and requirements changes. 

The candidate will further support these efforts by reviewing new and existing system requirements and corresponding technical data. 

They will develop studies to consider requirements impacts, alternative courses of action, and analyses to reduce risk and facilitate solution down-selection.

The senior engineer will be responsible for creating and/or reviewing technical drawings, specifications, digital engineering models, and software capability updates. 

They will lead and brief meetings including OEMs, other vendors, foreign military program partners, and USG stakeholders to refine designs, provide guidance to meet requirements, synchronize software and hardware updates, maintain and deconflict schedules, and mitigate integration issues.

This role requires an engineer that will also review test objectives, witness testing, and assess the validation and verification of software and hardware requirements. 

They will be responsible for analyzing test results and briefing high-confidence fielding recommendations to the USG. 

This candidate will also aid PGSE to coordinate with other Product Offices, acting as a liaison to align integration programs and product modifications. 

Basic Qualifications

Certified undergraduate engineering degree in electrical, mechanical or aerospace engineering
Minimum 5 years of experience working in US Dept. of War Air and Missile Defense systems engineering roles
U.S. Citizen with active Secret Security Clearance or the ability to obtain and maintain this level of clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Certified master’s degree in systems engineering
Proficient at interpreting mechanical and electrical technical drawings and military engineering specifications
5 years designing and reviewing military system requirements
5 years in roles responsible for providing technical briefings and guidance to US Government customers and other team members
Experience using Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) tools such as Cameo or Magic Draw.  Demonstrate past modeling of requirements and systems in MBSE environments
Demonstrates working knowledge of Army Acquisition efforts and how they flow down to a Product’s Systems Engineering Team
History coordinating and supporting Interagency Defense Efforts
Background in Ground Support Equipment hardware and systems design with an emphasis on application of existing system requirements to modifications and new requirements
Experience briefing technical content to external customers
Technical Understanding of the PATRIOT Air and Missile Defense System including, requirements, configurations, software builds, capabilities, and foreign partner programs

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
Title:

Principal Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

 

KBR, is seeking a highly motivated Principal Software Engineer to join us in supporting our great nation, working with a prototype development team in Colorado Springs, CO.

In this position, you will be responsible for the continued design and development of database models and backend-for-frontend software development. Additional responsibilities include interfacing with engineering partners from both private and government organizations, as well as direct communication with government stakeholders.

 

Why Join Us? 

Innovative Projects: At KBR, you'll be working on prototype projects that support the Department of Defense mission-critical objectives. KBR plays an integral role in leading the discovery, development, and integration of affordable warfighting technologies for our air, space, and cyberspace force. Collaborative Environment: KBR fosters a dynamic and collaborative atmosphere where cross-functional teams of engineers, developers, and defense experts work in unison. We practice Agile and DevOps principles, ensuring rapid iteration, continuous feedback, and integration across all projects. Our team is passionate, forward-thinking, and united by a mission-first mindset that encourages knowledge sharing, innovation, and problem-solving at every level. 

Impactful Work: Your work here won’t just be limited to software development—it will directly support the Department of Defense in expanding current national capabilities. 

 

Key Responsibilities:

Design database models using PostgreSQL

Design geospatial models using GIS, PostGIS, and Mapbox / OpenLayers

Design, engineer, analyze, and develop software prototypes as part of a multi-disciplinary team

Develop proof-of-concepts and prototypes of backend and backend for front-end components

Engage with customers to better define the problem space and vision to determine capabilities and priorities for prototypes

Work across multiple technology stacks, gaining hands-on experience with various languages, frameworks, and tools to support a broad range of applications

 

Work Environment:

Location: Colorado Springs, CO – Hybrid or Onsite

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Flexible

 

Qualifications:

Required:

Security Clearance: Must be eligible to obtain a U.S. government TS/SCI security clearance which is something only a U.S. citizen can obtain

Required Experience and Education: BS degree in Computer Science or Information Systems. Other degrees will be considered with relevant work experience.

Advanced proficiency in Java, and Java frameworks such as Spring Boot

Proficiency in SQL

Experience with Docker

Experience with Azure Cloud

Experience with container orchestration with Kubernetes

Experience with git

Hands-on experience with Apache Kafka

Experience developing applications that interface with multiple message types, such as XML, JSON

Ability to work independently to research and solve customer pain points

Strong passion for conducting research, tackling complex problems, and continuously learning and adopting new technologies

 

Desired:

Experience working with Geoserver, or other Web Map Servers

Some experience working with Javascript fameworks such as React

Some experience working with MapBox or OpenLayers Javascript API

Working knowledge of Elixir and other Erlang family of languages

High level of curiosity and investigative mindset with an attention to detail, a tenacity of thought, the flexibility to adapt to new challenges, and the resiliency to overcome short-term hurdles by staying focused on the team's deliverables

Passion for conducting research, tackling complex problems, and continuously learning and adopting new technologies 

 

Basic Compensation: $142,800.00 - $214,200.00 USD Annually (Colorado Springs Only)
The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity. 

 

Additional Compensation: 
KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Cloud Developer – AWS Modernization
description:
Title:

Cloud Developer – AWS Modernization

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Around here, we define the future.
We share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

Position Overview

KBR is seeking a skilled Cloud Developer to join our team in modernizing mission-critical solutions for the USGS EROS Center. As a member of a collaborative engineering team, you will help migrate on-premises systems to AWS, utilizing both lift-and-shift and full modernization approaches. The role includes designing and implementing event-driven architectures, optimizing cloud workloads, and working closely with other developers, architects, and stakeholders to deliver innovative solutions using Agile methodologies.

Note: This position is contingent upon contract award, customer approval, and funding availability.

Eligibility Requirement:
This position requires U.S. Citizenship due to contractual and security requirements.

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

Responsibilities

Contribute to the migration of on-premises infrastructure to AWS using both lift-and-shift and modernization strategies.
Participate in the design and implementation of event-driven systems leveraging AWS-native services (e.g., Lambda, SNS, SQS, EventBridge).
Develop and maintain automation tools for provisioning, monitoring, and managing AWS cloud infrastructure.
Collaborate with solution architects, engineers, and other team members to deliver secure, scalable, and cost-effective cloud solutions.
Support the design and optimization of CI/CD pipelines using industry-standard tools (e.g., GitLab, Jenkins, AWS CodePipeline).
Apply Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles using Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Implement configuration management and automation using tools like Ansible.
Troubleshoot and support cloud-based applications in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment.
Contribute to documentation and process improvements to enhance system reliability and efficiency.
Identify and implement AWS cloud cost optimization strategies, incorporating FinOps principles.
Participate in Agile teams, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives, delivering incremental value through iterative development.

Required Skills/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or related technical field.
Minimum 6 years of experience in cloud engineering, DevOps, or software development, with a focus on AWS technologies.
Hands-on experience with lift-and-shift migrations and event-driven system design in AWS.
Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CDK, or AWS CloudFormation.
Experience with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef, Puppet).
Scripting proficiency in Python, Bash, PowerShell, or similar for automation.
Strong understanding of cloud security, networking, and AWS best practices.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and automation.
Demonstrated FinOps ability to reduce cloud spend through cost optimization strategies.
Experience working in Agile development environments and applying Agile methodologies.
Excellent troubleshooting skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including technical documentation.

Preferred Skills/Experience

Associate, Professional, or Specialty certifications in AWS that are relevant to cloud development (e.g., AWS Certified Developer – Associate, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional, AWS Certified Security – Specialty).
Experience with Agile methodologies and modern software engineering practices.
Experience designing and implementing event-driven architectures in AWS.
Familiarity with government security credential requirements and ability to obtain necessary clearances.

Special Requirements

Three years of continuous U.S. residency for government security credential.
Ability to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation for government facility access.
Experience and/or education in lieu of these qualifications may be considered.

Basic Compensation:

$110,000K – $ 165,000K

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Power Systems Engineer (Designer)
description:
Title:

Power Systems Engineer (Designer)

elong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

 

Around here, we define the future.

 

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.


The Mission Systems Operations Contract (MSOC) at the Johnson Space Center is seeking a Power Systems Engineer/designer with exposure to, and/or knowledge in, the electrical power systems area, and who is passionate about increasing their experience and knowledge in the areas of electrical circuitry and distribution systems for both the NASA/JSC Mission Systems critical and non-critical power systems. The selected applicant will also be involved in conducting impact analysis for any engineering modifications, installations, and maintenance of space mission systems in both the test environment and production environments, conduct power infrastructure analysis, electrical systems design, facility planning and modifications, as well as design and generation of required engineering drawings. The applicant will work in a team environment, and must possess good interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written. Our ideal candidate will have a strong drive to apply and continually update his/her skill base, is team oriented and with good problem-solving skills.

Responsibilities to include
• Generation of technical instructions for implementation
• Assist in the design of power infrastructures (circuitry, distribution equipment, etc.) for the 3 Mission Systems
• Consult/coordinate contract requests for facility modifications (i.e. walls and doors)
• Assist in the review of design proposals for impact to flight operations
• Assist in the design and implementation of room layouts per customer requirements and fire safety codes
• Communicate and coordinate with team leader, as well as MSOC management as needed
• Comply with the MSOC contract and NASA/JSC/MSD direction, policies, and procedures
• Make improvements and suggestions to advance the overall engineering processes in place
• Incident and Risk Management
• Support system projects and new engineering initiatives

Qualifications: 

Education: BS in Electrical Engineering or related discipline

10 years or more experience in premises (low voltage) wiring installation and/or design
 

Desired Qualifications

Excellent computer skills (MS Windows & Office)

Experience with Solidworks, Draftsite and PDM
Ability to examine and measure finished articles to verify conformance to standards

title: Intelligence Analyst Product Trainer
description:
Title:

Intelligence Analyst Product Trainer

KBR is seeking an experienced Intelligence Analyst Product Trainer to design, deliver, and continuously improve training programs for U.S. Government (USG) intelligence analysis applications and workflows. The employee will develop curriculum, hands-on labs, and scenario-based exercises that reflect real-world intelligence tradecraft, collection management, and analytic production practices. Employee will lead new-user onboarding, role-based advanced training, and sustainment sessions while aligning instruction with IC standards, mission use-cases, and enterprise governance. The role includes close collaboration with product teams and mission stakeholders to translate updates, features, and analytic methodologies into practical, measurable training outcomes. Strong facilitation, stakeholder engagement, and results-driven instruction are essential to ensure rapid, compliant adoption of mission systems.

Roles & Responsibilities

Develop and deliver instructor-led, virtual, and self-paced training for USG intelligence analyst applications (e.g., all-source analysis, link analysis, geospatial, data exploitation) aligned to IC tradecraft.
Create detailed training artifacts (curricula, syllabi, lesson plans, job aids, lab guides, quick-reference cards, and assessments) mapped to task-based learning objectives and mission workflows.
Build scenario-based practical exercises using realistic datasets that reinforce collection-to-analysis-to-production processes and analytic standards.

Basic Qualifications

Experience: 3+ years of professional intelligence analysis experience within DoD/IC (all-source, GEOINT, SIGINT, or counterterrorism/counterintelligence) or 3+ years of analyst experience plus 2+ years of formal training/instructional delivery on mission systems.
Education/Training Credential: Bachelor’s degree
Travel & Schedule: Ability to support travel up to 10% and work within secure facilities and mission schedules (including occasional surge periods).

Preferred Qualifications

Tool Proficiency (documented): Training or operational experience with common IC/DoD analysis tools (e.g., link analysis platforms, geospatial exploitation tools, data integration/ETL, workflow/case management systems) and enterprise data services.
Instructional Design Credential: Professional certification in instructional design or completion of formal train-the-trainer programs.
Mission Integration Experience: Prior experience standing up training programs during new system deployments, capability rollouts, or mission transitions, including building performance baselines and adoption metrics.

Clearance: Active TS/SCI w/CI Poly

Travel: Travel & Schedule: Ability to support travel up to 10% and work within secure facilities and mission schedules (including occasional surge periods).

title: Systems Engineer MBSE
description:
Title:

Systems Engineer MBSE

KBR seeks a highly motivated Systems Engineer to support an Intelligence Community Space customer.  The successful candidate will possess an understanding of government space architecture and systems, insight into resiliency mission fundamentals, and the ability to perform modeling and simulation of complex space systems in a Digital Engineering Environment.  Modeling and Simulation activities will support the development and validation of requirements, Concepts of Operations (CONOPs), architecture products, and the development and integration of simulation and analysis tools for space system resilience-related activities in the overall Enterprise.


Responsibilities:

Modeling and simulation of space systems, space, and ground segments

Provide technical expertise in systems and engineering to support resilience enterprise mission operations activities, programs, systems, and processes

Support modeling and simulation, including threat assessments/impacts, trades, and analyses

Communicate technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences

Participate in system design reviews and technical interchange meetings

Interface with customers, directorate/office representatives, and across system engineering groups to drive resolution plans and strategies for complex technical challenges

Work Environment:

Location: On Site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Standard

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in the STEM field

5+ years' experience in the space systems domain

Prior experience with satellite systems

Experience in modeling and simulation

Experience analyzing and summarizing data with Microsoft Excel

Ability to generate and maintain technical documentation and reports

Desired Qualifications:

Object-Oriented Design and Analysis experience

Experience with orbital analysis tools such as Ansys Systems Toolkit (STK)

Prior experience with resilience mission fundamentals

Prior experience with sensor modeling

Experience with UML/SysML/UAF models

Experience working in an Agile development environment

Familiarity with IC and/or DoD

Security Requirements: TS/SCI with Poly

title: Mid Level Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Mid Level Systems Engineer

KBR is seeking a Systems Engineer to support our customer in Chantilly, VA. The position requires the employee to draft critical documents necessary to establish new contracts. The ideal candidate will have experience within the Intelligence Community with a high level of familiarity with standard systems engineering approaches and modeling techniques.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provide mission planning and requirements development using an interdisciplinary approach encompassing the entire technical effort to evolve and verify an integrated and total life-cycle balanced set of system, people, and process solutions that satisfy customer needs in support of system acquisitions including maritime, ground, air, and/or space-based acquisitions. 

Develop technical information to support the government program management decision-making process; assist Government PMs in managing and controlling the definition and management of the system configuration and the translation of the system definition into work breakdown structures. 

Develop CONOPS for technical collection operations and management. 

Overseeing contractor development of technical collection systems and software in accordance with system requirements.  

Demonstrated experience in mission planning and requirements development to evolve and verify an integrated and total lifecycle balanced set of system, people, and process solutions that satisfy customer needs. 

Demonstrated experience supporting system engineering and integrating functions for customer acquisitions including requirements development, acquisition documentation, test and evaluation, and system design reviews.

Experience developing programmatic, technical information to support the program management decision-making process.

Experience developing, managing, and controlling system configuration documents and work breakdown structures.

Demonstrated experience providing contractor support to government collection systems and software acquisitions.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in STEM-related discipline; Master’s Degree preferred

0 – 5 years experience

Demonstrated ability to serve as the integrating mechanism across the technical efforts related to the development, manufacturing, verification, deployment, operations, support, disposal of, and user training for systems and their life cycle processes

Experience working with the community to prioritize, rank and task technical collection

Experience in processing and exploiting technical intelligence and the production of intelligence products for dissemination to the community

Experience in Source Selections

Experience in the oversight of program cost, schedule, and performance

Travel:  CONUS and OCONUS travel may be required.   
 
Security Requirements:  Active TS-SCI/w Poly security clearance required

E3D Piping Design Administrator

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for an E3D Piping Design Administrator to work with one of the largest EPC firms in the country.

title: Technical Writer II *Temporary*
description:
Title:

Technical Writer II *Temporary*

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of Defense, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

Looking for a role where your contributions are valued, and your potential is unleashed? Join us at KBR as a Technical Writer, where you’ll play a key role in supporting the Army LCU Watercraft Project. In this position, you will collaborate closely with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to validate, refine, and capture technical content for the Army’s new Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) components.

You’ll lead the development of accurate, high‑quality documentation within a timeline‑driven project environment—ensuring updates are precise and, when needed, validated through hands‑on review. Your work will have a direct impact on delivering reliable, mission‑critical technical materials that support the Army’s watercraft modernization efforts, shaping the trajectory of our project team and the broader organization.

We're seeking a team player who thrives in a collaborative, detail‑focused environment where excellence is the standard. If you're ready to take on new challenges and be part of something extraordinary, apply now and let’s build a brighter future together!

Roles and Responsibilities:

Prepares technical documentation in eXtensible Markup Language (XML) written to Military Specification such as MIL-STD-40051 and MIL-STD-38784; coordinate layout and organization of documentation.
Reads engineering drawings, blueprints, wiring diagrams and schematics.
Coordinates graphic development to prepare technical publication graphics and illustrated parts breakdown/exploded view diagrams for submission.
Gathers and researches technical information, including engineering and development information, for use in documentation activities.
Interacts with SMEs, Graphic Artists, and Logisticians as part of a courseware production team.
Reviews, edits, and proofreads materials written by others, provides suggested revision.
Exercises safe, mature, discretionary handling of Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) materials, sensitive materials (documents and equipment), and any GFI for training.
Prepares various types of technical documentation for watercraft systems which provide technical guidance for the operation, evaluation, maintenance, and repair parts support.
Minimum travel may be required.  

​This is a TEMPORARY POSITION until September of 2026, with the possibility of being permanent

 

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree in English, Journalism, or a related field
Minimum two years of related experience. 10 years of related experience as described in the job description will be accepted in lieu of a degree.
Experience with editing eXtensible Markup Language (XML) and/or Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML)
Experience preparing technical documentation written to Military Specification such as MIL-STD-40051 and MIL-STD-38784 and coordinating layout and organization of documentation
Candidates must be a U.S. Citizen and be able to obtain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Security Clearance

 

Preferred Qualifications:

Ability to research, develop, and/or update content for printed manuals, Contract Data Requirements Lists (CDRLs), I-types, and Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) documents, illustrations, and parts breakdown manuals using software such as Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Acrobat Pro, Arbortext Editor, and/or Oxygen XML Editor and EMS-NG.
Experience with U.S. Army developed Interactive Authoring and Display System (IADS)

title: Electrical Engineer Intern - Summer 2026
description:
Title:

Electrical Engineer Intern - Summer 2026

Program Summary

KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. Our Las Cruces, NM office is an engineering and manufacturing facility that provides solutions for our customers with safety and quality at the forefront of our operations.

Why Join KBR?

· Mentorship from senior engineers

· Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges

· Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment

· Competitive pay and great company culture

Job Summary

KBR is seeking an Electrical Engineer Intern to join our team at our Las Cruces, NM office for the Summer 2026, June thru August. The selected candidate will operate under the direct supervision of a senior engineer and support projects around ground-based mobile satellite communication systems, antenna manufacturing, and radio frequency engineering. The Electrical Engineer Intern will receive direct mentorship in being able to research, develop, plan, design, and integrate electrical products and systems. This position will apply principles and techniques of electrical engineering to support engineering staff on projects and solve engineering problems in all phases of design, development, integration/implementation, analysis, and testing.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Assist in research, design, modify, develop and evaluate systems, products, components, and applications by applying fundamental electrical engineering principles

· Apply electrical engineering principles in areas of RF, power, AC/DC circuit, communications, and software

· Validate vendor equipment performance and capabilities by developing testing methods, performing tests, and documenting test results

· Support senior engineers with final system performance through execution of test procedures and data analysis

· Troubleshoot and resolve systems for satellite/radio frequency communications and power distribution

· May perform site surveys and field installations with project teams

· Communicate and collaborate with other engineering disciplines, manufacturing personnel, management, vendors, customers, and subcontractors.

· Support engineering documentation, i.e., drawings, project specifications, procedures, test data and results

· Abide by company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks

· Must hold a valid driver’s license and have the ability to obtain a US DOD security clearance

Basic Qualifications

· Must be a U.S. citizen with valid documentation

· Must be currently enrolled at an ABET accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s of Science in Electrical Engineering

Preferred Qualifications

· Basic knowledge of RF systems

· Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.00

· Able to work up to 40 hours per week during the internship program

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Our Las Cruces, NM office is an engineering and manufacturing facility that provides solutions for our customers with safety and quality at the forefront of our operations.

Why Join KBR?

· Mentorship from senior engineers

· Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges

· Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment

· Competitive pay and great company culture

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a Mechanical Engineering Intern to join our team at our office in Las Cruces, NM for the Summer 2026, June thru August. The selected candidate may support multiple projects from a mechanical engineering standpoint in an RF communications industry. This internship will provide experience working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment amongst professionals within an engineering and manufacturing facility. Under the supervision and mentorship of a senior engineer, this intern will be introduced but not limited to processes, procedures, and tools to efficiently perform analysis on stress, strain, thermal management, hardware integration, component selection, and engineering documentation.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Assist in research, design, modify, develop and evaluate systems, products, components, and applications by applying fundamental mechanical engineering principles

· Validate vendor equipment performance and capabilities by developing testing methods, performing tests, and documenting test results

· Support senior engineers with final system performance through execution of test procedures and data analysis

· Research and identify mechanical parts, components, and materials

· Manage data, including test results, Bills-of-Material, quotations, drawings, technical data sheets, etc.

· Perform hardware assembly and equipment installations

· May perform site surveys and field installations with project teams

· Communicate and collaborate with other engineering disciplines, manufacturing personnel, management, vendors, customers, and subcontractors.

· Support engineering documentation, i.e., drawings, project specifications, procedures, test data and results

· Abide by company policies and procedures to complete assigned tasks

· Must hold a valid driver’s license and have the ability to obtain a US DOD security clearance

Basic Qualifications

· Must be a U.S. citizen with valid documentation

· Must be currently enrolled at an ABET accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s of Science in Mechanical Engineering

Preferred Qualifications

· Basic experience using Computer Aided Drafting (CAD) software

· Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.00

· Able to work up to 40 hours per week during the internship program

title: Special Operations Physical Therapist (5th SFG(A), Ft. Campbell, KY)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Physical Therapist (5th SFG(A), Ft. Campbell, KY)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION. 

 

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

 

We are seeking a stellar Special Operations Physical Therapist who will provide evaluation, treatment, and rehabilitation of musculoskeletal conditions. They are licensed independent practitioners and credentialed as direct care providers in specific military HP settings. At KBR we maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts – Could this be you? 

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Evaluate and treat patients with or without referrals.  

Refer patients to other POTFF staff members as needed.  

Provide and perform the following services in support of POTFF’s HP program for SOF personnel, with the priority on SOF Operators and Direct Combat Support personnel: Provide neuro-musculoskeletal injury care, utilizing approved supplemental clinical privileges including the ordering of images, laboratory tests, pharmaceuticals, dry needling, acupuncture, joint injections and aspirations, and referrals to specialty providers. 

If directed by HP Program Manager and/or Coordinator, directly supervise the PT Tech, PT Assistant, and/or Certified Athletic Trainer (ATC) within their scope of practice.  

Participate in periodic meetings with HP and POTFF for reasons such as, but not limited to, reviewing care provided to patients. Identify opportunities for improvement.  

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in matters related to Sports Medicine (SM), injury prevention, rehabilitation, and relevant human performance research. 

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator for administrative matters, purchasing of supplies and equipment, and supplemental fiscal requests.  

Conduct equipment, product, and literature reviews to ensure the HP program stays current with the provision of care.  

Provide input for the development and utilization of required databases.  

Conduct peer (record) reviews for the HP Staff as directed by governing credentialing body and local medical oversight process. 

Assists the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and updating criteria-based job descriptions and performance standards.  

Assist the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and maintaining clinical practice guidelines to ensure consistency of care across all HP Training Centers (HPTCs) and associated facilities.  

Assist with the preparation of short and long-term fiscal plans; submits input to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator.  

Attend and participate in meetings with other POTFF staff members and medical providers as requested and/or required.  

Ensure safe and effective operation of equipment used for patient care and contribute to a safe working environment. 

Participate in periodic in-service training for members of the HP staff or POTFF staff as appropriate. 

Attend required training in accordance with guiding instructions. Commands will allow for attendance at necessary conferences and/or courses to complete continuing education units required to maintain certification. 

Maintain 100% compliance with local mandatory command training requirements. 

Document care in the Military’s Electronic Health Record ) i.e., AHLTA, GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.) as required per DODI 6040.45, USSOCOM HQ and POTFF Staff, and as directed by local HP program manager and/or coordinator. 

Document work performed, utilization, encounters, referrals, and all other information in the Military’s Electronic Health Record (i.e., AHLTA, MHS GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.), as directed by HP program manager and/or coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Perform other tasks, within the scope of the PT position description, as assigned by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Collect and report all data as requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Proficiently utilize computers, software, and technologies as required and requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

 

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

This position requires U.S. Citizenship. 

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

Master’s degree in Physical Therapy. 

Certification through the American Board of Physical Therapy Specialties (ABPTS) as either an OCS or SCS, or certification through the National Athletic Trainers Association (NATA) as a certified athletic trainer (ATC).  

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at the local MTF.  

Capable of meeting physical demands of training with SOF including the ability to hike over rough terrain, function in austere environments, and observe SOF training evolutions.  

May be required to assist with strength and conditioning testing and training protocols and lift and manipulate loads or weights up to 25 kilograms. 

Minimum of five (5) years or more of demonstrable, accumulated experience (continuous and sustained experience preferred) of performing manual therapy in the sports medicine field with individual athletes and groups of athletes (experience at the levels of NCAA Division I, Olympic, professional, and/or SOF Operators preferred) in the accompanying, respective settings.  

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English. 

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation. 

 

 

Desired Education, Experience, Skills or Training:  

Doctoral degree in Physical Therapy.  

Prior military and/or SOF experience.  

Additional credentials such as a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) through the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA).  

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

Responsible for completing all required training.  

Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

  

  

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. 

 

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Subcontract Administrator
description:
Title:

Subcontract Administrator

Are you passionate about producing high quality work with integrity? Join our team as a Subcontracts Administrator and deliver results for our corporate Supply Chain group! As an integral part of our organization, you'll play a crucial role in ensuring the execution of a full range of procurement and administration activities associated with subcontracting work. Your contributions will ensure that our services exceed all expectations. As a Subcontracts Administrator, you'll find yourself collaborating with a passionate team who shares your dedication to excellence. If you're seeking to immerse yourself in an environment where your skills and expertise will make a genuine impact, we invite you to join our team! 

This will be a hybrid role split between 2 days in the office and 2-3 days working remote. 

Some of your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

Qualifying subcontractors
Issuing requests for information (RFIs)
Issuing requests for proposals (RFPs)
Preparing subcontract documents and amendments, including identification and inclusion of flow down requirements from the prime contract
Performing commercial evaluations of proposals
Negotiating subcontracts
Issuing properly authorized awards/subcontracts
Resolving subcontractor claims in a timely manner
Handling cradle to grave subcontract management (pre-award to file closeout)
Serving as liaison between subcontractor and project manager

We are seeking someone with a keen eye for detail, excellent time management/prioritization, and a strong customer service focus. You should be a person who thrives in a diverse environment and who is comfortable communicating at all levels of an organization, verbally and in writing. To be successful in this role, you should have a sense of genuine, engaging curiosity, and a desire for continuous learning along with superior problem solving and analytical skills. 
 

**This position will be located in the Chennai, India area. Relocation is not provided. 

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree and at least one (2) years of directly related subcontracts experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered
Federal Government contracts/subcontracts experience.
Proficiency with MS office applications (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint)

Preferred Qualifications:

Two (2)+ years of experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelors degree preferred in Supply Chain Management, Business Management, or closely related fields
Experience with Deltek (CostPoint)
Experience with commercial and/or defense contracts/subcontracts highly desired

title: Senior Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Systems Engineer

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

About Us

At KBR, we deliver science, technology, and engineering solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions. Our team at the USGS Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center supports the Landsat program and other remote sensing initiatives that impact global environmental monitoring and research. We value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence in everything we do.

Why You'll Love This Role

As a Senior Systems Engineer, you will lead architecture decisions, mentor engineers, and ensure mission-critical systems meet stringent reliability and security standards. Your work will shape the future of Earth observation technologies and have global impact.

Responsibilities
Lead design, development, and maintenance of scientific/engineering software systems, ensuring quality and compliance while meeting scope, schedule, and budget contstraints
Define and document system requirements, operational concepts, and integration/test plans
Analyze customer requirements and translate them into design specifications; create prototypes and validate solutions
Develop and execute test plans; perform integration, system, and acceptance testing
Create and manage project schedules to ensure timely delivery of system components and milestones
Evaluate vendor software and recommend adoption or integration
Conduct studies to enhance efficiency, reduce cost, and meet evolving requirements
Plan and coordinate work of engineers; mentor and train team members
Serve as organizational consultant and lead cross-functional teams
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or related field
14 years of progressive, related experience in systems engineering or software development for scientific/engineering applications
Proven ability to lead complex system design and integration efforts
Strong understanding of Software Design Life Cycle, configuration management, and quality assurance principles
Desired Skills
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
AWS Solutions Architect or similar certification
Experience with hybrid-cloud architectures and containerization
Knowledge of image processing, database management, and software development
Proficiency with tools such as DOORS, Jira, and Confluence
Ability to conduct trade studies for technology upgrades, cloud services, and software updates

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential
The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hiring to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account

Experience and/or Education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability to meet these requirements.

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

title: Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (27th SOW / Cannon AFB, NM) Sign-On Bonus Eligible
description:
Title:

Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (27th SOW / Cannon AFB, NM) Sign-On Bonus Eligible

Sign-on bonus of up to $10K may be available to qualified, selected candidates (eligibility requirements may apply). Current KBR employees are not eligible to receive sign-on bonuses.

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services.

We are looking for a Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker to join the team who is responsible for integrating the physical, mental and psychological wellness of our service members and their families for the Preservation of the Force and Family (POTFF) contract to optimize and sustain Special Operations Forces (SOF) mission readiness, longevity, and performance through integrated and holistic human performance programs designed to strengthen the Force and Family.

Core Tenets include:

POTFF is Performance and Readiness Focused.

POTFF utilizes Embedded and Specialized Professionals.

POTFF is composed of Multi-Domain Cross Functional Teams.

POTFF is a Proactive and Holistic Approach.

POTFF is Evidence-Based.

POTFF provides Centralized Oversight and Decentralized Execution.

At KBR we maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for Special Operations service members and their families – Could this be you?

This Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker will function within an operational unit, as a Behavioral Health Care Provider and is responsible for the application of social work procedures and techniques, including interviewing, behavioral assessment, and evidenced-based therapies, in the evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of psychological and neuropsychological disorders using the following skills: individual, family and group psychotherapy, couple's therapy, alcohol and drug treatment evaluations.

Responsibilities:

• Engage all quality improvement and staff meetings, conferences

• Conduct applied research and clinical investigations in clinical/behavioral health/organizational social work.

• Consult with medical personnel, legal authorities, military commanders and school districts as required.

• Maintain accurate medical records of all patients seen and produces reports of evaluation and/or treatment.

• Participate in military specific training.  This position may include clinical supervision of unlicensed providers or trainees.

• May be required to perform some, or all, of the following activities: Participates in and successfully completes required DoD or service required training; Contact referred patients to assess treatment adherence; Use validated symptom inventories to assess current symptom severity; Assess barriers to treatment adherence and help patient problem-solve solutions to barriers; Provide patients with education regarding their mental health condition and treatment regimen; maintain patient information in a patient registry; maintain accurate and current notes in the electronic medical records of all patients contacted for review by the managing physician; Routinely staffs difficult cases with the referring provider, behavioral health consultant and/or psychiatry consultant; and Performs case management functions.

Required Education/Experience:

Position requires U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status.

Must have a Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain Secret Clearance.

Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) or equivalent (MSSW, MSSA) degree from a graduate school of social work fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

Maintain a current, unrestricted clinical license to independently practice social work in any one of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at a local MTF.

A minimum of two (2) years peer-reviewable clinical social work experience in a mental health setting

Demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics regarding the delivery of clinical social work services.

Experience in brief behavioral interventions.

May be required to receive and maintain clinical practice privileges.

Required Skills/Training:

• Fluent oral and written communication skills in English.

• Prior military and/or SOF experience.

• Experience working in a Government setting such a DOD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.

• Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.

• Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.

• Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.

• Responsible for completing all required training.

• Perform other assignments and duties, as required.

Basic Compensation:

$73,300 to $114,400

This range is for Cannon AFB, NM

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

locations

description:
Title:

Program Director

Job Title:                            Program Director
Company:                           KBR - Abu Dhabi
Location:                            Abu Dhabi
Experience Required:     20+ years

Employment Type:           Full-time, Contract

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Purpose

The Program Director will oversee the entire programme of projects, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, progress and coordination of resources and ownership over preparation of monthly/quarterly/annual progress report. This is a PMC role, and the PD will be responsible for overseeing and execution of engineering management, procurement, and delivery for large-scale power and water transmission projects in Abu Dhabi. There will be multiple Supervision Consultants and EPC`s appointed directly by the Client. This role involves strategic planning, resource management, and collaboration with numerous stakeholders to meet project objectives, timelines, and budget constraints.

Job Responsibilities

Lead and manage the overall planning, execution, and delivery of the Project.
Coordinate with project stakeholders, including clients, supervision consultants, contractors, vendors and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment and compliance with project specifications and regulations.
Oversee the development and implementation of project plans, schedules, and budgets.
Provide leadership and direction to project teams, fostering a culture of safety, quality, and continuous improvement.
Monitor project progress and performance, implementing corrective actions as necessary to address any deviations from the project plan.
Prepare and present regular project reports to senior management and the client`s executive leadership teams detailing progress, challenges and solutions, commercial status, risks etc.
Ensure effective risk management strategies are in place to mitigate potential project risks and issues.
Collaborate with the technical team to ensure constructability and compliance with industry standards.
Guide and mentor project team members, promoting professional development and knowledge sharing.
Foster strong relationships with clients and other stakeholders to maintain project support and mitigate any concerns.

Qualifications

Master’s degree preferred or Bachelor’s degree in related field.
20+ years of experience in projects, specifically in large power and water distribution programmes.
Proven PMC experience in a similar role on programmes.

Technical Skills

In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Strong understanding of electrical and mechanical engineering principles and UAE regulatory requirements for power and water transmission.
Proficiency in project scheduling and resource management.

Soft Skills

Exceptional leadership and team management abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities effectively.
A proactive approach to risk management and conflict resolution.
Arabic speaker preferred

title: Production Chemist
description:
Title:

Production Chemist

Production Chemist

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Responsibilities:
A member of the Production Chemistry team reporting to the Production Chemist Team Lead.
The position is based in the Contractor Camp, with daily site visits to support field operations teams in South Rumaila.
The role will support production chemistry related activities in South Rumaila degassing stations and associated facilities.
The role will include trouble shooting at the degassing stations and working with various teams to ensure crude quality, gas export quality, PW quality and laboratory analysis.
Input into produced water clarification, corrosion, and scale impacts and treatments is required.
Review and support to laboratory analysis in various water analysis locations, so experience in water lab chemistry is essential.
Running, monitoring, and optimisation of laboratory tests and field trials.
Data analysis and interpretation on trials and operational data.
Quality Control inspections of chemicals from suppliers.
Equivalent to degree qualification in Chemistry or related discipline from a relevant internationally recognised institution.
Individual must be qualified in oil and gas separation, flow assurance, corrosion mitigation, foam suppression, biological controls and monitoring, PW treatment, as well as related laboratory analysis and management.
As a member of ROO Operations, the role is expected to embrace and adopt the ROO Code of Conduct (CoC), safety leadership principles and uphold the values of ROO. 
Strong communications skills in English language are required.

Key Responsibilities:

Safe and Efficient Operations
Daily site support to South Rumaila Operations Teams
Input to Operations meetings – daily and ad-hoc
Input to Production Chemistry Threats
Input to Sampling Program
Input into Crude Quality Plan
Coaching / mentoring Crude Quality Team
Support the Production Chemistry Team to resolve plant technical issues, process improvements, operability improvements and troubleshooting

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field
10 + years of relevant field experience with an average of 15 years with a minimum of 5 years of experience with same type of position.

description:
Title:

Project Manager – Landscape

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Project Manager – Landscape

LOCATION

Abu Dhabi, UAE

PROJECT DESCRIPTION

KBR has been appointed under a framework agreement with the largest developer in Abu Dhabi to oversee a diverse portfolio of projects that contribute to Abu Dhabi's growth.  This includes developing essential infrastructure such as transportation networks and utilities, alongside public spaces and involving also the shaping of thriving communities by managing the development of residential housing projects and ensuring the quality of new educational facilities, together with the development of mosques and maximizing urban space through infill development projects. This PMC role offers a unique opportunity to make a lasting impact on Abu Dhabi's built environment.

THE ROLE

Reports to the Project Director for ensuring delivery of 1 or more project sites.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Manage and oversee the execution of Landscaping construction contracts in alignment with Project objectives.
Maintain clear and consistent communication with all stakeholders, including Contractors, Consultants, and Client representatives.
Monitor and report on project progress against approved schedules and milestones.
Present progress reports, dashboards, and key updates to PMC management and the Client.
Coordinate with the assigned Engineer to ensure proper administration of the contract in compliance with the Contract Terms & Conditions.
Ensure quality standards are met in all aspects of the works, in accordance with project specifications and Client expectations.
Enforce highest standards of health and safety compliance as a priority through all stages of the project
Identify potential risks early and develop mitigation strategies.
Manage change processes effectively, ensuring proper documentation and approvals.
Provide input and analysis for contractor Extension of Time (EOT) claims.
Ensure familiarity with authority handover requirements and integrate them into project planning.
Ensure the Engineer is managing the permitting, NOCs, and material approval processes in compliance with local authority regulations.
Developing a high performing team that strives for quality, safety, cost, and schedule improvements at every opportunity with all delivery partners, challenging and seeking to improve the project deliverables.

EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
BSc, engineering, architecture or equivalent.
Minimum of 15 years overall experience
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
Minimum of 5 years working in Middle East
CLMI Required
Experience managing the facilities design, or the planning and coordination of capital projects that included the overall design, contract administration, cost estimating, and scheduling activities
Knowledge of operational aspects of civil infrastructure projects including roads, bridges, and utilities with experience in construction management
Excellent report writing and communication skills and User of MS Office
A high standard of spoken and written English, Arabic speaking advantageous

COMPETENCIES
Leadership
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Commercial awareness
Strong customer focus
Planning & organising
Accepts Responsibility
HSE Awareness

title: Graduate Project Controls
description:
Title:

Graduate Project Controls

The Opportunity 

 

We are seeking a Graduate Project Controller to support multi-disciplinary projects through effective cost management, budget analysis, and financial oversight. In this role, you will work closely with stakeholders to deliver accurate forecasting, transparent reporting, and strong governance compliance, ensuring projects remain on track and within budget. 

 

As a Graduate at KBR, you’ll kickstart your career with hands on experience across diverse real-world projects, supported by guidance and mentoring from experienced professionals. Our self-guided program empowers you to explore your interests, shape your development, and build strong technical skills through regular training. You’ll also connect with peers nationwide through our IMPACT Program, participating in social activities and industry events that help you grow your network and your career. 

 

Key Responsibilities: 

Provide cost and budget analysis across major projects 

Apply risk management and contingency planning 

Implement budget management frameworks and tools 

Monitor costs, variations, and milestones 

Support in the development of cost management tools. 

Ensure governance compliance 

Prepare cost reports and forecasts 

 
Who are you? 

 

We are seeking a detail oriented professional capable of contributing effectively to complex, multidisciplinary projects. This role is suited to a recent university graduate with a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or Finance related who is eager to develop a career in project controls. To be successful, you will demonstrate an interest in the application of AI and a proactive approach to improving processes. 

Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance or relevant field  

Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team 

Good written and verbal communication skills 

Demonstrate strong initiative 

Interest in application development 

 

About us 

 

KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions business works with customers across the nation to plan, design and deliver smarter, safer and more sustainable infrastructure to meet the demands of the future for all Australians. We’re a team of over 1300 who deliver engineering, science and technology solutions across the water, transport, energy, sustainability, resources and defence sectors. 

 

Please click the link below to learn more about Infrastructure Solutions Australia and the markets that we operate in. 

 

Contents - Who we are 

 

The perks 

Industry leading salaries, reviewed annually 

The opportunity to accrue an additional 8 hours of time off every 4 weeks 

Salary packaging and Novated leases 

Salary continuance (Income protection) 

Paid Professional Membership Fees 

Life/Health insurance discounts 

Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time) 

End of trip facilities 

Employee Stock Purchase Plans 

Paid parental leave 

Personal Career development plans 

Growth and promotion opportunities 

 

Our people are the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to creating work environments in which every member of our team of teams feels safe, supported, respected, trusted and valued, and where each person is given opportunities to belong, connect and grow.
