title: Process Engineer
description:
Title:

Process Engineer

Do you have 5+ years of experience as a Process Engineer in sectors like Water, Resources, or Defence?

Are you looking for an opportunity to broaden your expertise across diverse industries and exciting projects?

Position Overview:

Our team is expanding! With continued growth and exciting project wins, we are looking for a talented Senior Process Engineer to be part of our dynamic team in Adelaide.

In this role, you’ll take the lead on process engineering for diverse and impactful projects, from wastewater and potable water treatment to chemical dosing, odour control, venting, flaring, pumping systems, pipelines, and compression. You will collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team of mechanical, structural, hydraulic, civil, and electrical engineers to deliver innovative solutions for a wide range of clients.

If you are passionate about solving complex challenges and want to work on projects that make a real difference in water, environment, and resources sectors, we would love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities include:

Develop process engineering design and analysis for projects across water, defence and energy sectors.

Develop and implement process simulations and models to optimize plant performance and efficiency.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project objectives are met within specified timelines and budgets.

Conduct feasibility studies and risk assessments for proposed projects.

Provide technical expertise and guidance to junior engineers and project teams.

Ensure compliance with relevant Australian standards and regulations.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and cost optimization.

Skills & Experience Required:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Chemical Engineering or related field.

Proven experience in process engineering within water/defence projects.

Knowledge of Australian standards and regulations pertaining to process engineering.

Proficiency in process simulation software (e.g., Biowin, Aspen HYSYS, PHAST, etc.) is highly regarded.

Strong analytical skills and problem-solving abilities.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Current Baseline Clearance or the ability to obtain Defence clearance required.

About KBR:

KBR is renowned for working in partnership with our clients and construction partners to deliver exceptional outcomes based on our collaborative approach and our “One Team” value.

In Australia, KBR employ nearly 2000 people with offices in each state. Our project delivery track record, industry profile and strong relationships have enabled us to grow significantly, and we continue to expand.

Creating a superb culture is also huge for us and a key part of our success and growth. Genuine collaboration across the business is integral to how we work. As a company KBR have created an organisation where people matter, are valued, and cared about. By joining KBR you can be assured that you are joining a team that pulls in the same direction and shares common values.

In addition to working on some fantastic projects, KBR offer an array of benefits focused on providing our people with a great working environment, career development, flexible work arrangements and work/life balance.

KBR Values:

Our KBR Values - We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, We Are a Team of Teams - embody our people centric organisation.

Our culture, and our genuine focus on our people is a major factor in our success and we want you to be part of our journey. 

Curious about the exciting projects and what life is like at KBR Adelaide?

Check out our videos and see for yourself:

👉 YouTube👉 Vimeo

Shape tomorrow by applying today!

Follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: FMS Program Analyst
description:
Title:

FMS Program Analyst

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

This position will serve as Program Management Support to the International Program Managers of the HIMARS Quality Review Board (QRB) team as well as the primary Case Developer for the HIMARS Program. Contractor personnel is requested to fulfill this requirement due to the flexibility of job functions/description and approaching timeline desired to have this personnel in place to support the emerging requirements for multiple programs. Requirements are growing for the QRB Team and meeting development timelines is becoming increasingly more difficult. Additional support is needed as partner demand for support grows and the number of basic cases, modifications and amendments continues to grow as well. Time is the significant factor in ensuring continued success of the overall HIMARS program and maintaining our great relationship with the foreign partner.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Program Management Support will be expected to assist the International Program Managers with tasking through DSAMS, IMPART, and TMT.
Senior Program Management Support will be expected to be an expert in FMS Case execution and development.
Program Management Support will also be required to initiate and respond to programmatic correspondence through emails and official memorandums.
Person will be required to support training IPTs and other events in support of on the job training.
Travel (CONUS and OCONUS) may be required (25%).

Basic Requirements

Bachelor's Degree with 2+ years of experience
Candidate must have an active secret clearance or be eligible to obtain and maintain one.

Program Manager, Workforce Planning

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. Looking for a role where your contributions are valued, and your potential is unleashed? Join us at the Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems Division as the Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD) Operating Unit (OU) Program Manager, Workforce & Budget Planning, where you'll lead a team of analysts providing workforce planning for over 400 employees, shaping the trajectory of our division. We're seeking a team player who thrives in a collaborative environment, where excellence is the standard. If you're ready to take on new challenges and be part of something extraordinary, apply now and let's build a brighter future together!

Manage a team of analysts to provide workforce and budget planning for the Integrated Air and Missile Defense Operating Unit supporting over 400 employees across more than 20 projects.

Manage changes and updates to the contract rough order of magnitude (ROM) estimating model.

Manage structure cost budgeting, reporting, and analysis processes.

title: Metrology Technician II
description:
Title:

Metrology Technician II

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

 The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Metrology Technician is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards and taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests. Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  Calibration of metrology lab standards as required.  The position requires fluency in calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up test equipment calibration systems.  Metrology Technician may be required to provide assistance to entry level technicians as they learn new measurement procedures and processes. This role will report to the lead technician and lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of electronic measuring and test equipment according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).
Calibrate and repair equipment such as Multimeters, frequency counter, timers, oscilloscopes, power supplies, electronic loads, and Thermo-hygrometers.
Calibrate standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.
Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.
Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.
Complete all other duties as assigned.
Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with 3+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 3 years of experience.
Working knowledge of one or more of the following voltage, current, resistance, capacitance, time and frequency, signal conditioning, etc.
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal systems.
Familiarity with laboratory measurement and calibration equipment.
Experience in calibration of mass and weights, and/or the use of mass comparators.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

description:
Title:

Operations and Maintenance Manager

O&M Manager (Operations & Maintenance) 

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

You’re an experienced and results-driven Operations & Maintenance Manager with a proven track record in managing the daily operations, maintenance, and repair of complex systems and facilities. With a deep understanding of mechanical, electrical, and operational systems, you excel at leading teams to ensure optimal performance, safety, and compliance. Your strong leadership, problem-solving skills, and ability to manage multiple projects make you a key driver of operational efficiency and success.

At KBR, you bring expertise in operations management, a commitment to safety and quality, and the ability to lead cross-functional teams. Known for your ability to implement effective maintenance schedules, troubleshoot system issues, and ensure regulatory compliance, you play a vital role in maintaining operational continuity and excellence. Your dedication to continuous improvement and operational effectiveness aligns with KBR’s mission of delivering innovative and reliable solutions to support critical missions.

What You WILL DO

In the role of Operations & Maintenance Manager, your duties will include:

Directs work groups and/or units engaged in activities associated with the planning, construction, maintenance, operation, repair, renovation, alteration, and demolition of buildings, structures, equipment, machinery, and other facilities.
Obtains, evaluates and negotiate bids from outside engineering, architectural, and construction firms.
Establishes schedules and budgetary controls, allocates expenditures, and oversees the coordination of major construction activities requiring integration with engineering, architectural, contracts and government agencies.
Ensures compliance with contract specifications, insurance requirements, and local building codes.
Reviews and approves architectural /engineering drawings.
Participates in the department strategic planning process and ensures appropriate skills are available when needed.
Develops and maintains relationships with other engineering organizations to keep abreast of developments in allied fields.
Interprets, executes and recommends modifications to organizational policies and corporate initiatives.
Establishes and maintains quality systems and instills values and ethics.
Manages the O&M Technicians onsite

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a SECRET clearance with the ability to upgrade to a TS/SCI w/ Poly
Five (5)+ years of work experience in a leadership role supporting global life support services or similar laborers.
High School, Vocational or Trade school Diploma
Experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS).
Experience executing Preventative Maintenance (PM) plans
Experience in prioritized schedules for OM&R and PM programs
Experience in measuring work performance against established goals and standards.
Basic computer skills (MS Word, MS Excel, etc.)

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS
REQUIREMENTS:
Must possess a SECRET clearance with the ability to upgrade to a TS/SCI w/ Poly
Five (5)+ years of work experience in a leadership role supporting global life support services or similar laborers.
High School, Vocational or Trade school Diploma

title: Security Controls Assessor (SCA) Representative
description:
Title:

Security Controls Assessor (SCA) Representative

KBR is seeking a Security Controls Assessor (SCA) Representative in Colorado Springs, CO area. The individual will directly support the United States Space Force (USSF) Risk Management Framework, Cybersecurity Framework (RMF, CSF) compliance activities to ensure security controls are defined, implemented, and assessed for complex multi-level security architectures of advanced aerospace systems.

Key Responsibilities:

Conducts independent comprehensive assessments of the management, operational, and technical security controls, and control enhancements implementation within or inherited by an information technology (IT) system to determine the overall effectiveness of the controls (as defined in NIST SP 800-37).
Applies RMF/CSF principles to the development of integrated weapon systems.
Conducts assessment and authorization (A&A) events to support recommendations to the USSF Special Access Program/Special Access Required (SAP/SAR) Authorizing Official (USSF SAP AO) based on requirements, security impact levels and projected/current operational environment.
Develops Security Assessment Report to support Authorization to Operate decisions.
Full-time job with frequent US travel required.

Qualifications:

Required:

An active TS/SCI and eligible for SAP/SAR, which is something only a U.S. citizen can obtain.
Prior experience as a SAP SCA or SAP SCA Representative.
Ability to travel 20%-50%.
5 years of Linux experience in implementation/principles/administration.
Strong knowledge of RMF/CSF process activities and related documentation (e.g., life-cycle support plans, concept of operations, and operational procedures) to confirm the level of risk is within acceptable limits.
Demonstrated ability perform cybersecurity assessments, identify gaps in cybersecurity architecture, and develop a security risk management plan that articulates risk to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to ensure Body of Evidence (BoE) artifacts such as plans of actions and milestones and cybersecurity plans are in place for vulnerabilities/deficiencies identified during risk assessments, audits, inspections, etc.
Demonstrated history finding unique mitigations to varied systems’ cybersecurity challenges to assess the effectiveness of security controls.
Demonstrated technical proficiency in at least two of the following areas of security: communications, networks, embedded systems, software, system testing or assessment, etc.
Strong written and oral communication skills to support necessary compliance activities (e.g., ensure that system security configuration guidelines are followed, compliance monitoring occurs).
Ability to verify software/network/system security postures are implemented within a DevSecOps process, agile methodology and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to ensure cybersecurity requirements are included in early during development.
Demonstrated ability to develop methods to develop methods to monitor and measure risk, compliance, and information assurance efforts.
Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP).

Desired Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or other Technology related fields is desired. Prior law enforcement, counterintelligence or cyber operation experience is highly desired.
Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP).
Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH).
AWS or other cloud technology security certification.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Up to 20-50%
Working Hours: Standard

Basic Compensation:

$160,000 - $180,000

This range is for Colorado only.

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

title: PSAB ESS: Project Mechanical Engineer (Secret Clearance)
location:
locations
Al-Kharj, Saudi Arabia
San Antonio, Texas
Houston, Texas
Florida
Washington, DC
description:
Title:

PSAB ESS: Project Mechanical Engineer (Secret Clearance)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.

Our people make the world a more productive, efficient and fascinating place. And that's only the beginning.

The Prince Sultan Air Base (PSAB) Project Mechanical Engineer (ME) shall provide architectural and engineering services that support project, work order, and work request operations. 

These functions are to ensure the delivery of BASE OPERATING SUPPORT-INSTALLATION (BOS-I) services to the 378 Air Expeditionary Wing (AEW), mission partners, and tenant units, including transient, temporary duty (TDY), permanent party, and rotational personnel as well as five (5) remote Army sites at PSAB, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA).

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Knowledge and Familiarity with War Reserve Material (WRM) assets

Efforts include planning for repair and maintenance, designing, providing technical support, and updating record drawings.

Provide effective Electrical Engineering support to ensure projects are designed and completed to support mission requirement based on guidance from 378 Engineering Flight Chief.

Develop and administer Activity/Asset Management Plans (AMP) that translates Air Force and installation objectives into asset-related decisions by understanding assets’ physical attributes, condition, usage, and performance as well as the realized and potential value to the mission.  These plans should balance risk, current and future objectives, resource limitations, and lifecycle management.

As required, be available within two (2) hours of notification to meet on the installation with Government personnel.

Design and develop designs along with scope of work in support of various projects on PSAB.

Provide frequent updates to the 378 Engineering Flight Chief along with briefings upcoming projects prior to sending to 378 ECONS for solicitation.

Ensure compliance with all US laws, Saudi Labor Law, US EPA Guidelines, Final Governing Standards (FGS), Overseas Environmental Baseline Guidance Document (OEBGD), US Building Codes, Department of Defense (DoD) Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC), National Electric Code (NEC), National Electric Safety Code (NESC), Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards, National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) and Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineering (IEEE) standards.  In addition, ensure site activities  comply with applicable US, DoD, and Host Country codes and standards to include American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air-Conditioning Engineers (ASHRAE), International Plumbing Code (IPC), National Plumbing Code (NPC), Building & Fire codes concerning health, safety, and the environment in the design and construction of real property facilities at all times.

Performs other duties as assigned.

MATERIAL & EQUIPMENT DIRECTLY USED: 

May be exposed to potentially hazardous conditions that require wear of hard hats, gloves, steel toed boots, hearing protection, safety glasses and other personal protection equipment (PPE); may be required to push, pull and lift heavy equipment.

Use of Land Mobile Radios, cell phones, laptop, and other devices to maintain contact and accountability of work activities.

WORKING ENVIRONMENT:

Work will be indoors and outdoors.

Exposure to heat, cold, dust, noise, chemicals may occur.

Overtime and shift work may be required depending on contractual needs as well as occasional to frequent travel.

Employee must comply with all Federal, State and Local regulations and published Company work rules as well as written instructions.

Task specific work environment training maybe provided.

Must be prepared to function in a wartime or contingency environment to support U.S. interests.

PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES:

Physical requirements include lifting up to 35lb, team lifting up to 50lbs, climbing, extended sitting, or standing, stooping, stretching, and bending.

Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots as well as Individual Protective Equipment (IPE) which may include but not limited to Level III plus/IV Individual Body Armor with both front and back ballistic plates, ACH helmet, clothing (undergarments, shirts and pants and/or coveralls), reflective vests/belts, sound suppression devices, etc.

Day-to-day physical requirements may involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs. frequently, etc.

Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking up stairs

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Specific contract requirements regarding education and experience will prevail.

Education/Certifications:

Bachelor’s Degree Mechanical Engineering with a minimum 4 years relevant experience on similar projects.

Must be a U.S. Citizen with a current U. S. Driver's License.

Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 13 months of remaining validity AND 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining

Must have and maintain a valid U. S. SECRET Security Clearance

Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English fluently

Candidate must also meet CENTCOM MOD-15 theater requirements.

Skills:

Project management, pro-active, well organized, results-oriented, and team player with decision-making ability.

Use computers & related software such as Microsoft Office and other common products used in office environments or within the Engineering and Construction Industry.

Able and willing to work periods of long hours to meet mission requirements.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with documented supervisory experience.

Experience in contingency environments as well as knowledge & experience working with government contracts.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Paralegal, Litigation & Employment
description:
Title:

Senior Paralegal, Litigation & Employment

KBR — Delivering Solutions, Changing the World. 

KBR brings together the best and brightest to deliver science, technology and engineering solutions that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

In everything we do, we are guided by our ONE KBR Values:

We Value Our People – We create diverse, inclusive environments in which each person can feel safe, respected and valued, and where everyone has opportunities to grow and reach their full potential.

We Deliver – We are uncompromising in our commitment to deliver innovative, high-quality, technology-led solutions for our customers and exceptional, sustainable value for all our stakeholders.

We Are People of Integrity – We value honesty, trust, courage, fairness, prudence and tenacity. We believe doing what’s right for the planet, the communities where we work, and our people is good for business.

We Empower – We empower our people with a shared purpose, the right tools and the supportive culture they need to be proactive decision-makers, to be adaptive to change, and to succeed.

We Are a Team of Teams – We have a will to succeed, but we value the achievements of our team of teams over individual accomplishments. Our collective focus makes us a better, stronger, more effective company.

We have also embedded environmental, social and governance (ESG) principles in every business operation and corporate function. Not only are we committed to operating safely, sustainably and equitably, but we are also committed to using our capabilities and expertise to help our customers accomplish their sustainability goals. Worldwide, KBR employs a diverse workforce approximately 29,000 people strong, with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in 40 countries. At KBR, We Deliver.

KBR is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Paralegal to join our in-house legal team.  This role will provide advanced legal support for the Litigation and Labor & Employment teams. This role involves managing complex case workflows, coordinating with internal stakeholders and outside counsel, and ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. The position requires deep expertise in litigation processes, employment law, and strong organizational and communication skills.

KBR is a global leader in delivering technology-driven, mission-critical, and sustainable solutions that truly matter. For over a century, we have powered bold missions across defense, space, industry, and government through our two core business lines Mission Technology Solutions and Sustainable Technology Solutions. With nearly 38,000 talented people operating in more than 80 countries, we thrive on a culture built on safety, integrity, and teamwork. At KBR, we empower our people to solve the world’s toughest challenges and create lasting value for communities and the planet. We don’t just deliver results, we deliver game-changing solutions, innovative technology, deep domain expertise, and cutting-edge technologies.

Responsibilities

Duties and responsibilities may include are but not limited to the following:

Legal Hold Management & Discovery Support

Draft legal holds and administer them through Mitratech Legal Hold system

Conduct custodian interviews and assist with document collection

Draft, review and finalize discovery responses, subpoenas, privilege logs and document productions

Support other discovery efforts as needed including eDiscovery

Matter Management & Support

Utilize Mitratech TeamConnect matter management system and SharePoint to maintain case files

Draft and review pleadings, motions and legal correspondence

Support attorneys in handling employment disputes, investigations, compliance matters

Assist with responses to EEOC charges, state agency complaints, and related filings

Liaise with HR and compliance teams on employment-related requests

Perform in-depth legal and factual research

Coordinate with outside counsel as necessary

Perform other legal support duties as assigned

Service of Process (SOP)

Provide backup support for SOPs as needed

Required Education, Experience & Skills

Bachelor’s degree required; JD or paralegal certification preferred

10+ years’ experience in litigation and labor & employment in a law firm and in-house environment 

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills including the ability to communicate and interact effectively at all levels and across all functions within an organization

Highly organized with ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines

Demonstrated expertise in legal research, discovery drafting, eDiscovery and trial preparation

Advanced proficiency with software such as (but not limited to)

Microsoft 365 – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint, etc.

LexisNexis

Relativity & Purview

PACER

Experience with matter management systems

Intellectually curious with a passion for process improvements and technology such as AI

Ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment and handle sensitive matters with discretion

Self-driven, operates with a sense of urgency, and resourcefulness

Ability to develop and maintain productive working relationships

Team player with excellent interpersonal skills

Location:

This role is based in Houston, TX OR the DC area and offers hybrid working arrangements.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

Click here to learn more:  KBR Benefits

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Mechanical Engineering Supervisor
description:
Title:

Mechanical Engineering Supervisor

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

KBR is seeking an experienced Aircraft Mechanical Engineering Supervisor to lead and manage a Mechanical Engineering team in designing changes to aircraft structural systems in the US Army, US Airforce, and other DoD customers’ existing aviation platforms. In this role, the Mechanical Engineering Supervisor will be responsible for providing cost and schedule estimates required to execute mechanical designs, as well as all Mechanical Technical Data Package documentation, required by each customer’s Statement of Work and desired schedule commitment scheduling employees’ tasks in support of Mechanical Engineering activities.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Manage a team of Mechanical Engineers to design and document modifications to existing models of US Army Rotorcraft to integrate new technologies and systems. The models include, but are not limited to, the HH/UH-60 Blackhawk (A, L, and M), and the CH-47 Chinook.
Work with other Engineers to Help guide the technical direction of the US Army Rotorcraft fleet by helping define mechanical and structural systems requirements
Develop mechanical designs in SolidWorks and/or AutoCAD to facilitate Maintenance Work Orders and installation instructions utilizing Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) standards to ensure fabricated parts are repeatable.
Perform mechanical analyses as required.
Evaluate supplier drawings for adherence to design standards and manufacturability.
Work with suppliers to correct any issues found.
Manage employees’ time charging based on allocated work authorization hours.
Work with Engineering Manager to establish a Basis of Estimate (BOE) and a Period of Performance (PoP) estimate for each project or program requiring Mechanical Engineering effort.
Provide manpower requirement projections to the Engineering Manager in support of assigned projects and programs.
Assign and manage the workload of Mechanical Engineers.

Basic Qualifications 

A bachelor’s degree in mechanical or aerospace engineering from an accredited program.
Minimum 2 years leading a team of Mechanical Design Engineers
Minimum 5 to 10 years’ experience with the following:
Mechanical design generation utilizing computer-aided design software such as Solid Works, AutoCAD, or Siemens NX
Configuration Management tools such as PDM, Enovia, Windchill, etc.
Aircraft Mechanical and Structural Design
Experience in creating and interpreting Bills of Materials (BOMs).
Proficient with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
Experience interfacing directly with US Government Customers in an Integrated Product Team (IPT) environment is a must.
Knowledge of GD&T practices and application is a plus.
Experience tracking tasks utilizing software such as JIRA, confluence, etc.
Understanding of Military, ASME, ASE Specifications as they relate to Mechanical Design
Experience managing Mechanical System Requirements.
Existing SECRET clearance or ability to obtain a SECRET clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Experience interfacing with Suppliers
US Army Aviation experience
Experience using PDM
Experience performing Thermodynamic, Stress, Fatigue, and Crash Loads analyses on DoD Aircraft platforms
Experience performing Weight and Balance analysis of airborne platforms
Experience in creating Modification Work Orders for Army Aviation aircraft
Experience creating or supporting Prototype Demonstration kits for DoD aircraft platforms

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. title: Performance Expert (R2PC) - Fort Stewart, Georgia
location:
locations
Fort Stewart-Hunter Army Airfield, Georgia
description:
Title:

Performance Expert (R2PC) - Fort Stewart, Georgia

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.  But we all share one goal:  to improve the world responsibly and safely.

This position is contingent upon a vacancy at this location.

KBR is seeking a Performance Expert to help strengthen the physical and psychological health, resilience and performance of Soldiers, Unit Leaders, Families, and DA Civilians located at Army Installations. The Resilience Training/Ready and Resilient Performance Center Program purpose is to provide specialists focused on optimizing mental and physical health and to provide and sustain the effort of existing Army training and education programs across Army installations. The work provides support for the purpose of increasing the physical and psychological health, resilience, and performance of Soldiers, Families, Department of the Defense personnel, United States (US) Government Agencies, and Allied Forces (ROTC) Cadets, and Department of the Army Civilians (DAC).

The Performance Expert will be responsible for: 

Master Resilience Trainers shall instruct individuals in holistic approaches to strength and conditioning and resilience so that they can help ensure durability. Certified Performance Experts conduct training intake/registration to include initial unit contact, observation, and development of training plan, provide all preparations for the training event to include conducting research, tailoring course material, producing all course material and distributing course material to all training attendees, and shall facilitate the training event, grade student course materials, and document student grades in required databases.
Performance Experts will assess training impact by distributing surveys at the close of each training activity, provide survey results and summarize training activities in an After-Action Review (AAR) for every training session conducted, and will provide the AAR to leadership for all courses conducted within five workdays of training session completion, as well as a quarterly report with analyses of all data. Performance Experts will maintain records of trainings and observe instructors providing training and provide feedback on delivery of training. All Performance Experts will complete initial instructor certifications to ensure effective delivery.
Performance Experts’ instruction will be geared toward the application of resilience and performance enhancement, how the training ties directly into unit missions, and how to incorporate resilience and performance enhancement into higher level guidance and training. Training will include concepts and skill building to build professional climates founded on mutual trust and cohesive teams, empower Leaders to apply proven communication and fundamental counseling skills that support the organization’s doctrine for developmental counseling and evaluations, develop critical thinking, knowledge, and skills to overcome challenges and to bounce back from adversity. Training will focus on teaching participants the practical application of resilience training, resilience and performance enhancement skills, leadership training, and similar skills. Performance Experts shall work as part of a team and provide participants with the resilience and performance knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully complete required trainings, general education in human performance along with personalized training on how to acquire and apply specific mental skills and techniques that cultivate mental and emotional strength. Performance Experts provide tailored educational programs and workshops to help personnel living and working in demanding environments achieve success and accomplish personal, professional, and family goals.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Minimum of a Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in the field of Psychology, Counseling Psychology, Counseling Education, Coaching Education, or Kinesiology with a specialized emphasis in sport and/or performance psychology.
Teaching or coaching experience, preferably with military and DOD personnel.
Thorough knowledge of the Army organizational structure, mission objectives, function, procedures, regulations, and policy pertaining to the Department of the Army.
Prior to performing PE tasks, PEs shall be evaluated and certified to ensure PE’s can effectively deliver lessons.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Certifications or memberships within a professional association related to their field of study such as the Association for Applied Sports Psychology (AASP), Certified Mental Performance Consultant (CMPC) or American Board of Sport Psychology (ABSP), or able to obtain in a year of hire

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

Click here to learn more:  https://careers.kbr.com/us/en/kbr-benefits

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

description:
Title:

Performance Expert (R2PC) - Fort Lee, Virginia

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.  But we all share one goal:  to improve the world responsibly and safely.

This position is contingent upon a vacancy at this location.

KBR is seeking a Performance Expert to help strengthen the physical and psychological health, resilience and performance of Soldiers, Unit Leaders, Families, and DA Civilians located at Army Installations. The Resilience Training/Ready and Resilient Performance Center Program purpose is to provide specialists focused on optimizing mental and physical health and to provide and sustain the effort of existing Army training and education programs across Army installations. The work provides support for the purpose of increasing the physical and psychological health, resilience, and performance of Soldiers, Families, Department of the Defense personnel, United States (US) Government Agencies, and Allied Forces (ROTC) Cadets, and Department of the Army Civilians (DAC).

The Performance Expert will be responsible for: 

Master Resilience Trainers shall instruct individuals in holistic approaches to strength and conditioning and resilience so that they can help ensure durability. Certified Performance Experts conduct training intake/registration to include initial unit contact, observation, and development of training plan, provide all preparations for the training event to include conducting research, tailoring course material, producing all course material and distributing course material to all training attendees, and shall facilitate the training event, grade student course materials, and document student grades in required databases.
Performance Experts will assess training impact by distributing surveys at the close of each training activity, provide survey results and summarize training activities in an After-Action Review (AAR) for every training session conducted, and will provide the AAR to leadership for all courses conducted within five workdays of training session completion, as well as a quarterly report with analyses of all data. Performance Experts will maintain records of trainings and observe instructors providing training and provide feedback on delivery of training. All Performance Experts will complete initial instructor certifications to ensure effective delivery.
Performance Experts’ instruction will be geared toward the application of resilience and performance enhancement, how the training ties directly into unit missions, and how to incorporate resilience and performance enhancement into higher level guidance and training. Training will include concepts and skill building to build professional climates founded on mutual trust and cohesive teams, empower Leaders to apply proven communication and fundamental counseling skills that support the organization’s doctrine for developmental counseling and evaluations, develop critical thinking, knowledge, and skills to overcome challenges and to bounce back from adversity. Training will focus on teaching participants the practical application of resilience training, resilience and performance enhancement skills, leadership training, and similar skills. Performance Experts shall work as part of a team and provide participants with the resilience and performance knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully complete required trainings, general education in human performance along with personalized training on how to acquire and apply specific mental skills and techniques that cultivate mental and emotional strength. Performance Experts provide tailored educational programs and workshops to help personnel living and working in demanding environments achieve success and accomplish personal, professional, and family goals.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Minimum of a Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in the field of Psychology, Counseling Psychology, Counseling Education, Coaching Education, or Kinesiology with a specialized emphasis in sport and/or performance psychology.
Teaching or coaching experience, preferably with military and DOD personnel.
Thorough knowledge of the Army organizational structure, mission objectives, function, procedures, regulations, and policy pertaining to the Department of the Army.
Prior to performing PE tasks, PEs shall be evaluated and certified to ensure PE’s can effectively deliver lessons.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Certifications or memberships within a professional association related to their field of study such as the Association for Applied Sports Psychology (AASP), Certified Mental Performance Consultant (CMPC) or American Board of Sport Psychology (ABSP), or able to obtain in a year of hire

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer
location:
locations
Sioux Falls, South Dakota
Remote - U.S.
description:
Title:

Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. We all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely by supporting the science that informs decision makers and protects Earth.

Note: This position is contingent upon contract award, customer approval, and funding availability.

Eligibility Requirement:
This position requires U.S. Citizenship due to contractual and security requirements.

Preferred location is Sioux Falls, SD

Will consider Remote

Position Overview

KBR is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Cloud DevOps Engineer to join our team in delivering innovative and mission-critical cloud solutions to our customers. As part of a global leader in science, technology, and engineering solutions, you will play a key role in rapidly migrating physical/on-premises infrastructure to AWS using a “lift and shift” approach. After initial migration, you will collaborate with experienced engineers to modernize and optimize cloud workloads. All projects will be completed using Agile methodology, ensuring iterative delivery, continuous improvement, and close collaboration with stakeholders.

Responsibilities

Support the rapid migration (lift and shift) of physical and on-premises infrastructure to AWS cloud environments.
Assist in the development and maintenance of tools for provisioning, monitoring, auditing, and de-provisioning AWS cloud infrastructure using automation tools.
Work closely with solution architects and engineers to implement secure, scalable, and cost-effective AWS cloud solutions.
Maintain and optimize CI/CD pipelines using industry-standard tools like GitLab Runners or similar.
Apply Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles using Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Support the configuration and automation of AWS environments using tools like Ansible.
Troubleshoot and provide support for cloud-based applications in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment.
Contribute to documentation and process improvements to enhance system reliability and efficiency.
Identify and implement AWS cloud cost optimization strategies, incorporating FinOps principles where applicable.
Participate in ongoing modernization efforts, refactoring and enhancing cloud workloads to leverage AWS-native services and best practices.
Collaborate within Agile teams, participate in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives, and deliver incremental value through iterative development.

Required Skills/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or related technical field.
Associate-level certification in AWS (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate, AWS Certified Developer – Associate).
Terraform Associate certification required.
Minimum 6 years of experience in cloud engineering, DevOps, or related fields, with a focus on AWS technologies.
Hands-on experience with DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and automation.
Strong understanding of cloud security, networking, and best practices for AWS.
Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CDK, or AWS CloudFormation.
Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
Scripting proficiency in Python, Bash, PowerShell, or similar for automation.
Demonstrated FinOps ability to reduce cloud spend through cost optimization strategies and practical implementation.
Experience implementing cost-effective, FinOps-aligned AWS cloud solutions.

Collaboration and Problem-Solving

Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with diverse stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, navigate ambiguity, and deliver high-quality results under pressure.

Communication and Documentation

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to present recommendations to technical teams.
Strong technical documentation skills for designing and implementing AWS cloud infrastructure.

Preferred Skills/Experience

Professional or Specialty certifications in AWS (e.g., AWS Certified Security – Specialty, AWS Certified Advanced Networking – Specialty, AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and modern software engineering practices is a plus.

Special Requirements

Ability to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation for government facility access.
Experience and/or education in lieu of these qualifications may be considered.
***Must be a U.S. Citizen***

Basic Compensation:

$110,000K – $ 165,000K

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Benefits

Competitive benefits: 401K with match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending, disability, paid time off, flexible schedule.
Career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Metrology Technician I
description:
Title:

Metrology Technician I

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

 The KBR Metrology team supports Honeywell Aerospace, Otto Instruments, Garrett Advanced Motion, and their suppliers by offering services such as onsite/offsite laboratory visits, test equipment calibration and repair, AMS2750 pyrometry services, metrology engineering, and equipment inspection. Our team ensures that the equipment is maintained to high standards through preventative maintenance, calibration recall system management, automation and programming, and performance tracking dashboards.

Job Summary  

 This position involves calibrating and certifying Test, Measurement, and Diagnostic Equipment (TMDE) traceable to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). The role requires utilizing certified laboratory standards and manufacturer, commercial, or military specifications/calibration procedures. Additional responsibilities include troubleshooting, fault isolation, adjustments, repairs, and managing logistics for TMDE assets.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Calibrate and certify TMDE using certified laboratory standards and NIST traceable procedures.
Perform troubleshooting, fault isolation, adjustments, and repairs on TMDE.
Handle TMDE pick-up and delivery, shipping and receiving of customer and lab assets.
Review certificates of conformance from external suppliers.
Communicate with external vendors regarding status, shipment, and logistics.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with applicable technical training and 2 years of direct experience, OR
Associate’s degree in engineering technology or relevant field and 1 year of direct experience.
U.S. Citizenship required due to client requirements.
Proficient in Microsoft technologies, including Excel.

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal.
Previous customer service experience.

title: MCPP Philippines: Freight Operations Specialist
description:
Title:

MCPP Philippines: Freight Operations Specialist

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

The scope of this position is to perform shipping and receiving duties on Marine Corps Prepositioning Program – Philippines (MCPP-PHIL) equipment and supplies.  The MCPP-PHIL Freight Operations Specialist will report directly to the MCPP-PHIL Distribution Management Supervisor.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Coordinate and execute shipping and receiving management functions for MCPP-PHIL and MCPP-PHIL Organic equipment and supplies implementing the following: 

Maintain a competent and complete materiel management program that follows the contract Statement of Work and adheres to Marine Corps policy and procedures.

Coordinate and execute the staging, distributing, and accounting of equipment and supplies. 

Perform actions in support of supply readiness, warehouse organization, and asset accountability and provide advice on all matters relating to distribution management. Review invoices and requisitions to plan work activities. 

Create/review requisitions for shipping equipment, materials, and supplies per budgetary guidelines.

Comply with personnel and administrative policies, procedures, and government regulations.

Comply with established safety regulations, and method and procedures for handling and storing various equipment parts/components.

Maintain compliance with job specifications, drawings, work orders, instructions, layouts, and time schedules.

Maintain MCPP-PHIL ISO policies and procedures and ensure on-going compliance with such.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High School graduate and four years of progressive experience with specialized knowledge of maintenance and logistic support activities involving supply operations.

In lieu of work experience, a combination of college credits, professional certification, formalized training, or education may be considered.

Must be a U.S. Citizen.

Must possess a valid state Motor Vehicle Drivers’ License.

Must possess or be able to obtain a U.S. Passport.

Must be able to obtain a work visa and Alien Employment Permit for the Philippines.

Applicants must be able to pass an FBI Background investigation with no criminal, civil, or security violations.

Preferred Qualifications

USMC MOS 3112.

Understanding of Marine Corps policies, regulations, and orders.

Industry Certification.

Automation and Scripting.

Expert knowledge of military shipping and storage procedures.

Working knowledge of general maintenance procedures for military tactical equipment and supplies.

Strong written and oral communication skills.

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Executive Chef
location:
locations

description:
Title:

Executive Chef

Executive Chef

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

You’re a dedicated and passionate Executive Chef with a strong focus on creating delicious, high-quality meals. With hands-on experience in food preparation, cooking, and kitchen organization, you excel at creating recipes, maintaining kitchen cleanliness, and ensuring food safety standards are met. Your ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, along with your attention to detail, makes you a reliable team member in delivering exceptional dining experiences.

At KBR, you bring enthusiasm, reliability, and culinary skills to every dish you prepare. Known for your ability to collaborate with kitchen staff and maintain a positive attitude, you play an essential role in ensuring meals are served on time and to the highest standards. Your dedication to quality and service aligns with KBR’s mission of delivering dependable solutions in all aspects of operations.

What You'll Do

In the role of Executive Chef, your duties will include:

Food Preparation - Prepare ingredients by chopping, slicing, marinating, and ensuring proper portioning for recipes.
Cooking - Cook food according to restaurant or kitchen standards, following recipes to ensure consistency and taste.
Maintain Cleanliness - Ensure the cleanliness of the kitchen, cooking equipment, and utensils. Follow sanitation and food safety standards.
Menu Knowledge – Be able to create a menu, ingredients, and cooking methods to effectively prepare and present dishes.
Quality Control - Monitor the quality of ingredients and finished dishes to maintain consistency and high standards.
Time Management - Prepare dishes in a timely manner, ensuring all meals are ready according to the service schedule.
Collaboration - Work closely with kitchen staff, to manage kitchen operations, communicate orders, and ensure efficient meal preparation.
Inventory Management - Track and managing kitchen supplies and creating reorders.
Compliance - Adhere to health and safety regulations and kitchen procedures, including proper storage of ingredients and food handling techniques.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess an Active SECRET security clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI w/ Poly level clearance.
Associate’s degree in Culinary Arts; OR a minimum of thirteen (13) years’ experience in food services including seven (7) years as an Executive Chef
(10+) years’ experience in Food Services
(5+) years experience as an Executive Chef
Experience in large food service operations providing cafeteria style or multi-entrée operations.
Experience leading and developing a food service team.
Experience providing complete, high quality meal service
Have experience working in a challenging food services environment.
Experience with maintaining Serve-Safe standards.

title: Senior Onshore Pipeline Engineer
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Senior Onshore Pipeline Engineer

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR !

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Description- Senior Onshore Pipeline Engineer

Position Title: Senior Onshore Pipeline Engineer
Company: KBR Corporate – In-house Engineering
Location: Abu Dhabi, UAE — KBR Office

Job Purpose

Lead pipeline engineering activities within Concept, FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) and Detail Engineering for Oil & Gas projects.
Ensure high-quality, safe, and timely delivery of pipeline design and related deliverables in adherence with project requirements, international codes, and standards.
Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and coordination across multi-disciplinary teams and interfaces with clients.

Key Job Responsibilities

Lead and independently perform the pipeline engineering scope for Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering phases.
Develop and review pipeline design strategies, standards, and procedures.
Hands-on capability to perform and supervise pipeline calculations, pipeline design basis, mechanical design, routing optimization, stress analysis, support design, crossings design & optimization, buckling assessment & mitigation, buoyancy assessment, location class & valve station selection, hot tap studies, ductile fracture assessment, scrapping requirement assessment, and insulation considerations.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8, API RP 1101, etc.) and project specifications.
Review and approve technical deliverables such as P&IDs, isometrics, routing drawings, material lists, and design basis memoranda.
Coordinate and interface with process, piping, mechanical, instrumentation, electrical, materials & corrosion, safety, construction, geotechnical, structural and civil teams to resolve technical issues.
Manage change to scope, schedule, and budget, and provide risk assessments and mitigation plans.
Mentor and train junior engineers; provide technical reviews and feedback.
Interface with clients and vendors, supporting technical clarifications and design approvals.
Ensure engineering integrity, quality assurance and document control for all pipeline-related deliverables.
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives, toolbox talks, and knowledge sharing.
Support field execution and construction activities as needed, including site visits when required and as-built documentation.

Experience

Minimally 10+ years of onshore pipeline engineering experience and proven track record in Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering and EPCM experience in the Oil & Gas industry.
Key Requirement 1: Previous ADNOC EPC experience + familiarity with ADNOC procedures & requirement (procurement, permitting, interfaces, etc.) is highly preferred. 
Key Requirement 2: Highly capable and efficient in preparing (hands-on) all onshore pipeline engineering deliverables independently and simultaneously working on multiple pipeline projects. Owns assigned tasks with high degree of responsibility. Flexibility & adaptability to maneuver dynamic and evolving project environment. 
Key Requirement 3: Experienced in Iraq field development projects. 
Experience in onshore pipeline constructability, procurement process & commissioning is highly desirable.
Familiarity / experience in offshore pipeline and subsea engineering is a bonus.

Education & Qualifications

Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (e.g. Pipeline, Mechanical or similar applicable degree).
Chartered status or professional registration is a plus.
Proven pipeline design software proficiency (eg. AutoPIPE, Caesar II, MathCAD, etc.) is mandatory. 
Proven experience independently and directly managing a group of designers producing project pipeline drawings to meet client requirements.

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of pipeline mechanical design, stress analysis, routing optimization, crossing design (road, rail, river, HDD, open cut, etc.) & optimization, buckling (LB, UHB) assessment & mitigation, and thermal expansion considerations.
Proficient in relevant codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8; API standards).
Ability to perform stress analysis, material selection, and corrosion considerations.
Knowledge of HSE practices & requirements and risk assessment methodologies applicable to design and construction phases.

Soft Skills

Integrity: upholding engineering integrity amidst challenging priorities.
Leadership: ability to lead, motivate, and develop a multidisciplinary, multicultural team.
Communication: clear and concise communication with internal teams and clients; effective technical writing and presentation skills.
Problem Solving: strong analytical and troubleshooting capabilities.
Project Management: ability to manage scope, schedule, and budget; risk management.
Stakeholder Management: adept at coordinating with clients, vendors, and project partners.
Adaptability: comfortable operating in dynamic project environments and across multiple projects.

What We Offer:

Opportunities for professional development and career advancement in a challenging work environment.
Engaging and collaborative work environment with a commitment to excellence, safety and sustainability.

description:
Title:

Structural Engineer

In Australia, KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions business employs over 1300 people with offices in each state. Our project delivery track record, industry profile and strong relationships have enabled us to grow significantly, and we continue to expand. This continued growth allows us to offer unrivalled opportunities to our staff in terms of career paths, career development and project exposure.

We are renowned for working in partnership with our clients and construction partners to deliver exceptional outcomes based on our collaborative approach and our “One Team” value. Creating a superb culture is also huge for us and a key part of our success and growth. Genuine collaboration across the business is integral to how we work. As a company KBR have created an open, inclusive organisation where people matter, are valued, and cared about. By joining KBR you can be assured that you are joining a team that pulls in the same direction and shares common values.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a motivated and talented Structural Engineer ready to take the next step in their career and join our growing Sydney based Buildings team. In this role, you will contribute to the planning, design and delivery of major local and interstate infrastructure projects, working collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams to deliver high‑quality outcomes.

You will bring a strong client focus, with a proven track record of successfully delivering projects and building trusted relationships. The role involves close coordination with construction partners and key external stakeholders to develop practical, efficient and well considered engineering solutions.

You will also be responsible for preparing technically robust, clear and well structured proposals and reports, ensuring complex information is communicated effectively. In addition, you will actively support the growth of the team by providing guidance, mentoring and technical oversight to junior engineers

Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor of Structural Engineering

Ability to design building structures and prepare design calculations using industry standard computer applications

Practical experience in the design and documentation of concrete and steel framed buildings

Be on the pathway to obtaining CPEng

Polished communication skills with the ability to navigate project issues

You must currently hold or be able to obtain a Defence clearance

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia

KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity:

As a Pricing Analyst you will play a crucial role in driving the financial and commercial success of ADSS by designing, maintaining, and evaluating pricing models across proposals, contracts, and strategic initiatives. Working closely with multi-disciplinary teams, the role is responsible for generating financial inputs and delivering end-to-end pricing support—including requirement analysis, data preparation, outcome modelling, gate review coordination, and bid submission. Success in this role requires strong analytical acumen, meticulous attention to detail, and effective collaboration across finance, operations, and business development.

This position is a Permanent, Full-Time opportunity and can be based in any of the following locations:

Melbourne
Canberra
Sydney
Brisbane
Adelaide

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain pricing models for new business proposals and contract renewals.
Analyse cost structures, labour rates, and market benchmarks to ensure pricing is both competitive and compliant.
Generate financial inputs in collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams for commercial tenders.
Support the full pricing lifecycle including analysis of requirements, data preparation, modelling of outcomes, gate review process, and bid submission.
Provide pricing insights and recommendations to leadership for strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with Business Development, Capture Management, Commercial, and Program Management teams to align pricing with strategic goals.
Identify pricing risks and mitigation strategies, and communicate them effectively to stakeholders.
Maintain proposal documentation and pricing records in SharePoint and other internal systems.
Other reasonable tasks as assigned relevant to this appointment, skill set and experience.
 

Required Qualifications, Experience & Skills:

Essential:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in pricing, financial analysis, or cost estimation.
Advanced Excel and cost modelling skills; experience with pricing tools and ERP systems preferred.
Strong understanding of government contracting and cost estimation principles.
Solid problem solving skills and persistence in the face of obstacles.
Ability to build trusted relationships at all levels
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver under tight deadlines.
Excellent analytical, communication, stakeholder engagement, and presentation skills.
Ability to obtain a Defence Security Clearance.

Desirable:

Knowledge of CASG/Defence/Aus Government pricing and procurement policies
Exposure to proposal lifecycle management and pricing compliance reviews.

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work

Paid Reservist leave
Income protection
Corporate rewards
Salary packaging/Novated leasing
