Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Support the SSC with ensuring security, quality, timeliness, mission partner support, completeness, and regulatory compliance of ATO RMF documentation
Experience creating, editing and reviewing RMF, policy documents to implement administrative controls for each of the Rev 5 control families.
Experience developing and reviewing and performing self-assessments of control narratives and System Control Traceability Matrix (SCTM)
Experiencing reviewing and editing ATO artifacts such as Ports, Protocol and Services, matrix and Hardware/Software lists.
Proposing, coordinating, implementing, and enforcing all Department of the Air Force information system security policies, standards, and methodologies
Familiarity with vulnerability assessments using the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS), Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG), and the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) Compliance Checker, incorporating automated Benchmarks
Knowledge of evaluating operating systems and network devices security configuration in accordance with Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) approved Security Technical Implementation Guides
Performing security control continuous monitoring, security audits, risk analysis and developing mitigation strategies for DoD information systems
Ensures software, hardware, and firmware complies with appropriate security configuration guidelines (e.g., security technical implementation guides /security requirement guides)
Ensures proper configuration management procedures are followed prior to implementation and contingent upon necessary approval. Coordinate changes or modifications with the system-level Information System Security Manager (ISSM), Security Control Assessor (SCA), and/or the Wing Cybersecurity office
During system development, recommends protective or corrective measures, in coordination with the ISSM, when a security incident or vulnerability is discovered.
During system development, reports security incidents or vulnerabilities to the system-level ISSM and wing cybersecurity office according to AFI 17-203, Cyber Incident Handling
Recommends exceptions, deviations, or waivers to cybersecurity requirements.
Preparing certification letters and Memoranda of Agreement (MoA), Authorization to Connect (ATC) packages, Interconnection Security Agreement (SIA), and Security Impact Assessments with system owners for interface and networking implementations
Support the following responsibilities: security control assessor (SCA) and Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) curated to DOD/DAF/USSF baselines, audit standards, and plan of actions and milestones (POAM)

title: Cyber Security RMF Support
description:
Title:

Cyber Security RMF Support

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

You will join a systems engineering team defining the next generation of space communication systems supporting US Space Force (USSF) satellite communications. You will support Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) activities in a multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You will interface and collaborate with SE&I team members, contractors, government civilians and members of the USSF. You will lead and support several working groups responsible for leading technical discussion, resolve and identify risk, requirement gaps, developing briefings, writing, and tracking action items, and authoring meeting minutes.

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the US Space Force’s Space Systems Center (SSC). We support the Space Force’s acquisition of state of the art satellite communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Support the SSC with ensuring security, quality, timeliness, mission partner support, completeness, and regulatory compliance of ATO RMF documentation

Experience creating, editing and reviewing RMF, policy documents to implement administrative controls for each of the Rev 5 control families.

Experience developing and reviewing and performing self-assessments of control narratives and System Control Traceability Matrix (SCTM)

Experiencing reviewing and editing ATO artifacts such as Ports, Protocol and Services, matrix and Hardware/Software lists.

Proposing, coordinating, implementing, and enforcing all Department of the Air Force information system security policies, standards, and methodologies

Familiarity with vulnerability assessments using the Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS), Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG), and the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) Compliance Checker, incorporating automated Benchmarks

Knowledge of evaluating operating systems and network devices security configuration in accordance with Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) approved Security Technical Implementation Guides

Performing security control continuous monitoring, security audits, risk analysis and developing mitigation strategies for DoD information systems

Ensures software, hardware, and firmware complies with appropriate security configuration guidelines (e.g., security technical implementation guides /security requirement guides)

Ensures proper configuration management procedures are followed prior to implementation and contingent upon necessary approval. Coordinate changes or modifications with the system-level Information System Security Manager (ISSM), Security Control Assessor (SCA), and/or the Wing Cybersecurity office

During system development, recommends protective or corrective measures, in coordination with the ISSM, when a security incident or vulnerability is discovered.

During system development, reports security incidents or vulnerabilities to the system-level ISSM and wing cybersecurity office according to AFI 17-203, Cyber Incident Handling

Recommends exceptions, deviations, or waivers to cybersecurity requirements.

Preparing certification letters and Memoranda of Agreement (MoA), Authorization to Connect (ATC) packages, Interconnection Security Agreement (SIA), and Security Impact Assessments with system owners for interface and networking implementations

Support the following responsibilities: security control assessor (SCA) and Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) curated to DOD/DAF/USSF baselines, audit standards, and plan of actions and milestones (POAM)

Attend cleared expert threat briefings; have oversight of security program design, incident response plans, cyber risk assessments, and attack surface assessments; investigate security breaches, perform red, blue, purple, ethical hacking, orchestrate vulnerability assessment, develop security protocols, conduct tabletop exercises, and breach readiness reviews

Completes and maintains required cybersecurity certification in accordance with (IAW) AFMAN 17-1303.

Working Hours: Standard

Required:

An active Secret clearance is required for this position

BA or BS degree in engineering, physics, chemistry, mathematics, computer science, network, and telecommunications; information systems, information technology, or computer information systems

Minimum 2 years of continuous Information Systems, Information Assurance/Cybersecurity (IA/CS) experience.

Understanding and working knowledge of Risk Management Framework (RMF) Rev 5 and DODI 8510.01.

2 continuous years of experience with security controls and implementation delineated in Committee of National Security Systems Instruction (CNSSI) 1253, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), Special Publication (SP) 800-53, and the Joint Special Access Program Implementation Guide (JSIG).

2 continuous years of experience with performing vulnerability assessments using Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS), Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG), the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) Compliance Checker, incorporating automated Benchmarks.

2 continuous years of experience using SolarWinds and Splunk or other network analysis tools.

Extensive experience working with Linux/Unix Command Line Interface and using regular expression queries.

Possess DoD Approved Baseline Certification as Information Assurance Manager Level II in accordance with DoDM 8140.03. (i.e., CompTIA CASP+, CISSP).

title: Sr. HR Generalist
description:
Title:

Sr. HR Generalist

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! - At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Program Summary

The Global Asset Management (GAM) program provides government and property management, equipment production maintenance, engineering asset tracking, mailing services, and tool crib support to our customers worldwide. The GAM program plays a critical role in enabling customer operations and ensuring timely delivery to their internal and external stakeholders.

Job Summary

KBR’s Readiness and Sustainment (R&S) Business Unit is seeking an experienced Senior HR Generalist to serve as a strategic HR partner supporting the Global Asset Management (GAM) program. This individual will bring strong HR generalist expertise and broad business acumen to deliver end-to-end HR support and guidance across program operations.

Working in close partnership with HR colleagues and cross-functional teams across KBR, the Senior HR Generalist will provide expert support across the full lifecycle of HR administration and employee relations, while fostering a positive employee experience and strong engagement with program leadership and site management.

The ideal candidate is:

Self-motivated and proactive, capable of thriving in a fast-paced, high-demand environment

Highly collaborative and works extremely well in a team-oriented environment

Experienced in structured HR and business administration frameworks, ideally gained within large commercial enterprises, government services, or major project-based organizations

Comfortable navigating complex organizational structures and aligning HR practices with strategic business goals

Adept at balancing day-to-day HR operations with long-term planning and compliance

Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills

Customer-focused mindset with high professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality

An individual who desires advancement within the organization and is motivated by continuous learning, professional development, and the opportunity to take on increasing responsibility as our business evolves

**This role will work a hybrid schedule onsite in Arizona and is not eligible for full-time remote work

Roles and Responsibilities 

The responsibilities and duties may include but are not limited to the following:

Serve as the primary point of contact for employee relations, benefits inquiries, payroll issues, and general HR concerns

Partner with leadership to support project needs and workforce planning

Attend and participate in disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations

Mediate workplace conflicts and promote a positive, inclusive work environment through engagement initiatives

May direct resources, prioritize tasks, and provide guidance to less experienced team members

Leverage data insights to identify talent gaps and support the development of high-potential employees

Utilize HR technology, analytics, and innovative tools to streamline processes, improve employee experience, and improve operational efficiency

Support implementation and administration of human resources programs, policies, processes and procedures designed to attract, retain and reward employees in alignment with overall business strategy

Drive cultural adoption of employee development models through communication and training for managers as well as employees; develop and leads training for managers on performance management best practices

Support leadership development and succession planning initiatives

Will travel to various client sites as required

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. Citizen

Completion of a 4-year undergraduate degree

5+ years of relevant HR experience

Strong Employee Relations experience

Must be in or near the Phoenix or Tempe, AZ area

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams)

Preferred Qualifications

Degree in Business Administration or Human Resources Management

Professional HR certification (i.e., PHR, SHRM-CP)

Hands-on Workday administration experience with fluency in HR transaction processing within the tool

Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to influence and build credibility with leadership

Proven business acumen and strategic thinking to align HR initiatives with business objectives

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Electronics Technician Maintenance III
description:
Title:

Electronics Technician Maintenance III

Program Summary:

KBR’s Product and Technology Solutions Division specializes in rapid prototyping and advanced technology solutions for directed energy, electronic warfare, and security applications. With expertise in electronic warfare systems, critical infrastructure protection, and product R&D, KBR delivers cutting-edge innovations to meet mission-critical needs. Backed by a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR collaborates closely with customers to develop secure, effective, and forward-thinking solutions.


Job Summary:

KBR is currently recruiting for an Electronics Technician to join our team! This position will independently plan and perform corrective and preventive maintenance on complex electronic intrusion detection systems.  

You will serve as an expert in intrusion detection systems that include video (IR and day), access control (card readers and keypads), RADAR perimeter security, intrusion detection (PIR and BMS), mass notification equipment and a variety of communication networks. 

Roles and Responsibilities:

Performing preventive and corrective maintenance on intrusion detection and surveillance systems of various types and manufacturers
Recommend solutions to design problems.
Perform system tests and analyzing results, modifying equipment or installations to improve performance.
Perform other duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications:

Associates degree in electronics technology or a two-year civilian technical electronics curriculum or a four-year trade apprenticeship-training program in electronics or graduate of a military Class "A" electronics school. 
Previous Intrusion Detection System experience can be substituted at the rate of one years' experience for each year of education.
Must have as a minimum, eight years hands-on experience in the field of electronics.
Experience must include operational, maintenance and team lead work assignments.
Must be able to attain and maintain Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:

Working knowledge of multiple systems to include:

AMAG alarm monitoring and access control systems
DMP alarm monitor and reporting systems
FLIR RADARs and cameras
Genetec NVRs
Pelco cameras, DVRs, and video switchers
Networking protocols TCP/IP, network hubs, switchers, server connectivity
Windows Servers
Cisco Switches
Fiber communication equipment
WAVES MNS
Southwest Microwave Intrepid fence sensors
MS Server, Windows, Cisco, Security + and/or Tower Climber certifications a plus but not required

This is a Service Contract Act (SCA) position

23183 - Electronic Technician Maintenance III - SAM.gov

Compensation: $40.00 an hour. The salary range posted is for Hawaii locations. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

title: National Security Solutions (NSS) Internship – Subcontracts Intern
description:
Title:

National Security Solutions (NSS) Internship – Subcontracts Intern

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technical Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is with KBR’s Mission Tech Solutions (MTS).  At KBR MTS, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Why Join KBR?

Mentorship from experienced subject matter experts
Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges
Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment
Networking opportunities with other technologists and executives
Competitive pay and great company culture

As a National Security Solutions – Subcontracts Intern, you will support senior subcontracts administrators:

Proposal preparation, subcontract negotiations, fact finding, contract analysis and administration, and / or Government audit activities
Assisting with the execution of subcontracts and working with subcontract customers, which include the U.S. Government, Commercial and / or International Customers, and Prime U.S. Government Contractors
Conducting contract closeouts by collaborating with other program functions to ensure the closeout process is complete 
Work with the Program Control to ensure subcontractors are closed out of Costpoint.
Work with IT for any government property return and then obtain the necessary documentation for the PMs and subcontractors to close out the files.
Set-up new subcontract files for new contract awards where you will work with the Program Managers, Accounting and Program Control to ensure the subcontractors are set up for new awards
Customer communication via email and/or formal letters
Scheduling and reporting deliveries
Weekly, monthly, or quarterly reports, as required by the Business Area
Compiling and maintaining contractual records and documents in accordance with contract requirements and company policies.

Selected interns for this paid opportunity will be provided with the opportunity to mentor with experienced professionals, gain experience and establish a name for themselves in this high demand career field.

Currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Contract Law or Supply Chain Management

Must be a US Citizen
Must pass a Security Pre-Screen and have the ability to obtain a security clearance.

description:
Title:

Special Ops Licensed Clinical Social Worker (NAB, Coronado, CA)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION. 

 

A career at KBR can change the world — and change your life. If you’re ready, let’s get started. 

 

KBR maintains a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts.  We are looking for a Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker to join the team who is responsible for integrating the physical, mental and psychological wellness of our service members and their families.    

 

This Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker will function within an operational unit, as a Behavioral Health Care Provider and is responsible for the application of social work procedures and techniques, including interviewing, behavioral assessment, and evidenced-based therapies, in the evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of psychological and neuropsychological disorders using the following skills: individual, family and group psychotherapy, couple's therapy, alcohol and drug treatment evaluations.  

  

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Engage all quality improvement and staff meetings, conferences  

Conduct applied research and clinical investigations in clinical/behavioral health/organizational social work.  

Consult with medical personnel, legal authorities, military commanders and school districts as required.  

Maintain accurate medical records of all patients seen and produces reports of evaluation and/or treatment.  

Participate in military specific training.  This position may include clinical supervision of unlicensed providers or trainees.  

May be required to perform some, or all, of the following activities: Participates in and successfully completes required DoD or service required training; Contact referred patients to assess treatment adherence; Use validated symptom inventories to assess current symptom severity; Assess barriers to treatment adherence and help patient problem-solve solutions to barriers; Provide patients with education regarding their mental health condition and treatment regimen; maintain patient information in a patient registry; maintain accurate and current notes in the electronic medical records of all patients contacted for review by the managing physician; Routinely staffs difficult cases with the referring provider, behavioral health consultant and/or psychiatry consultant; and Performs case management functions.  

  

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

Position requires U.S. Citizenship.  

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) or equivalent (MSSW, MSSA) degree from a graduate school of social work fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).  

Maintain a current, unrestricted clinical license to independently practice social work in any one of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.  

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at a local MTF.  

Minimum of two (2) years within the past five (5) years in the independent practice of clinical social work in a mental health setting. 

Demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics regarding the delivery of clinical social work services.  

Experience in brief behavioral interventions.  

May be required to receive and maintain clinical practice privileges. 

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English.  

Experience working in a Government setting such a DOD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.  

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation. 

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

Responsible for completing all required training.  

Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

  

Basic Compensation: This range is for Coronado, CA area only 

$96,155-$106,543

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and / or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: UABOS Spain: Chief of Operations
location:
locations
Seville, Spain
KBR Tower, USA, Houston, 601 Jefferson Street, Texas
description:
Title:

UABOS Spain: Chief of Operations

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.

Job Summary

The Civil Engineer (CE) Chief of Operations is responsible for providing quality and cost-effective facility and infrastructure maintenance, heavy repair, material acquisition and assistance to CE customers. 

The Chief of Operations will lead the operational shops, Production Control, Material Control and Requirements and Optimization (R&O) to operate, maintain, inspect, repair, overhaul, install, construct, demolish, and logistically support real property, infrastructure systems, Real Property Installed Equipment, Equipment Authorization Inventory Data/Document, and Non-Real Property Equipment/System.

Coordinates closely with the Chief of Design and Chief of Installation Management deconflict schedules and activities to ensure efficient and on-time completion of projects. 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Provide daily accountability for all CE Operations personnel. 
Ensure all employees are briefed on Safety practices for the jobs being performed. 
Coordinate with the shops and production control to ensure Work Tasks are completed within Performance Work Statement (PWS) quality and time requirements.
Give advice and assistance on Work Task priorities based on the PWS, Air Force standards and personal experience. 
Manage material requests and coordinate with material control to ensure the shops have equipment, tools and parts to perform the tasks safely, and efficiently.   
Provide reports and updates on work completion status daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually. 
Hold meetings to pass on and receive information to the sections and shop leaders.  Attend design and construction meetings to provide insight and recommendations on projects and base activities.      

Basic Qualifications 

Must have or be able to obtain a U.S. SECRET Clearance
Shall have fifteen years’ experience (8 of the 15 years in supervision/management) in real property operation, maintenance and repair of facilities, infrastructure systems, pavements and grounds. Shall have USAF installation level working experience.
Must possess an associate degree or higher in a related field.
Knowledgeable and Proficient in Microsoft Office programs.  

Preferred Qualifications

Should have a U.S. Driver’s License
Able to communicate in Spanish.

title: QA/QC Engineer Civil & Structural Steel works-Flowlines
description:
Title:

QA/QC Engineer Civil & Structural Steel works-Flowlines

Job Description: 

Position: QA/QC Engineer (Civil & Structural Steel works)-Flowlines 

Project: ROO_EPCm

Location: Basra, Iraq 

Rotation Type: 6 days on and 1 day off

Nationality: Iraq

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Purpose:

The QA/QC Engineer-Civil & Structural Steel Works (Flowlines) will be responsible for ensuring compliance with project specifications and quality standards for civil and structural steel works on the BP_ROO_EPCM project in Iraq. This role involves monitoring and inspecting various facility installations to uphold quality and safety requirements.

Job Responsibilities:

Reports to QA/QC Manager.
Monitors and inspects facility installations including RCC structures, building architectural works, asphalt roads/pavements, storm water drainage systems, tank foundations, grouting works, and structural steel erection works.
Ensures compliance with project documents, codes, standards, and procedures.
Conducts quality control inspections on concrete works, earthworks, grouting works, and structural steel works as per approved ITPs.
Inspects heavy equipment foundations and other critical structural components.
Oversees excavation, backfilling, and compaction activities, including cable/pipe trenches.
Observes field tests for soil, concrete, and other materials.
Monitors construction sites to ensure adherence to safety standards and specifications.
Collaborate with design and engineering teams to ensure that quality requirements are integrated into the project design phase.
Conduct regular audits of construction activities to identify non-conformities and develop corrective action plans.
Review and approve quality control documentation, including test reports, inspection records, and quality certificates.
Provide technical guidance to subcontractors and construction teams to resolve quality issues and improve workmanship.
Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance quality processes and procedures.
Participate in project meetings and inspections to communicate quality-related updates and findings.
Assist in the preparation of quality reports and documentation for internal and external stakeholders.
Conduct supplier evaluations and inspections to ensure compliance with project quality requirements.
Support the training and development of junior QA/QC staff members to enhance departmental capabilities and performance.
Conduct risk assessments and proactive quality checks to prevent defects and deviations from project specifications.
Coordinate with third-party quality assurance agencies to validate project quality standards and compliance.

Mandatory Competencies:

Familiarity with international codes and standards related to materials, civil, and structural disciplines.
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing quality management systems to meet international standards.
Fluent communication in English.
Experience in a similar position: 7 to 10 years.
Experience conducting quality audits

Technical Skills:

Proficient in civil and structural engineering principles.
Strong knowledge of quality assurance and quality control processes.
Familiarity with construction materials and methodologies.
Some knowledge of welding processes and inspection techniques.
Familiarity with bolted connections and torquing requirements.

Soft Skills:

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or under minimal supervision.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

Qualifications:

Mandatory Bachelor's or Diploma in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution.
Non-essential but preferred qualifications in NDT disciplines, and / or welding inspection

Work Environment:

The role will involve on-site inspections and coordination with various project stakeholders. A dynamic and fast-paced environment requiring attention to detail and adherence to project timelines and quality standards.

title: Programme Support Scheduler
description:
Title:

Programme Support Scheduler

Simply put, at KBR, we do things that matter.

Every day, our people work together to deliver solutions that are helping solve the great challenges and opportunities of our time, including climate change, national security, energy transition and security, cybersecurity, space exploration, and more.

The Programme Support Scheduler will support the development and maintenance of an integrated programme schedule. This will necessitate close interaction and engagement with project schedulers, with direction being provided by the Programme Integration Scheduler/Functional Lead.

Some of your accountabilities be:

Stakeholder engagement with Tranche Planners and Leads.

Support with updating the P6 schedule. Work closely with the Project Schedulers, Project Managers, and Delivery Agents to gather progress to facilitate accurate schedule updates and development.

Support critical path analysis.

Management and reporting of dependencies and key milestones.

Support analysis of schedule performance data, (root cause analysis and corrective actions).

Other duties requested by, or as agreed with, the Programme Controls and Integration Manager and Programme Integration Scheduler.

What Do We Need

Experience using P6.

Strong engagement and communication skills.

Generation and presentation of reports for senior management.

Proactive and able to use own initiative to solve problems and see opportunities for continuous improvement.

Good understanding of the various methods of planning, programme, and progress monitoring.

Good understanding of risk and opportunity management with reference to planning and programming.

Strong understanding of the events that initiate, and of the methods used to demonstrate delay or change.

Location

The role is Hybrid where 3 days per week will be spent in the office in Glasgow City Centre.

There may be occasional travel.

Security Requirements

SC Clearance

Due to the secure nature of this project, restrictions in relation to UK residency and nationality will apply.

title: Electrical Supervisor (CAT A)
description:
Title:

Electrical Supervisor (CAT A)

Electrical Supervisor

CELE10 - Electrician, General foreman

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Assists the Superintendent by providing input to identify key success factors, timing of procurement deliverables, and establishing common work breakdown structures. Provides leadership to cause the creation of organizational structure and processes required to fully execute the requirements of services and is responsible for the execution of Electrical services, quality, subcontractor performance, and construction cost. Evaluates Electrical service execution for compliance to contract, design data, schedule, cost budgets, and quality, advising the project team of status, issues, impacts, risk, and cost influence factors on to go scope. Takes ownership of the Electrical craft schedule and develops short term look ahead schedules for the Foreman in alignment with the execution plan. Reviews and monitors cost and man-hour budget for installation process and develops a staff facilities equipment and tool requirement plan.

Familiarity with Electrical Control and Protection Systems like PLCs, Motor Protection Relays, Feeder Protection Relays etc.

Carry out basic repairs of electrical equipment and power circuits. Contributes in trouble shooting the complex and major electrical problems or breakdowns.

Read and interpret simple machine sketches, Single Line Diagram, complex control schematics and diagnose flow charts as necessary to facilitate proper maintenance.

Ability to use all related tools and instruments for the above said maintenance activities.

The personnel shall be able to use and maintain all type of testing and calibration instruments including Multimeter and Insulation Tester (Megger).

Shall be well familiar with the hazardous chemicals / materials used in the Oil & Gas industries and means to perform the Installation/Maintenance activity safely.

Shall be aware of safety and environmental aspects in the Oil & Gas plants.

Knowledge about Work permits system in large scale industries.

Knowledge about Lock-Out Tag-Out (LOTO)

Engineering Diploma in respective trade (12+3 years)

10 years relevant experience in Oil & Gas/Petrochemical/Fertilizer industry and competency

Working level competency in Communication, Team management, Report writing

title: Senior Technical Professional - Static Equipment
description:
Title:

Senior Technical Professional - Static Equipment

JOB DESCRIPTION

Responsible for developing design, specification, selection and services relating to Process Equipment including but not limited to Pressure Vessels, Spheres, Storage Tanks, Process Columns, Column Internals, Reactors, Scrubbers, Unfired Heat Transfer equipment, Electric Heaters, Silos, Bins, Mounded Vessels, Pig Launchers and Receivers.
Independently performs all conventional aspects of the functional area subject matter with minimal guidance.
Provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers.
Willing to travel globally and carry out short term assignments with other KBR offices/ client offices or with project site facility as needed to support projects.

SKILLSETS

Skills are typically acquired through a graduation in Mechanical or allied Engineering and a minimum of 8 years, with average experience ranging from 8-12 years.
Work requires a broad knowledge of precedents. Shall be able to effectively handle the tasks given as a Resonsible Engineer for the Requisition handled, with minimal guidance. Also, may be responsible for leadership of a functional area on a small project or a segment of a larger project.
Must be experienced with FEED and EPC/EPCM activities including but not limited preparation of Material Requisition, Technical Specification, Design using ASME, API and other International Codes/ Standard, Mechanical Data Sheets, Supplier offer review, Technical Bid Evaluation, Vendor Documents Review and Interfaces with Inter disciplines as required.
Shall work in line with project schedules without compromise on the quality.
Good oral and written communication skills.
Good attitude and able to work as a team player resolving all conflicts that may arise.   
Worked with process equipment in the shop or field (a plus).
Participation in the inspection of equipment at shop or field (a plus).
Experience in material selection per process requirements in compliance with various national and international codes and standards.
Expertise in software used in the design of pressure vessels such as DISASU, PVElite and/or COMPRESS
Expertise in software used in design of storage tanks such as AMETANK.
Good knowledge of NACE compliance and lethal service requirements.
Working Knowledge of FEA using software like ANSYS, Nozzle Pro etc (a plus).
Exposure to European codes for process and storage equipment (a plus).
Working knowledge of wind and seismic analysis using various National and International codes, standards and case studies.
Working knowledge on re-rating of process equipment, repair and re-qualification of fabricated equipment.
Knowledge of NDT requirement, code stamping and WPS /PQR (a plus).

title: Technical Professional
description:
Title:

Technical Professional

HVAC Specialist   – Job Description

The HVAC Engineer  shall have 8-12 years of demonstrated experience in Concept / Detailed design and engineering functions of HVAC systems preferable in the Oil & Gas and Hydrocarbon domain. He or she should be capable of leading a team of modellers  to complete the deliverables within Schedule and budget.
The Candidate shall be a self-starter and manage communication with all stakeholders including Client, Contractor, vendor, etc independently. He should be able to take independent decisions to support the project requirement and be accountable.

Skillsets

Prepare / Review heat load calculations, ventilation calculations, pressure drop calculations for ducting and piping, duct sizing, pipe sizing, etc.
Excellent knowledge in Standards like ASHRAE, SMACNA, etc
Hands-on knowledge in Design Software like Carrier HAP.
Preparation of Air Flow Diagrams,  P & ID’s, Equipment and duct layout, piping layout, etc. Exposure to Offshore projects like Fixed Platforms, FPSOs is an added advantage.
Should be able to independently develop  Design basis, Technical Specification, Data sheets, Material Requisitions and Bill of Quantities for Bulks like Ducting, Dampers, Registers and other accessories.
Hands-on knowledge in Selection of equipment like Chillers, Packaged and Split Systems, Air Handlers, Pumps, Fans, Cooling towers, etc.
Prepare Technical bid Evaluation for HVAC System including equipment and accessories.
Hands-on in review of Post Order  Contractor /  Supplier documents
Provide inputs and guidance for  HVAC modellers in modelling tasks. Working knowledge of modelling softwares like E3D, S3D and Navisworks is desirable
Working knowledge of sustainable engineering practices, CAPEX and OPEX.
Participation in the progress and coordination meetings of the project.
Necessary coordination with vendors and other department for related interfaces as applicable.
Interface directly with clients and other stakeholders.
Preparing technical proposals and reports.

title: Technical Advisor - Static Equipment
description:
Title:

Technical Advisor - Static Equipment

Under general supervision, independently applies advanced engineering techniques, makes decisions on engineering problems and methods, and represents the organization in conferences to resolve important questions or to negotiate with key Engineers and officials of other organizations.
Subject matter expert in Process Equipment that includes but not limited to Pressure Vessels, Spheres, Storage Tanks, Process Columns, Column Internals, Reactors, Scrubbers, Unfired Heat Transfer equipment, Electric Heaters, Silos, Bins, Mounded Vessels, Pig Launchers and Receivers.
Provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers and is consulted extensively by associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on scientific interpretations and advice.
Job role is responsible for a measurable asset such as an assigned staff and budget.
Willing to travel globally and undertake short term assignments with other KBR offices/ client offices or with project site facility as needed to support projects.
Responsible for effectively meeting the Project schedules and able to suggest improvement methods for effective handling of Projects.

SKILLS

Skills are typically acquired through a graduation in Mechanical or allied Engineering with a minimum of 12 years of demonstrated experience and average experience ranging from 16 – 20 years.

Hands-on experience with FEED and EPC/EPCM activities including but not limited preparation of Material Requisition, Technical Specification, Design using ASME, API and other International Codes/ Standard, Mechanical Data Sheets, Supplier offer review, Technical Bid Evaluation, Vendor Documents Review and Interfaces with Inter disciplines as required. At least 8 years of experience in EPC is preferred. Experience in fabrication Industry is a plus.
Experience in PMC projects (a plus).
Experience in the mechanical design of heat exchangers (a plus).
Shall be able to lead a team of Engineers/Designers and to effectively communication/ work with other KBR Centers and Client; Willing to work as a Requisition Engineer as well if Project demands; Responsible for the hours estimate and hours allocation to the resources allocated to Project, based on the tasks and effective completion of the tasks within budgeted hours.
Good oral and written communication skills.
Good attitude and able to work as a team player resolving all conflicts that may arise.
Worked with process equipment in the shop or field (a plus).
Participation in the inspection of equipment at shop or field (a plus).
Experience in material selection per process requirements in compliance with various national and international codes and standards.
Expertise in software used in the design of pressure vessels such as DISASU, PVElite and/or COMPRESS.
Expertise in software used in design of storage tanks such as AMETANK.
Good knowledge of NACE compliance and lethal service requirements.
Working Knowledge of FEA using software like ANSYS, Nozzle Pro etc (a plus).
Exposure to European codes for process and storage equipment (a plus).
Working knowledge of wind and seismic analysis using various National and International codes, standards and case studies.
Working knowledge on re-rating of process equipment, repair and re-qualification of fabricated equipment.
Knowledge of NDT requirement, code stamping and WPS /PQR preferred.

title: Scheduler
description:
Title:

Scheduler

Ready to kick off 2026 with a role that truly makes an impact? With continued growth across our Water portfolio, KBR’s Adelaide team is expanding — and we’re seeking an experienced Scheduler to support a major water infrastructure project in Adelaide.

At KBR, we put people first. You'll join a collaborative and supportive team where your scheduling expertise directly contributes to delivering essential infrastructure. If you’re looking for flexibility, career development, and meaningful work, this opportunity sets you up for a strong start to the year.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain baseline schedules and prepare what‑if scenarios to support project decision‑making

Apply schedule risk management techniques, including contingency planning

Perform critical path analysis, schedule integrity reviews, and progress reporting

Build and manage resource‑loaded schedules, including producing histograms and schedule insights

Work collaboratively with multidisciplinary engineering and project teams to ensure sequencing accuracy and timely program delivery

Utilise tools including Primavera P6, MS Project, and Excel (Power BI experience highly regarded)

Skills & Experience:

Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Project Management, or a related discipline

3–5 years’ experience in project scheduling, ideally within major infrastructure or water projects

Strong proficiency in Primavera P6 and MS Project

Understanding of EVM, SPI, schedule risk analysis, and progress measurement

Strong communication skills with the ability to engage effectively with project stakeholders

Considering a Move?

We welcome out-of-state candidates looking to self-relocate to South Australia.

Must be currently located in Australia with full work rights (PR or citizenship advantageous).

At KBR, our people are the heart of our success. We create an environment where you can flourish, feel valued, and focus on doing what you do best.

Together, we deliver infrastructure for a better tomorrow. Our reputation for excellence is built on our people and our culture of caring, collaboration, learning, and trust.

We Are People of Integrity – We act ethically and responsibly, always.

We Empower – We encourage innovation and give our people the autonomy to succeed.

We Work Together – Collaboration is at the heart of our success as OneKBR.

Benefits:

Just some of our benefits include the following:

Flexible work arrangements and genuine work-life balance

Career development programs and ongoing support

Employee wellbeing initiatives that support your overall health and happiness

A collaborative, innovative culture where your ideas and contributions truly matter

The above are just some of the benefits on offer at KBR.

title: Graduate Fire Safety Engineer
description:
Title:

Graduate Fire Safety Engineer

The Opportunity

Are you ready to apply your engineering skills to meaningful, real-world challenges? As a Graduate Fire Safety Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to projects nationwide across a diverse range of sectors, including buildings, defence, and transport infrastructure.

In this role, you’ll gain hands-on experience in performance-based fire safety design, developing holistic strategies that protect people, buildings, and critical assets. Through mentorship and involvement in live projects, you’ll build a solid foundation in fire safety engineering and play a key role in shaping safer, more resilient environments.

Key Responsibilities

Scope

 Assess how fires start, spread, and impact structures and occupants.
 Apply scientific and engineering principles to reduce fire risk, protect people and assets, and ensure compliance with relevant building codes and standards.
 Utilise zone- and CFD modelling to conduct fire and smoke analyses, combined with pedestrian egress modelling, and risk assessments to inform fire safety strategies.
 Prepare technical documentation including fire engineering reports and drawings, outlining design solutions.


Who are you?

We’re looking for a motivated and curious graduate who is eager to build a career in fire safety engineering. To be successful in this role, you will hold a bachelor's or master's degree in e.g. Mechanical, Structural, Aerospace, Chemical, or a related engineering discipline. You will bring strong problem-solving and analytical skills, effective communication and interpersonal capability, and the ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.

Australian citizenship and eligibility to obtain required clearances are essential for this position.

About us

KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions business works with customers across the nation to plan, design and deliver smarter, safer and more sustainable infrastructure to meet the demands of the future for all Australians. We’re a team of over 1300 who deliver engineering, science and technology solutions across the water, transport, energy, sustainability, resources and defence sectors.

Please click the link below to learn more about Infrastructure Solutions Australia and the markets that we operate in.

Contents - Who we are

The perks

Industry leading salaries, reviewed annually
The opportunity to accrue an additional 8 hours of time off every 4 weeks

Salary continuance (Income protection)
Paid Professional Membership Fees
Life/Health insurance discounts
Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time)
End of trip facilities
Employee Stock Purchase Plans
Paid parental leave
Personal Career development plans
Growth and promotion opportunities

Our people are the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to creating work environments in which every member of our team of teams feels safe, supported, respected, trusted and valued, and where each person is given opportunities to belong, connect and grow.

title: Drainage Engineer
description:
Title:

Drainage Engineer

Our Purpose

We’re here to deliver better infrastructure for a better tomorrow.

By creating smart, future‑focused transport solutions, we connect people and places—across major cities, growing regions, and remote communities.

Our mission is simple: move people more safely and efficiently through innovative rail, road, bridge, and maritime projects. With sustainability at our core, we design with care for both people and the planet—helping communities thrive and shaping the cities of the future.

We’re not just improving the way people travel. We’re designing vibrant, connected spaces that respect culture, celebrate heritage, and bring communities together.

The Opportunity

As a Drainage Engineer, you’ll be integral to delivering some of Victoria’s most significant transport infrastructure projects. From major road upgrades to complex rail works, you’ll take ownership of drainage design across all project stages—planning, modelling, designing, and guiding delivery to the highest standards.

You’ll collaborate closely within multidisciplinary design teams, supporting projects from concept through to completion. Ensuring quality, safety, program, and budget requirements are met will be a part of your day‑to‑day, along with building strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders.

This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to high‑profile projects that will shape Australia’s transport networks for decades to come—while working alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the industry.

Who You Are

You’re a Drainage Engineer with proven experience across civil infrastructure projects. You understand the complexities of drainage design for road and transport environments, and you thrive in multidisciplinary, fast‑paced project settings.

Building trust with clients and stakeholders comes naturally, and you take pride in developing solutions that are technically sound, practical, and future‑focused.

You bring:

A degree in Civil Engineering (or equivalent)
Experience working on infrastructure projects with consultants, contractors, or government agencies
Strong technical design skills and competence in drainage modelling software
A solid understanding of relevant standards and guidelines (Austroads, State Transport Authorities, etc.)

What we do 

KBR’s Infrastructure Services team delivers projects that shape a smarter, more sustainable future for Australia. From transport and water to defence and buildings, we partner with clients nationwide to provide innovative solutions across every stage of the project lifecycle. 

With over 1200 skilled professionals, we combine global expertise with local insight. Our teams are digitally connected, agile, and committed to social and environmental sustainability—driving innovation that benefits communities and the planet. 

At KBR, we value you – here’s how 

At KBR, we value our people. While you’re busy delivering world-class engineering solutions, we make sure you have the flexibility and support to thrive. Enjoy family-friendly work arrangements, options for hybrid working, and a culture that prioritizes trust and collaboration. 

You’ll have access to ongoing professional development and the chance to work alongside some of the industry’s most respected experts. With the resources of a global organization and the close-knit feel of a local team, you’ll never be just a number. 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today! 

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: Principal Drainage Engineer
description:
Title:

Principal Drainage Engineer

Our Purpose

We’re here to deliver better infrastructure for a better tomorrow.

By designing smart, sustainable transport solutions, we connect people and places across Australia’s major cities, regional communities, and remote areas. Our mission is to move people more safely and efficiently through innovative rail, road, bridge, and maritime projects—always with sustainability at the forefront.

We design with care for people and the planet, creating vibrant, connected places that respect heritage, support community growth, and shape the cities of the future.

The Opportunity

As a Principal Drainage Engineer, you’ll play a critical leadership role in delivering some of Victoria’s most complex and high‑profile transport infrastructure projects.

You will act as the Drainage Lead on multidisciplinary projects—owning the technical direction, leading design development, and navigating complex engineering challenges to deliver robust, innovative drainage solutions across road, rail, and major infrastructure programs.

You’ll provide high‑level technical leadership, guide design teams, mentor senior and junior engineers, and oversee project delivery to meet quality, safety, budget, and timeline expectations. You will be a trusted advisor to clients, influencing decision‑making, shaping design strategy, and driving excellence across all stages of the project lifecycle.

This is a rare opportunity to take a strategic leadership role in projects that will define the future of Australia’s transport networks.

Who You Are

You’re an experienced Principal Drainage Engineer with deep technical expertise and a track record of leading complex drainage design on major civil infrastructure projects. You thrive in challenging environments, excel at navigating competing priorities, and bring confidence and clarity to multidisciplinary teams.

You understand how to lead others, guide clients, and deliver innovative, scalable drainage solutions that stand the test of time.

You bring:
A degree in Civil Engineering (or equivalent)
Significant experience delivering complex infrastructure projects with consultants, contractors, and government agencies
Demonstrated experience acting as a Drainage Lead on major road, rail, or transport programs
Advanced design capability and expertise in drainage and hydrology modelling software
Strong knowledge of relevant codes and guidelines (Austroads, State Transport Authority requirements, etc.)
Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status

What We Do

KBR’s Infrastructure Services team is building a smarter and more sustainable future for Australia. We deliver end‑to‑end solutions across transport, water, defence, and the built environment, partnering with clients nationwide throughout every stage of the project lifecycle.

With more than 1,200 specialists across the country, we combine global expertise with deep local knowledge. We’re digitally connected, agile, and committed to delivering social and environmental outcomes that benefit communities long into the future.

At KBR, We Value You

Our values define how we operate and how we support our people:
We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, and We Are a Team of Teams.

As you focus on leading high‑impact engineering solutions, we ensure you have the support, flexibility, and autonomy you need to thrive. Enjoy hybrid working options, family‑friendly arrangements, and a culture built on trust, empowerment, and collaboration.

At KBR, you’ll work alongside some of the industry’s most respected experts with the support of a global organisation—and the connected, supportive feel of a local team. Here, you’re not just part of the business; you’re integral to shaping its future.

KBR values an inclusive and diverse work environment, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.

title: Operational Safety, Suitability, and Effectiveness SME
description:
Title:

Operational Safety, Suitability, and Effectiveness SME

KBR is seeking an Operational Safety, Suitability, and Effectiveness (OSS&E) subject matter expert (SME) to join our team in Albuquerque, NM supporting the Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center (AFNWC).  An active DoD TS/SCI clearance is required.

The OSS&E SME will support, develop, and establish Operational Safety, Suitability and Effectiveness (OSS&E) Support capability for NDS and the full spectrum of B61-12+ and W80-1 and W80-4 related Programs.

Key Responsibilities:

Support, develop, and establish Operational Safety, Suitability and Effectiveness (OSS&E) Support capability for NDS and the full spectrum of B61-12+ and W80-1 and W80-4 related Programs.
Identify, assess, and prioritize OSS&E activities and required documentation across the entire NDS portfolio.
Quantify impacts and model different scenarios to enable the project team to proactively address potential challenges and to formulate robust weapon and equipment sustainment management plans.
Support AFNWC/NDS development and sustainment of the programs and processes that assure engineering rigor and discipline are applied to the TKA weapon subcomponent hardware during weapon system sustainment and aging surveillance test and evaluation (T&E).
Support AFNWC/NDS-managed TKA Test Variants and support equipment.

Qualifications:

Required:

An active TS/SCI clearance is required to be considered for this job, which is something only a U.S. citizen can obtain.
Be familiar with AFI 63-103 for Joint Nuclear Weapons Life Cycle Management, AFI 63-101/20-101 and AFMCI 63-1201 for Implementing OSS&E and Life Cycle Systems Engineering (LCSE).
Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of experience related to Nuclear Weapons Life Cycle management; an additional 4 years of experience can be substituted in lieu of the degree.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize activities by levels of importance and suspense dates.
Ability to work with a team of multi-disciplined specialists.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and proven ability to work effectively with all organizational levels, including a matrixed environment.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Title:

Administrative Assistant

Belong. Connect. Grow. Around here, we define the future. But we at KBR share one goal: to improve the world responsibly as a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers.

KBR is seeking an Administrative Assistant to join its talented team in Sioux Falls, South Dakota. KBR, headquartered in Houston, Texas, is the primary contractor to the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for performing work at the Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center (http://eros.usgs.gov/) near Sioux Falls, SD (http://www.siouxfalls.org).

Education: Education equivalent to graduation from an accredited college or university with an associate degree in office management, secretarial science or related field preferred. At least four (4) years of clerical and/or administrative assistant experience. Additional directly related experience may substitute for education at the rate of two years of experience equaling one year of education at the hiring manager’s discretion.

Experience: Minimum of two+ (2+) years, prefer four (4) years directly related professional experience

Job Description:

This position provides administrative support to the Technical Support Services Contract (TSSC) under the direction of the KBR Office Manager. The incumbent will provide administrative support to the assigned staff on the TSSC contract. This position requires excellent communication skills and high level of confidentiality; applies basic fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures to current work following USGS and KBR policies and procedures. General office duties are completed with professionalism and tact.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Maintain confidential information
Provide Administrative support to project meetings by starting Teams, taking notes and updating project software tools
Preparing/arranging travel (domestic and international), securing approvals, visas, country clearance, travel vouchers and reimbursements
Preparing presentations, agendas, reports, and memos
Develop/maintaining spreadsheets and databases
Writing/updating Administrative processes and procedures
Schedule meetings, answering calls, maintaining supplies, and distributing mail
Ability to provide Administrative support to 80+ TSSC contract staff members
Circulate paperwork or forms for proper approvals

Special Skills/Requirements:

Prior experience with maintaining confidential data/information highly desired
Proficient with Microsoft Office tools including PowerPoint, SharePoint, OneDrive, Word, and Excel
Possess effective oral and written communication skills, please submit a cover letter
Experience as a Government Contractor a plus
Must have self-confidence and interpersonal skills to effectively work with internal and external customers; exercises initiative and tact
Ability to work with a team of Administrative Assistants supporting over 450 TSSC Contract Staff as a primary Administrative Assistant as well as backing up the rest of the team
Position will be 40 hours per week, onsite at Earth Resources Observation Science Center (EROS)

Experience and/or Education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability to meet these requirements.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential
The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hire to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Title:

Software Engineer Intern

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

About Us
At KBR, we deliver science, technology, and engineering solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions.

Join us at the Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center and help shape the future of Earth science data systems. As part of our mission-driven team, you’ll contribute to projects that make a global impact, supporting research, innovation, and technology that empower scientists and decision-makers worldwide.

Position Overview
This summer-based internship is open to juniors, seniors, and graduate students pursuing a career in software development. You will work on-site at the EROS Center near Sioux Falls, South Dakota, and gain real-world experience in software engineering. Candidate must have three years of continuous residency in the U.S. for issuance of a Government Security credential.

Why You’ll Love This Role

• Work on meaningful projects that support Earth science and sustainability

• Collaborate with experienced engineers and mentors who are passionate about innovation

• Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge technologies in software development

• Be part of a team that values curiosity, creativity, and continuous learning

What You’ll Gain

• Practical experience with modern software development tools and methodologies

• Exposure to cloud technologies and data systems

• Mentorship from experienced engineers and opportunities for professional growth

• Insight into government contracting and mission-critical IT operations

Core Responsibilities
• Design and implement tasks required in the development of software products
• Communicate and coordinate activities and technical status with your mentor, supervisor, Project Lead, and other team members
• Ensure all software activities are conducted in accordance with standards and best practices
• Support software planning including requirements definition, activity identification, and estimating
• Perform and document preliminary and detailed design of software components
• Implement software from detailed designs
• Develop and conduct software testing
• Document the testing effort through generation of test plans, procedures, and reports
• Submit, analyze, and manage configuration change requests in accordance with CM processes
• Participate in code reviews

Education & Skills
• Working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or equivalent

Required Skills
• Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team
• Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle
• Experience using Python and C/C++
• Experience interfacing with database systems
• Unix/Linux experience

Desired Skills
This internship is designed to help you learn. Prior experience in all skills is not expected.
• Postgres experience
• Experience with remote sensing, digital image/signal processing techniques, and basic geography concepts such as map projections
• Experience with AWS Cloud Services (S3, EC2, EKS, ECR, Lambda)
• Experience with CI/CD
• Experience with Infrastructure as Code
• Experience with Artificial Intelligence for software code generation and documentation

Special Requirements
Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential. The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hiring to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account.

Experience and/or education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability.

title: Program Manager - Cyber Security
description:
Title:

Program Manager - Cyber Security

Program Manager

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Position Overview

Primary responsibility in this role will be planning and managing program resources to execute development projects or project components from design phase through implementation. Interpret market requirements and convert to program deliverables. Identify and communicate project scope and ensure program milestones and objectives are met. Ensure effective communication between technical and non-technical functions. Coordinate project schedules, monitor budgets, and recommend/assign tasks. Keep Leadership informed of key issues and changes which may impact on expected business results. Consult with senior staff members on technical issues.

Requirements:

Active TS/SCI or Q Clearance

Bachelor's degree

PMP Certification or FAC-P/PM Mid-Level in Program Management

10+ years’ experience in Program/Project Management roles, overseeing programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity

Direct experience in managing multi-task contracts and subcontracts of various types and complexity, as well as experience in leading a multi-vendor environment.

What You’ll Do

Work with the higher-level program manager, if applicable, to provide effective and efficient management.

Develop and manage the main program documentation such as the program initiation document.

Assist in the allocation of resources (staffing, facilities, and budgets) on the contract.

Review and propose the Integrated Program Baseline (or resources loaded schedule) to the customer.

Knowledge and handling of project and program management methodology and techniques.

Review and recommend approval and/or rework of all earned value, estimate to complete, funds and man-hour expenditure report, or other financial reports as appropriate.

Review risk and risk mitigation activities and recommend budgets for the same.

Prepare program status reviews and other formal reviews to be presented to the Government project director.

Review and recommend allocated management reserve within contractual limits.

Communicate issues and solutions to the government program director in a timely and transparent manner.

Ensure compliance with all regulatory and administrative requirements imposed by the contract in coordination with the contractors’ contracts staff.

Assist in the formulation, organization, monitoring inter-connected projects, coordinate cross-project activities.

Assist the government project manager by providing input to statutory acquisition reports and responses to Congressional Questions for the Record (QFRs).

Coordinate the preparation of Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) and value engineering proposals to the government project manager

Additional Qualifications:

Demonstrated experience in conducting requirements analysis, resource allocation, project costing, deliverable tracking, schedule and financial data monitoring, and reporting.

Have at least one (1) year of demonstrated experience in the management and control of funds and resources using complex reporting mechanisms such as Earned Value Management.

Knowledgeable of the guidelines provided by the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) and other appropriate polices.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development. 

Belong, Connect, and Grow at KBR

$137,900 - $237,300

This range is for the <District of Columbia> area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:
