title: Integration and Test Engineer
description:
Title:

Integration and Test Engineer

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Work Environment:

Location: Onsite

Travel Requirements: (Willing and able to travel (up to 25%, typically CONUS)

Working Hours: Standard

Responsibilities:

KBR provides innovative and cost-effective services and solutions to national security and industry customers. We are leading the way for national security and commercial space integration, developing innovative solutions to tomorrow's challenges today. We are seeking an individual for a position of Integration and Test Engineer in the MilSatcom arena. Position entails supporting our customer’s Government Furnished test equipment to industry contractors. Customer is MIT Lincoln Laboratory (MIT LL). As a representative of MIT LL, you will install, maintain, sustain and train on use of equipment. With use of equipment by contractors, you will provide Subject Matter Expert support in their system integration and testing. Part of tasking will entail supporting technical exchange meetings, test planning, procedure reviews, and providing technical reports to management and our MIT LL customer. This position requires the candidate to have an active DoD secret clearance.

Duties to include:

Install, configure and operate MIT LL test equipment at contractor facilities

Support contractor integration and testing activities as MIT LL representative

Troubleshooting of issues during integration and testing

Detailed reporting of issues back to MIT LL and coordinating of resolution

Perform periodic maintenance on customer equipment at contractor sites

May require travel to MIT LL at Lexington, Massachusetts for internal testing and training

May also require other travel to industry contractor locations, mostly in CONUS

Required:

Active DoD secret clearance

A minimum of 10 years of Experience in system-level integration of software and hardware components to test and validate system performance with specific experience in MILSATCOM systems

Familiarity with one or more of the following: MILSTAR, AEHF,EPS, ESS

Knowledge of use of RF equipment; O-scope, spectrum analyzer and bit error testers

Good oral and communication skills

Willing and able to travel (up to 25%, typically CONUS)

Outgoing and energetic with the ability to work within a team environment

Bachelors Degree

Desired:

Familiarity with MILSATCOM protocols and procedures

Familiarity with JAVA, C, and / or C++ 

Possess strong oral and written communications skills, and must be able to present findings/results to internal and external organizations

BS Degree in EE or CS fields

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40

Salary Compensation for the California area for this position: $150,000-$180,000

title: Director, Corporate FP&A
description:
Title:

Director, Corporate FP&A

KBR — Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.

KBR is a global leader in delivering technology-driven, mission-critical, and sustainable solutions that truly matter. With nearly 38,000 talented people operating in more than 80 countries, we thrive on a culture built on safety, integrity, and teamwork. At KBR, we empower our people to solve the world’s toughest challenges and create lasting value for communities and the planet. We don’t just deliver results, we deliver game-changing solutions, innovative technology, deep domain expertise, and cutting-edge technologies.

KBR is seeking a dynamic and strategic Director, Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) in Houston, TX to lead the corporate FP&A function. Reporting to the Vice President of FP&A, you will serve as a key partner to the CFO and CEO, shaping enterprise-wide financial strategy and driving transformation across the organization. You will lead a high-performing team, including a manager and analyst, with matrix responsibility for broader business unit FP&A teams, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and championing analytics and process automation. This position follows a hybrid schedule, with three days per week in the office.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership: Set the vision and direction for the FP&A function, driving enterprise-wide financial transformation and influencing executive decision-making. Lead and develop a team of managers, analysts, and business intelligence professionals (direct and matrix reporting lines).
Monthly Financial Performance: Oversee comprehensive analyses and review detailed reports on monthly financial performance, highlighting key variances to budget and forecast, and identifying trends to inform decision-making. Produce accurate and timely financial reports and dashboards for senior management and the Board of Directors.
Forecasting & Budgeting: Lead global periodic forecasting and annual budgeting processes, consolidating business forecasts, identifying significant variances, and outlining risks and opportunities. Contribute to long-term strategic planning through financial projections and scenario analyses.
Analytics & Automation: Champion the adoption of predictive and driver-based forecasting, leveraging advanced analytics, automation (RPA, AI tools), and modern BI platforms (Power BI) to deliver actionable insights. Lead finance transformation initiatives to modernize reporting, streamline processes, and enable data-driven decision-making.
Business Partnership: Act as a strategic advisor and business partner to senior executives and department heads, providing financial guidance and supporting key business initiatives. Collaborate cross-functionally to drive business performance and growth.
Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate financial results and strategic insights to key stakeholders, including the CFO, CEO, and senior management, through presentations and education of non-financial stakeholders.
Investor Relations: Provide support to investor relations for quarterly earnings calls and ad-hoc investor webcasts and events.
M&A Activities: Develop financial models and scenario analyses to assess business transactions and strategic initiatives.
FP&A Leadership and Mentorship: Serve as the liaison with business unit FP&A teams, driving engagement, standardization, and alignment across the global FP&A organization. Foster an inclusive team culture and support diversity in hiring, development, and advancement.

Basic Qualifications

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field; MBA, CPA, CMA, or CFA preferred
10+ years of progressive experience in financial planning and analysis, including at least 3-5 years in a management role
Experience in a corporate finance role within a large, public organization is highly desirable 

Financial Expertise & Leadership:

Strong proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and budgeting, with demonstrated ability to deliver actionable insights
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of synthesizing complex data into strategic recommendations
Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to convey financial information clearly to non-financial stakeholders
Proven leadership and team management abilities, with experience building and developing high-performing teams
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and advanced FP&A tools such as Oracle EPM Cloud (FCCS and Planning), Costpoint, MS Dynamics, and modern BI platforms (Power BI)
Strong business acumen and results-oriented mindset, focused on driving organizational impact
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment
Proactive and innovative approach to problem-solving and process improvement
Commitment to ongoing professional development and continuous learning

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits, which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Network Architect
description:
Title:

Senior Network Architect

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.
The JMETC Network Architect provides a well-rounded System Engineering approach in the design and performance of the Joint Mission Environment Test Capability (JMETC) Networks.
Responsibilities include design, build, and manage computer and information networks, such as local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), and cloud infrastructures including planning network designs, researching new technologies, ensuring network security, overseeing implementation, and upgrading hardware and software to meet operational requirements.
Works with government, contractors, industry, and customers to provide Network collaborative services. 
Provides technical direction for interconnecting distributed test and development laboratory enclaves, cloud connections, network peering, and remote site connectivity.
Coordinates technical support with JMETC test customers, JMETC Systems Control (SYSCON), Network Operations and Security Centers, and Cyber Security teams.  
Experienced in DoD Network management, common network troubleshooting tools and techniques. 
Works with customers to ensure the availability of the network and networked service adequately support distributed test events. 
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet the eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
The JMETC program, located in Arlington, VA is focused on developing and deploying the processes, architecture, and middleware to facilitate cost effective integration of Live, Virtual, and Constructive (LVC) entities needed to support the DoD acquisition community testing needs utilizing a distributed testing approach. 
JMETC will be integral to testing systems-of-systems applications within a realistic joint mission construct.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Technical Bachelor's Degree
Minimum of 10 years’ experience
Experience working with DoD Wide Area Networks and familiarity with various network architectures, multicast data flows, and common protocols
Coordination, Communication and Presentation skills
Cisco and Juniper Network certifications
Active Secret Clearance with the Ability to obtain TS/SCI
Ability to travel up to 25%
Extensive layer 2/3 experience
Network Design
Security Management
Deployment and Testing
Performance Optimization
Troubleshooting
Documentation

Preferred Qualifications:

Security Certification CISM or CISSP
VoIP / Call manager infrastructure design and troubleshooting experience
Distributed Test and or Training Experience
Modeling and Simulation (M&S)
Live, Virtual and Constructive (LVC) Environments
Test Analysis and Test Planning
DREN, SDREN and DISN engineering experience
DoD Programs and Acquisition process
Testing in Distributed Exercises/Events
Windows Server and Red Hat systems administration experience / certifications
Experience in VMware environments
Cisco Next Generation Firewalls

title: Senior Network Administrator
description:
Title:

Senior Network Administrator

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The successful candidate will Provide Network Engineering support to the Test Resource Management Center’s (TRMC) All Domain Test Range (ADTR) and INDOPACOM Pacific-Rim Multi-Domain Training and Experimentation Capability Team, Joint Mission Environment Test Capability (JMETC) Secret Network (JSN) Node, JMETC Multiple Independent Levels of Security Network (JMN) Node, Secret Defense Research and Engineering Network (SDREN), Defense Research and Engineering Network (DREN).

As a Network Engineer, you will be a critical part of our team responsible for evaluating customer requirements on complex technical challenges. You will aid by providing solutions to complex problems in a manner which meets both functional and security requirements. You will handle keeping the team’s testing infrastructure operational and in compliance with all TRMC directives and applicable RMF requirements. To do this you will often work with other distributed team members to discuss current system status and desired future enhancements.

Minimum Qualifications:

MUST have an ACTIVE Top Secret SCI Clearance
Education: Technical bachelor's degree (experience may be substituted in lieu of degree)
Minimum of 10 years' experience to include the following:
DoD Testing and Training Ranges,
Military Instrumentation Systems Data Analysis
Experience working with DoD Wide Area Networks and familiarity with various network architectures, multicast data flows, and common protocols to include:
Experience working with Defense Research and Engineering Network (DREN)
Experience working with the Secret Defense Research and Engineering Network (SDREN)
Able to lift to 35 lbs.
Willing to travel up to 50%

Desired Qualifications:

Modeling and Simulation (M&S)
Live, Virtual and Constructive (LVC) Environments
Test Analysis and Test Planning
Testing in Distributed Exercises/Events
Cisco and / or Juniper Network certifications
Cisco Next Generation Firewall
Experience supporting systems within a DoD Risk management Framework (RMF) accredited environment
DoD 8570 certifications (Security+ or equivalent)
SIEM (Splunk, SolarWinds, etc.)
Strong documentation skills (Writing SOPs, Creating Networking Diagrams) Coordination, Communication and Presentation skills

Basic Compensation:

$140,000 to $165,000

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Process Safety Engineer
description:
Title:

Process Safety Engineer

Job Responsibilities:

Under supervision or independently, carry out design safety philosophies, specifications for fire protection systems (active and passive), and data sheets for firefighting systems.

Develop UFDs and P&IDs for the fire protection systems and carry out fire water/foam demand calculations (including gas suppression systems) and firewater system hydraulic check analysis.

Prepare hazardous area classification source release schedules/reports and their drawings, fire zone drawings, safety and fire fighting, life-saving equipment layouts, escape route drawings, safety signs drawings, firefighting nozzle coverage shadow drawings, etc.

Support in reviewing/consolidating comments and coordinating third party studies, including FERA, dispersion analysis, EERA, ESSA, dropped objects study, TRIA, ship collision study, QRA studies, etc. (not limited to).

Assist in the preparation of active and passive fire protection, lifesaving, and safety signs packages (including preparing requisitions, datasheets, TBE, etc.) and PFP schedule documents.

Support in TBE and vendor document reviews in Mechanical/Electrical/Instrument packages on safety (including HFE) aspects.

Assist with safety inputs, including ergonomics/Human Factors Engineering for projects, as required.

Interface/coordinate with other Engineering disciplines to resolve technical matters related to safety aspects.

Interact/coordinate with Designers and provide inputs for Safety layout preparations for projects, as required.

Job Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent from an accredited university.

Minimum of 3 years of HSE Engineering experience in the Oil and Gas industry, specifically in Process Safety/Technical Safety.

Involved in design projects for offshore (FPSO/Platforms) or onshore (Refineries, LNG facilities, Storage terminals, etc.).

Possess good knowledge of Oil & Gas facilities, local and international regulatory codes and standards, and the ability to influence designs to achieve optimal HSE outcomes.

Familiarity with plot plan reviews, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL classification/verification, and other Safety reviews (e.g., SIMOPS, ALARP) is preferred.

Working knowledge of local/owner's safety regulations for Singapore projects will be an added value.

Good working knowledge in PIPENET Vision, Flaresim, and other consequence modeling software such as DNV PHAST, etc., is preferred.

title: Senior Principal Process Safety Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Principal Process Safety Engineer

Job Responsibilities:

Carry out Design Safety Philosophy, HSE Plan, and specifications for fire protection systems (active and passive), HFE, etc.

Participate in Process Hazard reviews and analysis, including HAZOP/HAZID/SIL studies, and be responsible for actions close-out.

Lead the HAZOP/HAZID/SIL workshops and other Safety/HFE workshops (e, g., SIMOPS, ALARP, SCTA, VCA. etc).

Responsible for reviewing third party safety studies, including FERA, dispersion analysis, EERA, ESSA, dropped objects study, QRA studies, etc. (not limited to).

Carry out similar safety studies independently, as required.

Carry out independent design of active and passive fire protection systems and prepare Hazardous/H2S area classification documentation, safety and fire fighting layouts, escape route and life-saving equipment layouts, and other safety drawings.

Carry out/lead safety critical elements performance standards, RAM, fire and gas detection mapping, etc., based on project requirements.

Act as Package Engineer for safety and firefighting, lifesaving equipment.

Manage and guide safety team engineers and designers on Concept/FEED/Detailed Engineering projects.

Provide health and environmental inputs (including health risk assessments such as chemical exposure, noise and lighting, ergonomics/Human Factors Engineering, environmental impact assessments, etc.) to projects.

Interface/coordinate with other Engineering disciplines and clients and take the lead in resolving technical matters related to safety aspects.

Able to deliver project safety deliverables as per project schedule.

Provide inputs and support to projects in all safety aspects, including progress reports.

Job Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent from an accredited university.

Minimum of 15 years of HSE engineering experience in the Oil and Gas industry, in process safety/technical safety, and has worked a minimum of 4-5 years in a Lead position on similar projects.

Involved in design projects for offshore (FPSO/Platforms) and onshore (Refineries, LNG facilities, Storage terminals, etc.).

Should have worked on a minimum number of offshore projects (FPSO/Platforms).

Possess good knowledge of Oil and Gas process facilities, local and international process safety codes and standards, and regulatory/marine codes and standards (MODU, SOLAS, DNV/Lloyds Register).

Should have hands-on experience in plot plan review, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL classification/verification, and other safety reviews (e.g., SIMOPS, ALARP).

Good working knowledge of PIPENET Vision, Flaresim, and other consequence modeling software such as DNV PHAST, etc., is needed.

Ability to influence designs to achieve optimal HSE outcomes.

A team player with leadership potential and proactive inter-discipline communication skills.

title: Enterprise Infrastructure Systems Administrator
description:
Title:

Enterprise Infrastructure Systems Administrator

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR has an immediate need for an energetic and dynamic Enterprise Infrastructure Systems Administrator in support of the United States Geological Survey (USGS) Earth Resources Observation & Science (EROS) Center (http://eros.usgs.gov/) near Sioux Falls, SD (http://www.siouxfalls.org). 

The EROS Information Technology Services Division (ITSD) is seeking an Enterprise Infrastructure Systems Administrator to join a diverse and highly skilled team. This role leads technical operations across both Windows and Unix/Linux environments (with a primary focus on Linux). The ideal candidate will demonstrate leadership, mentorship, and deep technical expertise in managing on-premises, virtual, and cloud-based systems.

You will be responsible for the full lifecycle of IT systems and services—including deployment, configuration, maintenance, and decommissioning. This position emphasizes security, automation, and continuous improvement, while also fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing within the team.

*** Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a 

Government Security credential ***

Education:             Minimum of an AA in Computer Science; BS/BA preferred.   

Experience:            Minimum of six years of directly related technical, professional experience required. 

Essential Job Functions:

Lead and support the administration of Linux (RHEL, OEL, Rocky) and Windows environments.
Configure, maintain, and monitor physical and virtual servers, containers, and specialized software.
Perform system maintenance, patching, and vulnerability remediation to ensure a secure and stable environment.
Troubleshoot and resolve system issues using diagnostic tools and root cause analysis.
Manage user access controls and system security settings.
Develop and maintain technical documentation, including SOPs and system configurations.
Serve as a technical lead on IT projects, from design through implementation and post-deployment support.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated IT solutions.
Mentor junior staff and contribute to team development and knowledge sharing.

Required Skills: 

Associate degree in Computer Science or related field (Bachelor’s preferred).
Minimum of 6 years of directly related technical experience.
Strong working knowledge of Linux (RHEL, OEL, Rocky) and Windows operating systems.
Experience with server, application, and container provisioning and automation.
Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) and data formats (e.g., JSON, YAML).
Familiarity with IaC/CaC tools (e.g., Ansible, SaltStack, Terraform).
Experience with virtualization and container platforms (e.g., VMware vSphere, NetApp, Kubernetes, Docker).
Solid understanding of security practices, incident/problem management, and monitoring tools.
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, leadership, and communication skills.

Other Desired Skills: 

Certifications such as RHCSA, VCP, AWS, Azure, or ITIL v3/v4 Foundation.
Experience with tools like Jira (Agile/Scrum), BMC Remedy, SolarWinds, Splunk, Nlyte DCIM.
Awareness or experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with code debugging tools and techniques.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS

Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential
The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hiring to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account

Experience and/or Education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability to meet these requirements.

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: FMS Analyst
description:
Title:

FMS Analyst

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of Defense, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

Join a dynamic team supporting the U.S. Army’s Integrated Fires and Mission Command Office. As a Foreign Military Sales Analyst, you’ll play a key role in advancing international defense partnerships through technical and programmatic expertise in missile systems and acquisition planning.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Technical & Program Analysis

Conduct technical assessments to support FMS acquisition planning and execution.
Analyze missile system hardware to inform training, delivery schedules, and system modifications.
Collect and interpret technical data to identify and resolve issues independently or collaboratively.

Documentation & Compliance

Develop and maintain acquisition documents including Travel Data Sheets, IMS, SOW, CDRL, CWBS.
Ensure compliance with FAR, DFARS, and Other Transaction Authorities (OTA) through research and analysis.

Stakeholder Engagement

Liaise regularly with internal and external stakeholders to resolve program-related issues.
Prepare and support meetings, working groups, and conferences with reports, briefings, and minutes.

Lifecycle & Case Management

Support all phases of the FMS case lifecycle: pre-case development, execution, reconciliation, and closure.
Assist in the development of Letters of Request (LOR), Letters of Offer and Acceptance (LOA), and Price & Availability (P&A) documentation.
Monitor program activities across lifecycle phases: requirements, design, testing, production, fielding, and operations.

Additional Duties:

Track project milestones and conduct after-action reviews to identify process improvements.
Support strategic planning, Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs), and Prime Item Development Specifications.
Assist in contract development, technical evaluations, and briefing preparation.
Maintain program execution tracking using systems such as DSAMS, CISIL, and SCIP.
Present technical and numerical data effectively in written and verbal formats.

Basic Qualifications 

U.S. Citizenship and eligibility for a Final Secret Clearance are required.
Bachelor’s degree with 5–12 years of experience in Security Assistance or a related field.
In lieu of a degree, up to 12 years of relevant experience may be considered.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with DoD weapons and missile systems.
Prior experience in FMS acquisition and contracting is highly desirable.
Familiarity with program management principles, practices, and procedures.
Proven ability to adapt to shifting priorities, timelines, and demands.
Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

description:
Title:

Rigger

Rigger
CRIG07 - Rigger

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Responsibilities:

Check loads to be moved, estimate size, shape, weight and center of gravity, and make sure that loads do not exceed lifting capacities of cranes.

Attach lifting devices to hoisting equipment and items to be moved, using clamps, hooks, bolts, and knots

Choose/Select the proper slings, lifting gears and other grappling devices, covering sharp corners with padding to prevent damage to slings.

Continually alert for people, or objects which may come in the path of the load, where the load is not visible to crane or winch operators, hand signals, whistles or two-way radios are used.

Guide loads into position as they are lowered.

Lifting and shifting/moving Heavy equipment, large size pipes and control valves etc. with very large capacity cranes size up to 500T.

Secondary (12 years) certificate. Preferably ITI (Industrial Training Institute) certificate holder

07 years relevant and hands-on experience in Oil & Gas/Petrochemical/Fertilizer industry and competency*

Valid Rigging certificate from competent and certified agency

title: Lead Flow Assurance Engineer
location:
locations
Corniche, Al Khobar, Eastern Region, Saudi Arabia
description:
Title:

Lead Flow Assurance Engineer

Overall Summary

Lead Flow Assurance Engineer with proven experience in the design of pipelines, utilities and offsite piping system /pipeline from conceptual stage through detailed design of medium to large size projects. Thorough knowledge of projects/process  & flow assurance engineering practices, economics principles, calculation methods, international standards, codes, specifications, and procedures. Minimum 15 years’ experience in Oil & Gas, Hydrocarbons, and/or Infrastructure industries. Excellent communication skills required.

Responsibilities:

Has demonstrated experience in pipeline flow assurance and hydraulic calculations. Has been working as a pipeline simulation engineer. Knowledge of project engineering practices, international codes, standards, procedures, and specifications.

Good Experience in steady-state and transient hydraulic analyses using industry standard software like SPS, PIPENET and PIPESIM.
Have the capability to use other Process tools like HYSYS, PVTSIM, and Multiflash.
Review and approve process deliverables (PFDs, P&IDs, Design Basis, Process Narratives, Process Calculations, Equipment Specification documents, etc)
Experience in performing surge analysis on liquid lines using simulation tools like SPS.
Have full capability to design surge protection systems.
Have full capability to of simulating gas networks.
Must be able to demonstrate experience in single and multiphase pipelines hydraulic simulation.
Familiar with applicable regulations, codes and standards.
GCC experience particularly Saudi Aramco experience will be preferred.
Work independently and create a positive work environment.
Experience with firewater demand calculations and equipment requirements, industrial drainage design and equipment, familiarity with the associated Saudi Aramco standards and NFPA requirements are desirable.
Provide technical leadership to ensure that applicable procedures and standards (client, KBR and international) are correctly applied.
Must be proficient in English, oral and written.
Excellent technical presentation skills required.

Qualifications & Years Of Experience:

Bachelor's degree in chemical engineering
15 years’ experience in process and flow assurance.
Candidates must hold an Engineering Degree Qualification or equivalent from a government recognized institution.

title: Specialist Logistics Marine Engineer (Offshore Topside Project) – Offshore Rotation 6 weeks on / 3 weeks off x 2
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Specialist Logistics Marine Engineer (Offshore Topside Project) – Offshore Rotation 6 weeks on / 3 weeks off x 2

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise.

KBR Abu Dhabi is currently looking to fill a PMC role for Specialist Logistics Marine Engineer for an Offshore project to be based in Offshore site location (6 weeks on / 3 weeks off).

Profile matching below criteria only will be contacted.

Job Overview

The Specialist Logistics Marine Engineer is responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing offshore logistics operations to support marine engineering projects. This role ensures the safe, efficient, and compliant movement of personnel, equipment, and materials across offshore platforms, vessels, and supply bases.

Requirements

B.Sc. in an Engineering discipline, Supply chain or equivalent degree.
Minimum 15 years’ experience within the oil gas industry more so in material management &supply chain logistics, engineering, drilling, project management. With minimum 5 years in a middle management position in a high velocity project management environment.
High Planning, Analytical & problem solving.
Good Leadership, communication skills and ability to lead and manage teams.
Computer skills, exposure to SCM ERP modules will be a distinct advantage.

Key Responsibilities

Subject matter expert on all contractual matters relating to Logistics as outlined in the EPC / Company contract for services.

Review and monitor Contractor Project Logistics Deliverables (plans, procedures, manpower requirements, schedules, sub-contracts, etc.) and ensure compliance with Company safety, quality, cost & schedule requirements.

Review and monitor Contractor material procurement status reports to ensure schedule integrity.

Ensure Contractors strictly adhere to Company customs clearance procedures for all material entering UAE.

Identify all over-dimensional / heavy lift materials (i.e. modules) requiring specific handling procedures, permits, and special permissions to transport and receive at artificial islands. Ensure resources are properly allocated to special activities (i.e. module loadouts)

Ensure regular contact is maintained with the islands and marine team is kept informed and updated on any planned marine movements in the fields and that meteorological information is dispatched regularly to islands and vessels.

Review and evaluate ITT technical specifications and scope of works for all Transportation and Logistics sections of various contracts. Provide suitable recommendations for optimization.

Coordinates with EPC and Drilling Operations logistics team to ensure overlapping activities are minimized.

Demonstrates Safety Leadership – responsible for HSE system implementation.

Ensure Risk Assessments are scheduled by Contractor in line to execution plans and before mobilization approvals and ensure appropriate Company personnel are in attendance.

Work in line with HSE Policy and ensure awareness and compliance of HSE rules and regulations by subordinates.

Monitor and report on EPC Contractor vessel fleet (materials, personnel, modules)

Review and monitor Contractor on-island Logistics Procedures ensuring optimal usage of harbor berths, lay down areas, and effective and safe movement of machinery, materials, and personnel on the islands.

Ensure that the new supply lines for artificial island project are Fit for Purpose, ready for use when required, highly reliable, resilient to disruption and efficient.

On Island Activities

Manage and supervise the Material Handling, Transportation & Vehicle Maintenance Services Contractor on the islands, ensuring the safe and efficient handling of materials and equipment whilst minimizing the financial impact on the COMPANY. Ensure maintenance schedules are adhered to and maintenance procedures are acceptable, properly maintained and up to date, with no environmental impact.

Monitor and manage the Catering Contractor. Ensure a high standard of food preparation, menu quality and variation. Ensures that the waste management policy is adhered to, and a high standard of hygiene and housekeeping is maintained.

Regularly Monitor and inspect accommodation and other facilities ensuring that the highest standards are maintained.

Monitor and analyze Harbor House functionality. Implement change management for any possible improvement/optimization. 

Ensure that all preventive maintenance and repairs records are up to date, procedures applied conform to manufacturer requirements, and that all non-process facilities are maintained to high standards.

Implement and manage the efficient shipping of waste from the islands to meet with the HSE policies of the Company and International Standards. When necessary, modifies the procedures to meet new and unforeseen threats caused by hazardous waste.
skills: B.Sc. in an Engineering discipline, Supply chain or equivalent degree.

Good Leadership, communication skills and ability to lead and manage teams.

title: UABOS Spain LN: Utilities Craftsman
description:
Title:

UABOS Spain LN: Utilities Craftsman

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.

Job Summary

Join our team as a Utilities Craftsman, where your experience and dedication meet purpose.  Duties will include, install, maintain, troubleshoot, water and drainage systems, according to specifications and plumbing codes. Maintain water and wastewater treatment facilities to meet operational requirements.  You will ensure the safety of each team member and in addition, you are responsible for safeguarding assigned tools, equipment, and other resources efficiently.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Perform maintenance and repair of equipment associated with utility, water and plumbing systems.
Perform maintenance on the water distribution system on a daily, weekly, monthly, bi-monthly, semi-annual, annual, or as needed basis.
Inspect, monitor, troubleshoot, performance test fire hydrants and document work and maintenance performed on the potable and non-potable distribution system.
Install, maintain, repair, modify, and troubleshoot equipment including pumps, valves, motors, meters, tanks, reservoirs, and feeders.
Repairs all types of water and sewer lines both inside and outside buildings.
Cuts and threads pipe, using pipe cutters, cutting torch, and pipe threading machine.
Bends pipe to required angle by use of pipe-bending machine or by placing pipe over block and bending it by hand.
Install, troubleshoot, repair and replace all types of plumbing fixtures, such as sinks, toilets, urinals, flush valves, bathtubs, faucets, water heaters, hot water tanks, garbage disposals, and dishwashers.
Troubleshoot and repair pertinent fire protection equipment. Repair or replace defective components when needed.
Perform tasks to ensure on-time and accurate work completion in accordance with Performance Work Statement requirements, blueprints/drawings and written instructions.
Read and interpret electrical and electronic schematic wiring diagrams, manufactures’ literature, and standard operating procedures.
Maintain inventory of supplies, parts, tools, and equipment as applicable.
Participate and actively ensure the safety of all KBR employees.
Daily use of a computer.

Basic Qualifications 

Must have technical school completion or equivalent.
Must have at least 5 years of trade related work experience.
Advanced knowledge of applicable plumbing codes and public water compliance
Basic knowledge of the mechanics of operation of equipment such as pumps, boilers, heaters and other plumbing components.
Must have ability to communicate in native language, and proficient in English to perform assigned duties.
Must possess a Spanish Class ‘B’ driver’s license.

Preferred Qualifications

English Reading Level II, Written Level II, Verbal Level II.

KBR Benefits

Local Nationals (LN) personnel will receive benefits in accordance with the collective bargaining agreement (CBA) within the appropriate country location where they reside. KBR supports career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Electrical Engineer

Due to continued growth, KBR Perth is seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer with experience in infrastructure (transport, port, defence and resources) to lead and contribute to design and implementation projects across Australia.

This role will suit a Senior Electrical Engineer who thrives in a collaborative, high‑performance environment. You will work closely with cross‑functional teams to deliver concept and detailed designs, provide construction support, and contribute to effective design management. You will apply relevant engineering standards, identify new opportunities, and champion continuous improvement initiatives.

Success in this position requires the ability to work efficiently in a fast‑paced environment, prioritise multiple projects simultaneously, and communicate effectively while fostering a cooperative and solutions‑focused approach with colleagues, partners and stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

Engage in engineering projects, including concept, detailed design, construction support and commissioning related to the electrical discipline.

Develop and review electrical designs for LV power system (e.g. Single lines, schematics, layout, GA, cable/equipment schedules).

Develop engineering documents including scopes of works, calculation, drawings mark-ups, datasheets, calculation, design report etc.

Interfacing with multidisciplinary internal/external project team, client and supplier to ensure compliance against relevant standards, project’s basis of design document and functional specification.

Involve in tender process for preparing bid documents, identifying deliverable list and bid proposal.

Skills & Experience Required:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering.

Seeking candidates with over 8 years of professional electrical engineering experience in consultancy, utilities, mining, or resources sectors.

Previous experience with power distribution designs including switchboards, distribution earthing/bonding, cable sizing and load assessments.

Ability to perform power system analysis (i.e. load flow, fault level, protection and Arc Flash studies utilising ETAP or PTW electrical software to assist with general electrical designs.

Previous experience with lighting design for transport or public infrastructure and exposure to transport ITS design & integration (i.e. field devices, comms, networking fundamentals, cabinet design, and power) is advantageous.

Familiarity with rail electrical design, standards and regulations for LV power, lighting, and ancillary systems is desirable but not essential.

Design knowledge of applicable codes and standards (both Australian and international).

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, able to effectively communicate and work with team members, clients, internal and external stakeholders.

Applicants must currently reside in Australia and hold Australian permanent residency or citizenship.

Why Join Us?

At KBR, you’ll be part of a forward‑thinking team delivering some of Australia’s most complex infrastructure projects. We’re investing in the future of Australia — and you’ll be at the heart of it. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful, high‑impact work that shapes critical national infrastructure, leaving a lasting legacy.

We support flexible work arrangements that promote balance and wellbeing, and we offer ongoing professional development pathways, including support toward Chartered status.

KBR Values:

Our KBR Values — We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, We Are a Team of Teams — reflect our people‑centric culture and the way we work. Our strong organisational culture and genuine focus on our people are key drivers of our success, and we’d love you to be part of that journey.

Help shape tomorrow by applying today!

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: Project Digitalization Manager
description:
Title:

Project Digitalization Manager

The Project Digitalization Manager is responsible for leading all digitalization functions within the project, including the design and implementation of digital and AI solutions. This role ensures seamless integration of digital technologies across the project lifecycle, driving efficiency, compliance, and innovation while maintaining the contractual scope.

Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for Project Digitialization functions and design of all digital and AI solutions including, but not limited to:

Strategic Planning & Governance

Develop comprehensive digital implementation plans aligned with overall project scope, including:

Execution Plans & Procedures

Schedules

Requisitions

Vendor Evaluation Reports

Workshop Reports

Testing & Training Plans

RACI Matrices

Establish and maintain cybersecurity standards in collaboration with the client.

Ensure cybersecurity controls are implemented across all digital solutions.

Lead a team of Digital specialists in various domains such as Engineering, Construction, commissioning, CMMS, Well Testing, Flow Assurance and oversee their activities

Solution Design & Implementation

Lead workshops to review project specifications for digital and AI solutions; document outcomes and action items.

Develop requisitions and technical bid evaluations (TBE) for Digital System Integrator (DSI) and other digital vendors.

Manage DSI scope and performance throughout the project lifecycle.

Develop interface management plans and coordinate with stakeholders to identify interfaces for existing and new digital solutions.

Develop data collection templates for Data FEED to various Digital Solutions & Interfaces.

Implement staging environments for solution build & testing.                                                         

Stakeholder Management

Act as the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) between the company, contractors, Digital System Integrator (DSI), and vendors.

Drive vendor evaluation and selection processes for digital solutions.

Lifecycle Management

Oversee digital solution activities across all project phases:

Evaluation & Implementation Phase

Design Phase (Data Collection, Functional Design, Detailed Design)

Build Phase

Factory Acceptance Testing (FAT)

Site Commissioning

Site Acceptance Testing (SAT)

Integrated SAT (iSAT)

As-Built and Go-Live Phase

Testing & Training

Reporting & Analytics

Develop dashboard status reports and detailed digital solution progress reports.

Monitor KPIs and ensure timely delivery of digital milestones."                                              

                                                         

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Information Technology, or related field

Minimum 20 years of experience, 3 of which should be in management

Proven experience in digitalization within large-scale Oil & Gas projects including EPC Digital Twin, O&M Digital Twin and AI Technologies but not limited to:

IT, AI solutions, data management, and cybersecurity standards.

Execution plans, RACI matrices, and interface management.

Stakeholder management and communication skills.

Project lifecycle phases and digital solution integration.

Systemic Understanding/Implementation of Digital Project Execution.

Domain expertise in Oil and Gas EPC/O&M Digital Twin Development and other digital applications like Real time Flow assurance Monitoring, Well Testing, Robotics, AR, VR etc

Good Understanding of Information Technology aspects in Oil and Gas Domain

Good Understanding of Cybersecurity in Information & Operational Technology space.

Good Knowledge on Cybersecurity standards like IEC62443

Good People Management skills

Have managed System Integrators, multiple IT/Digital vendors in projects

Hands on experience in using /implementing Digital solutions

Hands on Experience in Applications like Aveva PI, Cognite Fusion etc

Hands on Experience in managing Digital Design Workshops

description:
Title:

Structural Modeller

KBR continued its strong growth throughout 2025, securing major Defence and infrastructure programs—and we’re set for even greater momentum in 2026. As our Structural team expands, we’re looking for a skilled Structural Modeller to support the delivery of high‑impact Defence and building projects. While Adelaide is the preferred location, we are also open to candidates based in our Perth or Sydney offices.

The Opportunity:

As our Structural Modeller, you’ll be responsible for producing accurate, detailed structural models and documentation that underpin some of South Australia’s most significant Defence and infrastructure projects. You’ll independently manage modelling tasks, support project delivery, and collaborate closely with engineers and multidisciplinary teams.

You’ll also have opportunities to lead smaller modelling packages, guide graduate modellers, and represent KBR within industry networks—while developing your own BIM and Revit capability in a supportive, growing team.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Develop and maintain accurate Revit models and documentation for structural components

Deliver modelling outputs within agreed budgets, timeframes, and technical standards

Lead small modelling packages or workstreams, coordinating deliverables and resources

Provide technical guidance and support to graduate modellers

Collaborate with engineers and multidisciplinary teams to ensure coordinated project delivery

Prepare and present modelling outputs to clients, stakeholders, and internal teams

Maintain strong, professional communication with clients and project partners

Participate in industry events and maintain active professional networks

Stay current with BIM technologies, industry standards, and modelling best practices

Contribute technical insights to business development activities and client engagement

What You’ll Bring:

Diploma in Drafting, Building Design, or a related discipline

Strong proficiency in Autodesk Revit and BIM workflows

Understanding of structural detailing standards and relevant Australian codes

Familiarity with model coordination, clash detection, and document control processes

A minimum of 3 years’ structural modelling experience in building and/or Defence environments

Proven ability to independently produce accurate, high‑quality Revit models and documentation

Strong verbal and written communication skills

High attention to detail and ability to manage competing priorities

Proactive approach to learning emerging BIM technologies

Experience coordinating small modelling packages or working closely with engineers

Exposure to multidisciplinary project environments (advantageous)

Australian Citizenship (mandatory for Defence project work)

Why Join Us?

At KBR, you’ll be part of a forward‑thinking team delivering some of Australia’s most complex infrastructure projects. We’re investing in the future of South Australia — and you’ll be at the heart of it. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful, high‑impact work that shapes critical Defence and national infrastructure, leaving a lasting legacy in the region.

We support flexible work arrangements that promote balance and wellbeing, and we offer ongoing professional development pathways.

KBR Values:

title: Digital Engineering Lead
description:
Title:

Digital Engineering Lead

The Opportunity

We are currently looking for an experienced Digital Engineering Lead to join KBR Adelaide supporting large-scale projects within defence, transport and buildings across Australia.

The position will be a part of Digital Engineering project delivery team at the design level and will be directly involved in leading the quality and on-time delivery of the design model and virtual design review processes we have in place.

Who are you?

The ideal candidate will have experience in the use of the DE/BIM/VDC/CDE software used to deliver large scale infrastructure projects including federated model management, model-based design coordination and review, 4D construction sequencing, clash detection and model validation.

As the Digital Engineering Lead, your key responsibilities will include:

Leading collaboration through federating and sharing Digital Engineering models with project teams.
Managing validation, acceptance and maintenance of digital information into the federated Digital Engineering delivery models across projects.
Managing design reviews for Information Models including Quality Assurance model checks, clash detection/mitigation and risk control processes.
Assist in facilitating Digital Engineering model-based design coordination and planning design reviews with the project teams.
Ability to drive projects within an ISO19650-certified environment.
Implementation of digital engineering technical initiatives.
Ongoing development of KBR’s National Digital Engineering capability.

You will have the following skills and experience:

Must be an Australian Citizen due to defence projects
Expertise in 3D modelling and coordination packages (Revizto, Navisworks, Solibri, Synchro, Revit, 12d)
Ability to manage diverse projects to ensure deliverables are met with excellence.
Implementation and management of clash detection
Understanding of all facets of the Asset Information lifecycle management approach
Coordination of multi-disciplinary teams, including engineering, architecture and specialty disciplines
Good understanding of current industry practices and standards (eg. ISO19650)

Who we are?

We are committed to social and environmental sustainability and delivering projects with a digital mindset that drives innovation within our business, for our customers and stakeholders.

Our people blend seamlessly into customer teams to help create a positive impact on the communities and environments they seek to improve. Our expertise and adaptability is unmatched and continues to meet the demands of tomorrow to help shape Australia’s future for the better.

In addition to working on some fantastic projects, KBR offer an array of benefits focused on providing our people with a great working environment, continual career development, friendly & flexible work arrangements with work/life balance. Our culture, and our genuine focus on our people is a major factor in our success and we want you to be part of our journey.

Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time)

title: Marine Electrician
description:
Title:

Marine Electrician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Performs complex duties involving the assembly, fabrication, troubleshooting, testing, repair, overhaul, modification, and general maintenance of electrical equipment or components which have typically been removed from larger systems or assemblies on marine equipment.  Performs other tasks as assigned.  Will be required to work outside for extended periods of times.

Basic Qualifications 

AA degree in electrical engineering or related discipline.
Eight years of directly related work experience. 
Complete the Navy Electrical Repair Course or equivalent. 
In-depth knowledge of electrical circuitry, electrical principles and formulas, and their practical application to the equipment and systems repaired. In lieu of a degree, a combination of college credits, other formalized training or education, and directly related work experience may be considered. 
Thorough knowledge of electronic circuitry and theory relative to a marine equipment/systems. 
Ability to apply a knowledge of mechanical theory and of pneumatic and hydraulic principles to isolate, repair, or replace faulty components. 
Ability to apply knowledge of wire color codes, symbols, layout sheets, wiring diagrams, schematics, technical orders, and manufacturer’s specifications. 
Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.
U.S. Citizen. 
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Office Manager
description:
Title:

Office Manager

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

This position plays an important role in the execution and support of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia’s (KSA) purchase of the THAAD missile defense system.  This position will support the KSA Foreign Liaison Officer assigned in Huntsville AL by providing office manager and clerical support.  KBR is looking for a person who is capable of bridging culture differences, able manage numerous tasks and projects simultaneously, and has keen attention to detail.  Typical daily duties include:

Scheduling meetings between the US Government and the FLO Office
Working with the KSA Embassy to process Foreign Visitor Requests
Coordinating facility maintenance activities
Helping coordinate travel for the FLO and staff
Pay monthly recurring costs and track monthly expenditures
Research and make special purchases

If you are looking for an opportunity to work with other cultures while helping support the Foreign Military Sale of one of America’s premier missile defense systems, this opportunity is for you. 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Answering phones
Performing clerical tasks such as printing, copying, filing, and mailing documents
Scheduling and booking conference rooms
Coordinating special events and meetings
Preparing and reviewing correspondence and other executive documentation
Maintaining correspondence and visitor logs
Submitting and tracking foreign visitor requests
Coordinate, aid with, and support travel requirements
Prepare and maintain briefings, spreadsheets, and schedules
Coordinate and track external inquiries, suspense, and action items
Take minutes and/or action items during executive meetings as required
Conduct office management duties such as paying bills, purchasing admin supplies, and overseeing janitorial activities
Perform other administrative duties as assigned

Basic Qualifications 

Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external personnel and organizations
Candidate must be a US Citizen
Possess (and be able to maintain) a Secret Clearance
High School Diploma and 6+ years’ experience or bachelor’s degree and relevant work experience

Preferred Qualifications

The ability to read, write, and translate documents from English to Arabic
Previous experience as an office manager
Previous experience as an Administrative Assistant in a Project Office
Previous experience drafting, submitting and tracking foreign visitor requests
An understanding of Arabic cultural norms

Sr RF and Electrical Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Collaborative Environment: Highlight the team dynamics and any unique aspects of the workplace culture.

Key Responsibilities:

Designing Customer specific Communication Systems and integration of transportable DoD Electronic and Electro-mechanical equipment systems. Managing and supporting the production of such systems through all phases of the process (from inception through research, development to assembly & testing).

Performing research, design, development, testing and integration of RF hardware systems or products as followed through the customer requirement analysis.  Working independently and in collaboration with the technical personnel in the design of electronic circuits to include circuit board level design and layout. Requires integration, testing and compilation of engineering data, and final delivery of the product along with the operational document for the field engineers.

Acting as the primary interface to customer providing updates, cost estimates, bill of materials (BOM), project schedules and recommendations on engineering solutions. May provide briefings and technical training on RF systems/products to internal and external teams.

Maintains liaison with other engineering and scientific organizations to keep abreast of developments in similar fields or programs and coordinates group activities with those of other engineering groups. Introducing new technology into system designs to enhance performance and/or reduce cost.

Comprehensive analysis reporting and systems level design documentation is a MUST. May manage the technical performance of assigned support personnel.

Required:

Advanced Electronic/RF hardware components packaging, systems design, testing and integration experience

At least 10 years’ experience as an Electrical and RF expert in Land Mobile Radio Systems, SATCOM, Wi-Fi, LTE and RF systems

Hardware research and acquisition experience

Excellent communication/presentation and briefing skills

Clearance: Must have or be able to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.

Basic Compensation:

($120,000- $180,000)

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: Special Operations Physical Therapist (Baumholder, Germany)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Physical Therapist (Baumholder, Germany)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION. 

 

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

 

We are seeking a stellar Special Operations Physical Therapist who will provide evaluation, treatment, and rehabilitation of musculoskeletal conditions. They are licensed independent practitioners and credentialed as direct care providers in specific military HP settings. At KBR we maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts – Could this be you? 

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Evaluate and treat patients with or without referrals.  

Refer patients to other POTFF staff members as needed.  

Provide and perform the following services in support of POTFF’s HP program for SOF personnel, with the priority on SOF Operators and Direct Combat Support personnel: Provide neuro-musculoskeletal injury care, utilizing approved supplemental clinical privileges including the ordering of images, laboratory tests, pharmaceuticals, dry needling, acupuncture, joint injections and aspirations, and referrals to specialty providers. 

If directed by HP Program Manager and/or Coordinator, directly supervise the PT Tech, PT Assistant, and/or Certified Athletic Trainer (ATC) within their scope of practice.  

Participate in periodic meetings with HP and POTFF for reasons such as, but not limited to, reviewing care provided to patients. Identify opportunities for improvement.  

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in matters related to Sports Medicine (SM), injury prevention, rehabilitation, and relevant human performance research. 

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator for administrative matters, purchasing of supplies and equipment, and supplemental fiscal requests.  

Conduct equipment, product, and literature reviews to ensure the HP program stays current with the provision of care.  

Provide input for the development and utilization of required databases.  

Conduct peer (record) reviews for the HP Staff as directed by governing credentialing body and local medical oversight process. 

Assists the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and updating criteria-based job descriptions and performance standards.  

Assist the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and maintaining clinical practice guidelines to ensure consistency of care across all HP Training Centers (HPTCs) and associated facilities.  

Assist with the preparation of short and long-term fiscal plans; submits input to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator.  

Attend and participate in meetings with other POTFF staff members and medical providers as requested and/or required.  

Ensure safe and effective operation of equipment used for patient care and contribute to a safe working environment. 

Participate in periodic in-service training for members of the HP staff or POTFF staff as appropriate. 

Attend required training in accordance with guiding instructions. Commands will allow for attendance at necessary conferences and/or courses to complete continuing education units required to maintain certification. 

Maintain 100% compliance with local mandatory command training requirements. 

Document care in the Military’s Electronic Health Record ) i.e., AHLTA, GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.) as required per DODI 6040.45, USSOCOM HQ and POTFF Staff, and as directed by local HP program manager and/or coordinator. 

Document work performed, utilization, encounters, referrals, and all other information in the Military’s Electronic Health Record (i.e., AHLTA, MHS GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.), as directed by HP program manager and/or coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Perform other tasks, within the scope of the PT position description, as assigned by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Collect and report all data as requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Proficiently utilize computers, software, and technologies as required and requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

 

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

This position requires U.S. Citizenship. 

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

Master’s degree in Physical Therapy. 

Certification through the American Board of Physical Therapy Specialties (ABPTS) as either an OCS or SCS, or certification through the National Athletic Trainers Association (NATA) as a certified athletic trainer (ATC).  

Additional Licensure: Current, full, active, and unrestricted license as a Physical Therapist in one of any U.S. State, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico or U.S. Virgin Islands. 

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at the local MTF.  

Capable of meeting physical demands of training with SOF including the ability to hike over rough terrain, function in austere environments, and observe SOF training evolutions.  

May be required to assist with strength and conditioning testing and training protocols and lift and manipulate loads or weights up to 25 kilograms. 

Minimum of five (5) years or more of demonstrable, accumulated experience (continuous and sustained experience preferred) of performing manual therapy in the sports medicine field with individual athletes and groups of athletes (experience at the levels of NCAA Division I, Olympic, professional, and/or SOF Operators preferred) in the accompanying, respective settings.  

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English. 

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation. 

 

 

Desired Education, Experience, Skills or Training:  

Doctoral degree in Physical Therapy.  

Prior military and/or SOF experience.  

Additional credentials such as a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) through the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA).  

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

Responsible for completing all required training.  

Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

  

  

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. 

 

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.  

Click here to learn more:  KBR Benefits New | KBR
