title: DJBOSS: Prime Power Operator
description:
Title:

DJBOSS: Prime Power Operator

Program Summary

KBR sustains the operational well-being of U.S. armed forces at Djibouti, Africa, Camp Lemonnier Naval

Base. Our services encompass program management, contingency and expeditionary, asset management

and recreation support, postal operations, safety services, logistics, and more. KBR ensures the base

operate smoothly, allowing deployed personnel to focus on mission execution.

Job Summary

Under direct supervision, assigned daily work. May explain instructions and documentation to plan work activities. Help coordinate movement of materials and equipment to work locations and set up work site. Completes and reviews records, maintains tools and equipment, and performs various clean-up activities. Job may require moderate to heavy lifting. Observes and follows all safety rules and procedures, including wearing required personal safety equipment. Requires a high school diploma or equivalent and 2 years of experience

Roles and Responsibilities

 Performing hourly stand-watch operations on two Meg Caterpillar C175-16 Generators
Performing physical walk-through inspection on two Meg C175 Caterpillar Generators
Physical refueling of two Meg generators.
Fill up the hourly readings based on performed above checks on generators.
Prepares daily report based on hourly readings taken from the two Meg Caterpillar Generators
Prepares the shift schedules for Local Nationals- Prime Power Operators
Ensuring that AHA/TSTI are taken every day to each shift.
Maintaining general cleanness in the Prime Power Control Rooms and Yards
Able to perform switching operations (energizing/de-energizing) on high voltage circuits.
Need to be able to understand share load operation of power plants, shed plan of power plant, and to react quickly in case of unexpected power outages.
Understanding of feeders and ET feeders, how power plant works, which ET can be closed, which ET could not be closed at any given time.
Should be Safety oriented, need to know how properly to use High Voltage PPE and equipment, and need to be familiar with LOTO program.
Work may involve outdoor Conditions, Height and Lifting 50+lbs

Basic Qualifications 

Education: Diploma in Electrical or Electrical Engineering, or related field (e.g., Generators).
Basic knowledge of diesel engines.
Familiarity with SCADA systems, Woodward components, protective relays, Ethernet, and fiber optic cables.
Ability to safely perform daily operations involving 11,000V power systems.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar position.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).
Must possess a passport book (not a passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity and 4 blank visa/stamp pages.
Must hold a valid driver’s license with at least 6 months of remaining validity.

Preferred Qualifications

Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment with multiple interruptions/distractions.
Excellent customer relations, communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills
Experience in High Voltage, HV cable termination and splicing will serve as an added advantage
Solid electrical background in high voltages. Certification and diplomas is advantage.

KBR Benefits
KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which include medical insurance.
We support career advancement through professional training and development and flexible work schedule.

location:

description:
Title:

HSE Manager

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

title: Drilling & Rigless Manager
description:
Title:

Drilling & Rigless Manager

Job Title:  Drilling & Rigless Manager
Company:  KBR-Iraq
Project:   Majnoon
Location: Basra, Iraq
Employment Type:   Full-time, Contract

Rotation: 28/28

Required: Expats

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Purpose

Oversee and Supervise the drilling operations and rigless interventions ensuring a safe, efficient, and cost-effective development of the Majnoon reservoirs through the provision of development wells. both production and injection. Lead the planning, execution, and supervision of drilling campaigns, workover activities, and reservoir stimulation programs, with a focus on maximizing reservoir performance, maintaining high safety and environmental standards, and delivering project milestones on schedule and within budget.

Job Responsibilities

Develop and implement drilling and rigless execution plans for development, appraisal, and workover campaigns in alignment with project objectives and HSE policies.
Lead the design, procurement, and management of drilling programs, ensuring compliance with applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements.
Coordinate with multidisciplinary teams (Reservoir, Operations and Surface Facilities, Subsurface, HSE, Logistics, and Construction) to optimize well delivery and minimize non-productive time.
Manage contractor selection, scope of work, performance metrics, and interfaces to ensure Quality, Cost, Schedule (QCS) objectives are met.
Oversee wellsite operations, including rig mobilization/demobilization, casing and cementing programs, mud systems, well control, and safety management.
Plan and supervise rigless interventions (wireline, coiled tubing, chemical stimulation, slickline, etc.) to meet production and reservoir management targets.
Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, and cost controls for drilling and rigless activities; monitor expenditures and optimize resources.
Lead risk assessments, Job Safety Analyses (JSAs), and permit-to-work processes; ensure adherence to company safety standards and Iraqi regulatory requirements.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives for drilling practices, equipment reliability, and performance analytics; implement lessons learned.
Prepare, review, and approve technical documentation (drilling programs, casing designs, intervention procedures, start-up and commissioning checklists, close-out reports).
Ensure data integrity and reporting: daily/weekly/monthly drilling reports, drilling performance metrics, well integrity logs, and dashboards for management review.
Mentor and develop junior engineers and field staff; foster a culture of safety, reliability, and technical excellence.
Collaborate with QA/QC and procurement to ensure supplier qualifications and compliance.
Support near-term and long-term field development planning, including reserve estimation inputs and production optimization strategies.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Petroleum Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related discipline).
Minimum of 15 years of experience in Wells, management of Drilling operations, and wells completion / intervention, and background in production optimization.
Experience in onshore drilling operations in complex environments; exposure to Basra/Iraq-based projects is a plus.
Demonstrated leadership of cross-functional teams and ability to manage multiple priorities in a high-hazard setting.

Technical Skills

Comprehensive knowledge of drilling engineering principles, rig operations, wellbore construction, and completion technologies.
Rigless intervention technologies (wireline, slickline, coiled tubing, hydraulic fracturing stimulation, acidizing, nitrogen/air lift, etc.) and associated surface facilities.
Reservoir management concepts, well integrity, production optimization, and artificial lift methods.
Familiarity with HSE standards, risk management, permit-to-work systems, and incident investigation techniques.
Proficiency with drilling software and data analytics tools (e.g., well planning, drilling simulators, surveillance software) and standard office software.
Knowledge of standards and regulatory requirements relevant to Iraq (local oil & gas regulations, environmental, and safety compliance).

Other Requirements

Strong communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to work onsite in Basra with readiness to respond to emergencies or off-hours demands.
Fluency in English; knowledge of Arabic is advantageous.

location:

description:
Title:

Project Manager - PMC

JOB DESCRIPTION – Project Manager - PMC

Senior Project Manager who can lead and oversee PMC industrial or infrastructure Projects.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience managing PMC projects, teams, and budgets, as well as a proven ability to deliver results on time and within budget. 

Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary point of contact for all project-related matters, including scope, schedule, budget, risks, and issues.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with project sponsors, key stakeholders, and other team members to ensure successful delivery of the Project.
Participate in defining the project objectives, requirements, and deliverables in collaboration with senior management and other stakeholders.
Design detailed project plans, schedules, and work breakdown structures to effectively manage project execution.
Monitor and track project progress, performance, and milestones, identifying and resolving issues and risks in a timely manner.
Manage and motivate project teams, providing coaching and mentorship as needed.
Facilitate project meetings and communications, ensuring timely and effective decision-making.
Prepare project status reports and presentations for senior management and other stakeholders.
Negotiate and resolve conflict among project team members and other stakeholders.
Identify and implement process improvements to optimize project delivery.
Adhere to company policies and procedures, as well as applicable industry standards.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, project management, or related field.
15+ years’ experience in project management, with at least 5 years in handling PMC Projects as Senior PM OR PM.
Proven track record of successful project delivery, within scope, on time, and on budget.
Middle east experience essential.
Strong understanding of agile methodology and principles.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Ability to develop and manage complex project plans.

location:
locations
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Title:

Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist

An exciting opportunity for an experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the team in Sydney. 

The current recruitment team is superb and hugely appreciated by the wider business. It’s cohesive, smart and supportive and everyone is on the same page. It’s a great place to ply your trade, make a difference and whilst you're accountable to deliver, you are given the freedom to work to your strengths. You will manage a national portfolio supporting the delivery of multi million dollar projects and have the opportunity to get involved and collaborate with the global team.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with key hiring managers and leaders across the business to fully understand their current and future hiring needs

Develop customised recruitment strategies to enable effective and timely recruitment of top talent in-line with KBR’s growth strategy

Map the market and create talent pools  both locally and internationally

Write job advertisements and manage advertising across a range of platforms

Promote KBR at networking events and push for referrals from industry contacts and KBR staff

Head hunt talent using Linkedin Recruiter

Utilise AI in your recruitment processes

Review, shortlist and screen potential candidates

Support hiring managers throughout the interview process and customise interview guides so that all key competencies are appropriately explored

Offer management and negotiation to ensure the offer stage runs smoothly

Manage all offers and review employment contract documents to ensure all necessary information is completed and employee on-boarding is a smooth process

Experience & Key Skills

Essential requirements

Extensive experience in technical recruiting.

Engineering recruitment experience, preferably across either Transport, Defence Infrastructure, Building Services or Water

Excellent market knowledge, networks and relevant industry relationships

Extensive experience working for a recruitment agency or in an internal recruitment role

Excellent stakeholder management skills

A natural ability to build rapport with people quickly and be a good judge of character

Proven track record recruiting technical roles in candidate short markets

Ability to effectively use Linkedin Recruiter to head hunt talent

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Experience writing exciting and engaging job adverts

About us

KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions business works with customers across the nation to plan, design and deliver smarter, safer and more sustainable infrastructure to meet the demands of the future for all Australians. We’re a team of over 1300 who deliver engineering, science and technology solutions across the defence, water, transport, energy, sustainability and resources sectors.

Please click the link below to learn more about Infrastructure Solutions Australia and the markets that we operate in.

https://kbr.foleon.com/is-australia/who-we-are/who-we-are

The perks

Industry leading salaries, reviewed annually

The opportunity to accrue an additional 8 hours of time off every 4 weeks

Salary packaging and Novated leases

Salary continuance (Income protection)

Life/Health insurance discounts

Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time)

End of trip facilities

Employee Stock Purchase Plans

Paid parental leave

Personal Career development plans

Growth and promotion opportunities

Our people are the heart of everything we do. We are dedicated to creating work environments in which every member of our team of teams feels safe, supported, respected, trusted and valued, and where each person is given opportunities to belong, connect and grow.

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
Title:

Principal Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking a Principal Software Engineer to work on-site at Schriever SFB, near Colorado Springs, CO for our front range operations and sustainment effort. We liaison with an IC customer and Satellite Control Network to provide satellite support services to our mission critical customer.  Our team handles real time on-orbit support, launch ascent support and End-of-Life operations for all NOPS missions.  The software team works in a state-of-the-art dynamic environment to develop new containerized software and maintain existing software for different needs on the program.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Maintain software used to establish connections for status & control of ground equipment.

Provide Java software development. Perform all aspects of software engineering support required to implement systems.

Also maintain software that handles scheduling of on-orbit contacts, and orbit calculations.

Write software that supports launch operations with trajectory calculations for the SpaceX and ULA vendors.

Provide support to team members primarily with Java development and utilizing the Spring Boot framework.

Develop React-based user interfaces for operator interaction.

Assist writing microservices that interact with a variety of vendor interfaces for data processing.

Deploy new containerized applications in Kubernetes environments.

Assist with new customer requests by extending and enhancing existing capabilities and creating new ones where needed.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: 1st shift, regular hours

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40 hours

Basic Compensation:

$127,000 - $190,000 USD annually

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Qualifications:

Required:

Clearance: TS/SCI with a Polygraph 

Education: Undergraduate degree in computer science or related field 

Experience: 5 years of software engineering (development/coding) experience

Experience and proficiency with Java programming language

Knowledge with Spring Boot framework or other similar experience

Interpersonal Skills: Ability to interface effectively with users, customers, management, and other engineering personnel 

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr. Metrology Technician
description:
Title:

Sr. Metrology Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Sr. Metrology Technician is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards and taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests. Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  Calibration of metrology lab standards as required.  The position requires fluency in calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up test equipment calibration systems.  Metrology Technician may be required to provide assistance to entry level technicians as they learn new measurement procedures and processes. This role will report to the lead technician and lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of electronic and physical/dimensional measuring and test equipment according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).
Calibrate and repair equipment such as Multimeters, frequency counter, timers, oscilloscopes, dimensional hand tools, blueprint-controlled devices and fixtures, pressure devices, Thermo-hygrometers, scales, load cells, force devices, and other devices
Calibrate standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.
Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.
Interpret and create uncertainty budget in accordance with ISO 17025:2017
Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.
Complete all other duties as assigned.
Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with 7+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 5+ years of experience.
Working knowledge of one or more of the following voltages, current, resistance, capacitance, time and frequency, signal conditioning, blueprint and drawings, dimensional tooling and hand tools, pressure controllers, pressure dead weight testers, force gages and load cells, etc.
Ability to interpret, validate, modify, and create uncertainty budgets in accordance with ISO 17025:2107
Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.
Ability to travel to client locations to perform onsite service up to 75%

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal systems.
Familiarity with laboratory measurement and calibration equipment.
Experience in calibration of mass and weights, and/or the use of mass comparators.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr. Metrology Technician RF
description:
Title:

Sr. Metrology Technician RF

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

 The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Sr. Metrology Technician is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards, taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests, maintaining traceability and calibration of laboratory standards.   Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  The position requires knowledge and fluency in basic and advanced calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up advanced test equipment calibration systems.  This position also requires the ability to review, validate, create, and/or modify calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures.  Ability to interpret and create Uncertainty Budgets in accordance with ISO 17025:2017. Sr. Metrology Technician will provide support and training to other technicians. This role will report to the principal technician and/or lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of advanced RF electronic measuring and test equipment according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Calibrate and repair equipment such as Multimeters, data acquisition systems, data loggers, frequency counter, timers, oscilloscopes, Spectrum Analyzers, Network Analyzers, Attenuators, directional couplers, Signal Analyzers, Signal Generators, Waveform Generators, Power Meters, Power Sensors, directional couplers, etc.

Calibrate electrical standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.

Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Validate, modify and create calibration procedures from specifications and requirements.

Interpret and create uncertainty budget in accordance with ISO 17025:2017

Complete all other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

 

High school diploma with 10+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 6 years of experience.

Working knowledge of one or more of the following Low DC voltages, current, resistance, capacitance, RF time , frequency & power, time domain reflectance, signal conditioning, etc.

Ability to interpret, create and modify Measurement Uncertainty Budgets in accordance with ISO17025:2107

Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.

Ability to travel to client locations to perform onsite service up to 75%

Preferred Qualifications 

Military/PMEL trained

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal systems.

Familiarity with laboratory measurement and calibration equipment.

Metrology Standard Lab Experience

title: Principal Metrology
description:
Title:

Principal Metrology

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Principal Metrology Technician is responsible for performing advanced calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards, management and scheduling of day-to-day escalations and priority requests, maintaining traceability and calibration of laboratory capabilities and standards.  The position requires subject matter expert level knowledge and fluency in calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up manual and automated advanced test equipment calibration systems.  This position also requires the ability to review, validate, create, and/or modify calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures. Principal Metrology Technician will provide support, training and mentoring to other technicians.  This role will report to the lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of advanced dimensional measuring and test equipment, blueprint-controlled fixtures and hardware according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Calibrate and repair equipment such as Blue print controlled hardware and fixtures, dimensional tooling, gaging and hand tools.

Calibrate dimensional standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.

Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Validate, modify and create calibration procedures from specifications and requirements.

Interpret and create uncertainty budget in accordance with ISO 17025:2017

Complete all other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with 10+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 6 years of experience.

Subject Matter Expert level working knowledge of Dimensional calibrations, and GD&T

Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.

Ability to interpret, validate, modify, and create measurement uncertainty budgets in accordance with ISO 17025:2107

Preferred Qualifications

title: Metrology Technician
description:
Title:

Metrology Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Metrology Technician is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards and taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests. Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  Calibration of metrology lab standards as required.  The position requires fluency in calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up test equipment calibration systems.  Metrology Technician may be required to provide assistance to entry level technicians as they learn new measurement procedures and processes. This role will report to the lead technician and lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Perform calibration and certification of electronic and physical/dimensional measuring and test equipment according to technical specifications, ensuring traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Calibrate and repair equipment such as Multimeters, frequency counter, timers, oscilloscopes, dimensional hand tools, blueprint-controlled devices and fixtures, pressure devices, Thermo-hygrometers, scales, load cells, force devices, and weights.

Calibrate standards used in calibrations and maintain equipment to established performance standards.

Record maintenance activities in CMS, generate reports on results of tests, conditions of equipment and/or systems, repairs, and preventive maintenance performed, and prepare necessary documentation as required by customer and regulatory requirements.

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Complete all other duties as assigned.

Utilize common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma with 3+ years of experience in the field, OR associate’s degree in engineering technology or a relevant field with 3 years of experience.

Working knowledge of one or more of the following voltage, current, resistance, capacitance, time and frequency, signal conditioning, blueprint and drawings, dimensional tooling and hand tools, pressure controllers, pressure dead weight testers, force gages and load cells, etc.

Proficiency in using Microsoft Office software, including Excel.

Preferred Qualifications 

Experience with IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track, and Met/Cal systems.

Familiarity with laboratory measurement and calibration equipment.

Experience in calibration of mass and weights, and/or the use of mass comparators.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Logistics and Readiness Admin Support - Sr. Specialist
description:
Title:

Logistics and Readiness Admin Support - Sr. Specialist

Program Summary:

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Job Summary:  

KBR is seeking to hire a Logistics and Readiness Admin Support - Sr. Specialist to support a wide array of tasks from office management and light database support leveraging maintenance administration expertise. The position is within OPNAV Air Warfare Division, Logistics and Readiness Branch, N980L. This includes support to multiple branches and office facilities located in the Pentagon, and a workforce of 25 personnel: 

 

Roles and Responsibilities:

 

Provide Operational Support: 

Assist in the management of office communication: 

Telephone 
Sort and distribute mail 
Prepare and maintain appointment calendars for shared resources 
Coordinate and schedule appointments in N98 conference rooms 
Facilitate VTC and audio bridge reservations with Government providers 
Perform visitor control functions (greet, screen, validate, convey to point of contact, etc.). 
Facilitate correspondence (letters, directives, memoranda, newsletters, etc): 
Prepare draft template and standard language 
Edit for spelling, grammar, and format 

Prepare templates and edit graphical presentations and spreadsheets 

Provide multimedia and audiovisual support for N98 meeting and conferences. Specifically, oversee and support VTC set-up and verify equipment operation for the N98 conference rooms. 
Provide draft correspondence, naval messages, assistance with faxing, copying, collating of issue papers, point papers, instructions, speeches, articles, presentations, and briefings and other correspondence as required. 
Prepare templates, submit, track, and retrieve travel orders and travel vouchers for the Government; coordinate transportation and lodging reservations. 
Process electronic mail and naval messages. 
Provide business operations support and security expertise during meetings: 
Integrate and distribute agendas
Draft, administer, and distribute minutes 
Copy and distribute documentation 

Develop and maintain files (hard copy and electronic) 

Participate in preparation of Personnel listings, and manual updates. 
Track inventory of required office supplies and equipment in the assigned office space and make a tracker available for the purposes of supply ordering by the Government. 
Archive and store historical documentation. 

 

Provide Security Coordination:

Maintain and analyze established office security planning in order to safeguard classified and sensitive materials and other documentation. 
Receive, log, and track classified documents up to the SECRET level. 
Prepare Classified documents for disposal 
Comply with Government regulations regarding classified material and act as a subject matter expert on applicable instructions and directives. 
Prepare, screen, and receive collateral visit requests through Joint Personnel Adjudication System (JPAS). 

 

Provide Integrated Logistics Support:

Assist and provide policy, guidance, and oversight of the Fixed Induction Date (FID) and Integrated Maintenance Review Board (IMRB) processes in coordination with OPNAV Resource Sponsor, Program Offices, Fleet Support Teams (FST), NAVAIR Competencies, and Type Commanders. 
Receive, review, and process FID adjustment requests IMRB packages. 
Prepare and submit FID request responses to TYCOMs via naval message. 
Assist Aircraft Inventory Manager in the preparation, update, and completion of aircraft inventory reports and budget documents deliverables. 
Extract data from Decision Knowledge Programming for Logistics Analysis and Technical Evaluation (DECKPLATE), Aircraft Inventory and Readiness Reporting System (AIRRS), and PBIS databases.
Prepare responses to FOIA requests for review and release by government personnel. 

 

Basic Qualifications: 

U.S. Citizen.  Must possess an active SECRET security clearance or have held an active clearance within the past two years.
High school diploma AND minimum 5 years’ experience participating in specific business services and OPNAV internal business operations. 
Proficient knowledge of OPNAV security regulations. 
Expert knowledge of OPNAV and Secretariat business functions, operations, facilities management, physical security, Defense Travel System (DTS), training, and office automation/communications requirements support. 
 
Demonstrated expertise with software and systems: 
Microsoft Word 
Microsoft Windows 
Microsoft Excel 
Microsoft PowerPoint 
Joint Personnel Adjudication System (JPAS) 
Naval Defense – Naval Message – System; Automated Message Handling System (AMHS) 
Naval Aviation Maintenance Program (NAMP) 
Aeronautical Technical Publications Library (ATPL) 
Naval Aviation Logistics Command Management Information System (NALCOMIS) 
DoN Tasking, Records and Consolidated Knowledge Enterprise Repository (TRACKER) 

Preferred Qualifications:

We are seeking a highly qualified candidate to join our team. While a BS/BA degree is desired, it is not a requirement for this position. Instead, having a strong foundation in Integrated Logistics Support, with expertise in areas such as supply chain management, maintenance, and repair with a basic understanding of business operations, security regulations, and software systems.
 

Work Location: Must be willing to work onsite at the Pentagon.

Compensation: $114,940 - $130,795.  The salary range posted is for Washington, DC locations. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Benefits:

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: LCV NORTHCOM NTC: Equipment, General Foreman
description:
Title:

LCV NORTHCOM NTC: Equipment, General Foreman

Program Summary

The Fort Irwin National Training Center is a major training area for the United States military and is located in the Mojave Desert in northern San Bernardino County, California. KBR provides maintenance and logistics services to customers at the National Training Center in Fort Irwin, California to support the U.S. Army building brigade combat team readiness with ten annual training rotations.

Job Summary

As an Equipment General Foreman, you will supervise multiple union employees providing maintenance services and fault repair for a wide variety of tactical and non-tactical equipment.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Handle workload planning, coordination, and service execution to meet contractual obligations in accordance with the performance work statement. 
Set priorities, monitor performance, coach, mentor, and train team members to achieve key performance indicators and quality goals.
Provide leadership to cause the creation of organizational structures and processes necessary to fully execute the requirements of services.
Ensure the completion of Maintenance services, Quality and HSE within your assigned area. 
Evaluate service execution for compliance to the contract, schedule, cost and quality, advising the production control team of status, issues, impacts, risk, and cost influence factors. 
Conduct internal audits to ensure compliance with performance standards in AR 750-1 and manufacturers guidelines for commercial equipment. 
Maintain the short-range look ahead plans and discuss all deviations with the Equipment Maintenance Supervisor.
Review and monitor cost and man-hour utilization for maintenance process, develop an equipment and tools requirement plan and review it with the Equipment Maintenance Supervisor. 
Supervise union employees on a daily basis, conduct performance counseling’s, make recommendations for discipline/termination of employment, and participate in the KBR selection/retention process.
Complete roll calls and accountability of personnel.
Must be able to perform required duties, and wear and utilize Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
Must be able to lift/move 45 lbs. without assistance and up to 80 lbs. with assistance.
Must be physically capable of performing the work in extreme temperatures, low humidity, blowing sand and dust.
May be required to work extended hours, nights, weekends, and holidays. Please note this position is SAT-WED 0700-1530. 
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must be able to pass a U.S. Government background investigation and obtain a NACI. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Green Card holder who has lived within the United States for at least the last 3 years to be eligible for this position.
Must possess a valid State Real ID
High school diploma or equivalent (GED)
Must possess Valid driver’s license
 

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

3-5 years of experience in Tactical Vehicle maintenance as a Lead or Foreman.
Experience in the use of GCSS-Army preferred

Pay

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40
Basic Compensation: $82,000-$123,000

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Senior Front-End Engineer (UI)
description:
Title:

Senior Front-End Engineer (UI)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Role summary

KBR is seeking a highly experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our team in Beavercreek, OH. The ideal candidate will be a Front End (UI) expert with a Secret DoW clearance.

Key responsibilities

Build the “single pane of glass” for developers and consumers intuitive workflows for modeling and development setup, orchestration, monitoring, and analysis
Translate complex simulation concepts (timing, state‑of‑play, user inputs) into usable experiences
Design and implement modular React/TypeScript front‑ends (or equivalent) with reusable components and UX patterns tailored to planners
Integrate with platform REST/gRPC/GraphQL APIs for model catalogs, scenario design, job status, data & metadata access
Visualize timing/synchronization, state‑of‑play, and entity interactions; real‑time status via WebSockets/SSE
Build secure UI flows: authentication/authorization (OIDC/OAuth2), role‑based views, audit logging
Collaborate with API/platform/HPC teams to evolve UX based on mission workflows and VV\&A needs

Work Environment:

Location: On-site/Hybrid/Remote
Travel Requirements: 15%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

10+ years of Software Engineering experience with 4–6+ years building production SPA front‑ends (React/TypeScript preferred; Angular/Vue acceptable)
Strong API integration skills (REST/GraphQL), state management (Redux/Zustand), and real‑time patterns
UI/UX for complex domains; accessibility (WCAG) and performance optimization
Active Secret DoW clearance

Desired:

Data visualization (D3, Three.js/WebGL) for entity timelines, maps, and campaign metrics
Experience with secure environments (Content Security Policy, hardened builds) and design systems
Comfortable delivering UI assets for multi‑environment deployments
Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

title: System Engineer Intern
description:
Title:

System Engineer Intern

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

About Us

At KBR, we deliver science, technology, and engineering solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions. Our team at the USGS Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center supports the Landsat program and other remote sensing initiatives that impact global environmental monitoring and research. We value innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence in everything we do.

Why You'll Love This Role

As a Systems Engineer Intern, your primary focus will be supporting a Systems Engineering team with requirements development, design, implementation, and test activities, while assisting with the adoption and integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll collaborate with mentors and experienced engineers to contribute to mission-critical systems and help integrate AI into engineering workflows. This internship offers hands-on experience across the systems engineering lifecycle and exposure to cutting-edge technologies. This position is onsite in Sioux Falls, SD.

What You’ll Gain

During this internship, you’ll gain hands-on experience across the full Systems Engineering lifecycle. You’ll work closely with mentors who will guide your professional growth, collaborate with experienced engineers on mission-critical projects, and learn best practices for building and integrating complex systems. This is an opportunity to make a tangible impact while developing skills that set you apart in the engineering field.

Responsibilities
Assist with requirements development, design, implementation, and test activities for mission-critical systems
Collaborate with mentors and Systems Engineers to identify AI opportunities in engineering workflows
Support integration of AI tools into systems engineering processes
Assist in creating documentation, workflows, and integration plans for AI adoption
Participate in brainstorming sessions to turn innovative AI ideas into reality
Support system design, integration, and testing activities as needed
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field
Experience with Artificial Intelligence concepts and tools (e.g., machine learning frameworks, AI APIs)
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical audiences
Desired Skills

This internship is designed to help you learn. Prior experience in all areas is not expected.

Familiarity with Systems Engineering principles
Programming experience (Python or similar)
Interest in Earth science or space systems
Experience with collaboration tools such as Jira and Confluence
Special Requirements

Three years of continuous residency in the US for issuance of a Government Security credential. The candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation after hiring to obtain a badge for government facility access and user account. Experience and/or education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability.

Experience and/or Education in lieu of these qualifications will be reviewed for applicability to meet these requirements.

KBR partners with several other companies to fulfill its requirements as a government contractor. The selected subcontracting companies align their benefits as closely as possible to those above.

title: Senior Software Integration Engineer-API Design
description:
Title:

Senior Software Integration Engineer-API Design

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Role summary

KBR is seeking a highly experienced Senior Software Integration Engineer to join our team in Beavercreek, OH. The ideal candidate will be expert in API web design with a Secret DoW clearance.

Key responsibilities

Define and govern the API‑first contracts that modularize the simulation core and onboard legacy tools as modern services
Ensure transparency, repeatability, and security across all integrations (tools, data, metadata, orchestration)
Design REST/gRPC APIs and GraphQL schemas for simulation core services: timing, state‑of‑play, user input, orchestration
Lead API governance: versioning, schema evolution (OpenAPI/JSON Schema/proto), deprecation policy, and documentation
Wrap existing simulation/wargaming tools as secure web services via SDKs; standardize authentication/authorization (OIDC/JWT) and mTLS
Implement API gateway patterns: routing, rate limiting, quotas, request validation, and zero‑trust controls
Model metadata & lineage: tagging of tools/inputs/results; expose reconciliation endpoints for VV\&A, fidelity compatibility assessment, and repeatability

Work Environment:

Location: On-site/Hybrid/Remote
Travel Requirements: 15%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

5–8+ years in API design/integration; strong OpenAPI, JSON Schema, protobuf/gRPC, and GraphQL experience
Security: OAuth2/OIDC, JWT, mTLS, policy enforcement; experience with gateway technologies
Data modeling, metadata/lineage design, and auditability for regulated domains
Active DoW Secret clearance

Desired:

Experience integrating legacy/constructive simulation systems into modern API ecosystems
Event streaming (Kafka/NATS) for asynchronous workflows and telemetry
Comfortable designing interfaces for multi‑classification operations
Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

Title:

ESH Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Who You Are
You’re a dedicated Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) Specialist with a passion for creating safe, sustainable, and compliant work environments. You bring a deep understanding of EHS regulations, risk assessment, and safety practices, paired with a proactive approach to problem-solving and a meticulous eye for detail. Your expertise enables you to identify, evaluate, and mitigate risks that could impact the mission success of our customers.

At KBR, you’ll play a critical role in safeguarding people, property, and the environment, ensuring adherence to the highest safety standards. Known for your strong communication skills and collaborative approach, you’re adept at training personnel, conducting inspections, and implementing EHS programs that enhance operational readiness and resilience. Your commitment to continuous improvement and regulatory compliance directly aligns with KBR’s mission of building a safer, more secure, and sustainable future.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award


What You'll Do
In the role of EH&S Specialist, your duties will include:

Manage environmental programs for compliance, pollution prevention, and /or natural resource protection programs.

Prepares and oversees SOWs and cost estimates for environmental studies, designs, and projects.

Continually ensures and monitors compliance and investigations of non-compliant issues.

Establishes and manages hazardous waste storage and disposal policies and practices.

Oversees identification and validation of potential contaminated sites and development/implementation of remedial action plans.

Manages staff, budget and policies affecting specific programs.

Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a US TS/SCI Clearance w/ Poly, or an Australian PV clearance

Must have a minimum of a BA/BS, from an accredited institution, preferably in environmental science or EH&S related field

Must have a minimum of five years of EHS experience managing projects of similar size, scope, and complexity

Must possess a ASP, CSP, CIH, CEP (Preferred), or Australian equivalent (note: a CSP or CIH are preferred); An EH&S related Master's Degree may suffice for Certification requirement

Must be knowledge of process improvement models

Must have an understanding of the US and Australian bilateral agreements governing EHS

Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze data and statistics related to workplace safety and environmental compliance.

Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills for preparing reports, presenting safety training, and interacting with regulatory bodies.

Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to identify safety risks and develop effective mitigation strategies.

Physical Requirements: Depending on the sector, there may be physical demands such as walking extensive distances on inspection rounds.

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

title: Senior Platform Engineer/Kubernetes SME
description:
Title:

Senior Platform Engineer/Kubernetes SME

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Role summary

KBR is seeking a highly experienced Senior Platform Engineer to join our team in Beavercreek, OH. The ideal candidate will be a Kubernetes SME with a DoW Top Secret clearance and SCI eligibility.

Key responsibilities

Own the design, build, and operations of a modular, API‑first platform that abstracts infrastructure from simulation software
Lead multi‑cluster Kubernetes, service mesh, security hardening, and observability to support hundreds of users and tens of thousands of entities across connected and air‑gapped environments
Design and operate multi‑cluster Kubernetes environments (control/data/CI/observability planes) with strong isolation and zero‑trust defaults
Implement service mesh (e.g., Istio) for mTLS, traffic control, and fine‑grained AuthorizationPolicy; manage ingress (Gateway/VirtualService) and east‑west policies
Author and maintain platform CRDs and controllers/operators to reconcile developer intent into runtime objects (namespaces/cells, Deployments/Jobs, Services, policies, gateways)
Integrate network policy (eBPF/Cilium), secrets management, RBAC/ABAC, and policy‑driven automation across environments
Stand up observability (metrics/logs/traces) and SLO monitoring; drive reliability (HA, backup/restore, DR)
Support air‑gap packaging/delivery and secure software supply chain (images, SBOMs, provenance)
Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility

Work Environment:

Location: On-site/Hybrid
Travel Requirements: 15%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

12+ years of Software Engineering experience with 5–8+ years in platform/SRE roles operating production Kubernetes at scale; strong multi‑cluster and GitOps (Argo CD/Flux) experience
Hands‑on with Istio/Envoy, Cilium (NetworkPolicy, eBPF), Ingress/Gateway API, and cluster networking (DNS, L7/L4)
Controller/operator development using Go (Kubebuilder/Operator SDK) or TypeScript‑based frameworks; CRD design/versioning
Observability: Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Fluent Bit/OpenSearch; incident response and performance tuning
Security: mTLS, OIDC, JWT, OPA/Gatekeeper/Kyverno (or equivalent), image signing, SBOM, CVE remediations

Desired:

Experience in air‑gapped or classified environments; package and deploy with tools that support disconnected sites
Exposure to Kubernetes Gateway/Envoy Gateway, egress control, and sidecar injection strategies
Prior VV\&A support for modeling & simulation platforms
Ability to work across Unclassified → Secret → TS/SCI/SAP environments

Manage event communications, including invitations, RSVPs, signage, and briefing materials.

Provide on-site support during events, coordinating set-up, execution, and tear-down.

Track budgets, process invoices, and monitor expenditures in alignment with financial and contracting requirements.

Support day-to-day administrative functions related to office events, training, and official engagements.

Clearance Requirement:  TS/SCI w/ CI Polygraph

Previous experience in event planning, coordination, or related field (government or corporate preferred).

Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working with staff, leadership, and external partners.

Knowledge of government protocols, procurement, and security procedures is an asset.

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.


Who You Are
You’re a detail-oriented and technically skilled CAD Technician with expertise in creating precise and accurate design and drafting solutions. Proficient in CAD software and design standards, you excel at transforming concepts into detailed technical drawings, schematics, and models that drive project success. Your ability to interpret engineering specifications and collaborate with teams ensures that designs meet functional, regulatory, and quality requirements.

At KBR, you bring creativity, technical expertise, and a commitment to excellence to every project. Known for your attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities, you thrive in dynamic environments where your contributions are critical to mission success. Your dedication to innovation and quality aligns with KBR’s mission of delivering reliable and forward-thinking solutions for critical operations.


What You'll Do
In the role of CAD Technician, your duties will include:

Prepare Drawings: Under direct supervision, prepare detailed drawings and tracings using the commands and data entry methods specific to the CAD (Computer-Aided Design) system in use.

Operate CAD Equipment: Skillfully operate plotters and other output devices to generate hard copies of drawing files.

Perform Design Tasks: Engage in design preparation activities which may include PC board path layout and configuration, internal and external packaging, and control panel layouts.

Maintain CAD Files: Ensure that all CAD files are properly managed, updated, and stored in accordance with company guidelines.

Collaborate with Engineers: Work closely with engineers and other technical team members to understand the requirements and specifications for designs.

Implement Revisions: Apply changes and revisions to designs as directed by engineers or supervisors, ensuring all updates are accurately reflected in CAD drawings.

Follow Supervision: Adhere to guidelines and instructions provided by supervisors to meet the technical and design standards of the organization.

Ensure Accuracy: Check and verify the accuracy and completeness of drawings and specifications before submission for review or use in further engineering activities.

Stay Updated: Keep up-to-date with the latest CAD technologies and software updates to improve efficiency and quality of work.

Report Progress: Regularly report progress and any issues encountered to the supervising staff to ensure that project timelines and quality standards are met.

Other duties as required.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

Must have a minimum of a BA/BS from an accredited institution.

5+ years technical drafting/design training from either a accredited technical school or military training and 4 years prior drafting experience.

Experience managing similar USG projects of size, scope and complexity

Experience with AutoCAD and Revit

Ability to work in fast paced environment with excellent oral and written communication skills.

Clearance: Must Possess an active US Top Secret/SCI with Polygraph or AUS PV Security Clearance.

This role will be located in Alice Springs, at a 4,400-acre facility with approximately 687,000 square feet of mission and support space.  This position is expected to be onsite 100%.

Who You Are
You’re a compassionate and dedicated General Practitioner committed to providing high-quality healthcare and improving the well-being of patients across diverse populations. With a strong foundation in medicine and a focus on preventive care, you excel at diagnosing, treating, and managing a wide range of health issues while fostering strong relationships with your patients. Your holistic approach ensures that you consider not only the physical aspects of health but also the emotional and social factors that contribute to overall wellness.

At KBR, you bring your expertise in clinical practice and a collaborative spirit to a team that values patient-centered care. Known for your strong communication skills and empathetic demeanor, you work closely with other healthcare professionals to ensure that patients receive comprehensive and coordinated care. Your commitment to continuous learning and adapting to the latest medical advancements aligns with KBR’s mission to create healthier communities and enhance operational readiness in healthcare delivery.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award


What You'll Do
In the role of General Practitioner, your duties will include:

Provides medical services comparable to such services and coverage as provided by the USG Facility Medical Officer (FMO) during clinic hours of operation and "after hours" coverage, as necessary.

Obtain health history and perform physical examinations.

Diagnose and direct counseling for each patient on a plan for treatment.

Prescribe medication in accordance with state statute and professional practice guidelines.

Maintains a problem-oriented health record for each patient seen in accordance with established Health Information Management policies and procedures.

Assures continuity of care by providing comprehensive medical services on a timely basis.

Provides excellent internal/external customer service to assist patients with their health care needs.

Arrange referrals for patients requiring services not offered on-site.

Review incoming reports (e.g. lab, x-ray, EKG) sign, date and follow-up in a timely manner.

Assist in updating protocols and principles of practice as requested.

Assist in outside medical public relations functions.

Requirements:

Must be a US or Australian citizen

title: MCPP: Engineering Heavy Equipment Mechanic – Philippines
description:
Title:

MCPP: Engineering Heavy Equipment Mechanic – Philippines

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

The Marine Corps’ Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) and Marine Corps

Prepositioning Program has been operationally invaluable in supporting our Nation’s interests across the world. This unique program provides the essential elements needed to support and execute crisis response, global reach, and forward presence. The Marine Corps’ Prepositioning Program enables the rapid deployment of Marine Air Ground Task Forces (MAGTFs) and/or augment individual Marine units

forward deployed. These forces are uniquely capable of strengthening alliances, securing strategic access, and defeating hostile adversaries. MPF is keystone in the Marine Corps’ capability for setting the conditions for national security. The prepositioning of equipment and supplies to support MAGTFs from Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU), Marine Expeditionary Brigade (MEB), to Marine Expeditionary Force (MEF) level employment, enables Marine forces to fulfil their role and responsibility as our Nation’s force in readiness. Our prepositioning programs will continue to enable operations across the Joint Operational continuum – including shaping, deterrence, seizing the initiative, domination, stabilization, and enabling of civilian authorities. When combined with the forces and their equipment arriving in the fly-in echelon (FIE), prepositioning programs

provide forward deployed equipment and supplies needed to sustain a MEB-sized MAGTF for 30 days of operations; thus reducing total strategic lift requirements.

Job Summary

Perform the installation, operation, maintenance, and repair of HE equipment and systems, in support of the Marine Corps Prepositioning Program – Philippines (MCPP-PHIL).  The MCPP-PHIL Engineering HE Mechanic will report directly to the MCPP-PHIL Engineering Maintenance Supervisor.

Initial training for this position and onboarding will occur in Jacksonville, FL with follow-on USMC Contractor Replenishment Cell (CRC) training for ultimate placement in Subic Bay, Philippines.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Plan, coordinate, and execute the performance of maintenance functions for MCPP-PHIL and MCPP-PHIL Organic equipment implementing the following: 

Perform maintenance actions that follows the contract Statement of Work and adheres to Marine Corps policy and procedures.
Perform maintenance actions involving repairing, adjusting, servicing, and storing HE equipment and systems. 
Support equipment readiness, maintenance shop organization, control of maintenance assets and provide advice on all matters relating to HE systems maintenance. Review invoices and requisitions to plan work activities. 
Maintain proficiency in all maintenance functions. 
Inventory repair parts and equipment and requisition replacement stock.
Provide requisitions for equipment, materials, and supplies.
Comply with personnel and administrative policies, procedures, and government regulations.
Comply with established safety regulations, and method and procedures for handling and storing various equipment and materials.
Comply with MCPP-PHIL ISO policies and procedures, work specifications, and time schedules.
Interpret specifications, drawings, work orders, technical instructions, and layouts.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

Associate degree and/or coursework towards a BS degree in mechanical engineering or another related field.
In lieu of a degree, a combination of college credits, professional certification, formalized training, or education, and directly related work experience may be considered.
Four years of progressive experience with specialized knowledge of maintenance and logistic support activities involving HE systems maintenance.
Must be a U.S. Citizen.
Must possess a valid state Motor Vehicle Drivers’ License.
Must possess or be able to obtain a U.S. Passport.
Applicants must be able to pass an FBI Background investigation with no criminal, civil, or security violations.

Must be able to obtain a work visa and an Alien Employment Permit for the Philippines.

Preferred Qualifications

USMC MOS 1341.
Understanding of Marine Corps policies, regulations, and orders.
Industry Certification.
Working knowledge of military storage procedures.
Expert knowledge of general maintenance procedures for military tactical equipment and supplies.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient.

Title:

Program Director - PMC (Power)

Job Title: Program Director
Company: KBR-Abu Dhabi
Location: Abu Dhabi
Experience Required: 20+ years

Employment Type: Full-time, Contract

About Company

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Purpose

The Program Director will oversee the entire programme of projects, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, progress and coordination of resources and ownership over preparation of monthly/quarterly/annual progress report. This is a PMC role, and the PD will be responsible for overseeing and execution of engineering management, procurement, and delivery for large-scale power and water transmission projects in Abu Dhabi. There will be multiple Supervision Consultants and EPC`s appointed directly by the Client. This role involves strategic planning, resource management, and collaboration with numerous stakeholders to meet project objectives, timelines, and budget constraints.

Job Responsibilities

Lead and manage the overall planning, execution, and delivery of the Project.
Coordinate with project stakeholders, including clients, supervision consultants, contractors, vendors and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment and compliance with project specifications and regulations.
Oversee the development and implementation of project plans, schedules, and budgets.
Provide leadership and direction to project teams, fostering a culture of safety, quality, and continuous improvement.
Monitor project progress and performance, implementing corrective actions as necessary to address any deviations from the project plan.
Prepare and present regular project reports to senior management and the client`s executive leadership teams detailing progress, challenges and solutions, commercial status, risks etc.
Ensure effective risk management strategies are in place to mitigate potential project risks and issues.
Collaborate with the technical team to ensure constructability and compliance with industry standards.
Guide and mentor project team members, promoting professional development and knowledge sharing.
Foster strong relationships with clients and other stakeholders to maintain project support and mitigate any concerns.

Qualifications

Master’s degree preferred or Bachelor’s degree in related field.
20+ years of experience in projects, specifically in large power and water distribution programmes.
Proven PMC experience in a similar role on programmes.

Technical Skills

In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Strong understanding of electrical and mechanical engineering principles and UAE regulatory requirements for power and water transmission.
Proficiency in project scheduling and resource management.

Soft Skills

Exceptional leadership and team management abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities effectively.
A proactive approach to risk management and conflict resolution.
Arabic speaker preferred
