Stakeholder Manager
LOCATION

Abu Dhabi, UAE

THE ROLE

Reports to the Technical Director within the Programme Team. Responsible for Programme interface management with key stakeholders, in order to obtain all approvals related to design, handover, construction and issue resolution.

project description

KBR has been appointed under a framework agreement with the largest developer in Abu Dhabi to oversee a diverse portfolio of projects that contribute to Abu Dhabi's growth.  This includes developing essential infrastructure such as transportation networks and utilities, alongside public spaces and involving also the shaping of thriving communities by managing the development of residential housing projects and ensuring the quality of new educational facilities, together with the development of mosques and maximizing urban space through infill development projects. This PMC role offers a unique opportunity to make a lasting impact on Abu Dhabi's built environment.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Create a stakeholder map and develop, monitor and update the Stakeholder Management Plan
Develop relationships with key stakeholders to enable effective communication between their respective agency and the client Programme
Support the Technical Team and Delivery Managers in successfully driving infrastructure and building project issues through the respective agencies, with the aim to ensure project schedules are not impacted by stakeholder approvals, NOCs and permits.
Develop a thorough understanding of each stakeholder agency’s processes and challenges to enable the delivery team to tailor requirements accordingly
Feedback stakeholder issues, with proposed mitigations, to the PMC team to resolve issues and ensure appropriate timescales are included within project schedules for all approvals and permits
Attend coordination meetings with stakeholders and communicate issues to the appropriate Manager
Support the Technical Team and Delivery Managers to resolve issues between stakeholders and Design Consultants and Contractors in relation to both infrastructure and building projects
Maintain records of Stakeholder concerns, actions, owners, and due date
Prepare recommendations to improve communication and approval procedures with stakeholders. 
EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
BSc construction management, engineering, architecture, or equivalent
Minimum overall relevant experience 15 years.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
Minimum of 5 years working in Middle East
Fluency in Arabic and English languages both written and spoken
Knowledge of design and construction management on buildings and civil infrastructure projects including utilities interface and coordination management
Particular experience of dealing with Government Authorities and Utility Service Providers. Experience of Abu Dhabi Authorities is desirable
Experience and skills in developing and managing Stakeholder relationships.
COMPETENCIES
Strong Stakeholder focus.
Proactive
Strong interpersonal & communication skills
Team Management & Team player.
Planning & organising
Accepts responsibility.
HSE Awareness

description:
Title:

UABOS Turkey: Structural and Design Engineer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.

Job Summary

Join our team as a Structural Engineer in Incirlik, Turkey. Where you'll perform engineering and planning activities aligned with U.S. Air Force standards. In this role, you'll deliver essential structural analyses and pathology reports, developing design solutions to rectify deficiencies as part of project objectives. We require exceptional time management skills and a proven track record of maintaining professional customer relationships, ensuring effective communication to update leadership and customers on project status. At KBR, we're committed to solving challenges and driving progress in the engineering field. Join our team and be part of innovative projects where you can make a difference and advance your career.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Database Management: Maintain and update the NexGenIT software database or successor systems.
Project Design Management: Provide leadership and design project execution oversight for various contracts, including design, A&E, design-build, IDIQ, MACC, and service contracts.
Design Services: Manage design programs for facility and infrastructure projects, ensuring timely completion.
Facility Assessment and Maintenance: Provide structural analysis, pathology reports, and design solutions for structural deficiencies. Support CEO Structures Shop as needed.
Engineering and Planning: Develop short, medium, and long-term plans for installation complexes, optimizing space utilization.
Contracting and Collaboration: Develop contracting packages, oversee project execution, and collaborate with engineers on multi-discipline projects.
Coordination and Liaison: Provide engineering support for agency projects, coordinating with entities like AFCEC, USACE, NAVFAC, NATO and DLA.
Project Closure: Conduct project acceptance inspections, complete contract closure documents, and ensure submission of as-builts and manuals.
Construction Management Liaison: Serve as liaison for projects with AFCEC, USACE, NAVFAC, NATO, DLA or other third-party agencies.
Continuous Improvement: Drive service improvement while reducing costs by suggesting enhancements in procedures, technology, and human resources for improved productivity and quality.

Basic Qualifications 

U.S. Citizen
3 years of Structural Engineering experience
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering or Architecture from an accredited college or university, or approved equivalent
Certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP)
Shall have or be able to obtain a U.S. Secret security clearance
Training in Security Engineering UFC 4-010-01, demonstrating proficiency in antiterrorism standards for building design and engineering.
English proficiency: Reading Level III, Written Level III, Verbal Level III
Class B (passenger vehicle) driver’s license
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

Preferred Qualifications 

Proficiency in Microsoft Office & AutoCAD or similar software.  
DoD installation-level experience
6 years of project engineering experience for major real property facilities
6  years of experience in design and management of capital projects
Experience in planning, programming, scoping, and executing multi-discipline facility and infrastructure projects
Familiarity with American and Turkish facility design standards
Knowledgeable in developing and executing multi-discipline construction projects, evaluating contract schedules, and preparing construction reports.
Familiarity with engineering principles, materials, specification writing, USAF contracting procedures, engineering equipment, and surveying essential.
Familiarity with construction practices in host nations (HN) preferred.

description:
Title:

UABOS Turkey: Firefighter/Driver

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 
Program Summary
KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.
Job Summary
To serve as a Firefighter assigned to drive and operate firefighting vehicles of significant complexity engaged in airfield, structural firefighting, crash-rescue, and Hazardous Materials (HAZMAT) Operations and assist in reducing and/or eliminating potential fire hazards and reacting to the presence or potential releases of hazardous materials as a first responder to protect persons, property, or the environment. 
Roles and Responsibilities 
Safely operate fire department apparatus driving in both emergency & non-emergency response conditions
Performs hazard and risk assessment techniques in completing initial incident analysis.  Drives and operates firefighting vehicles, such as pumpers, Quint ladder trucks, Mobile Water Supply (MWS) and Airport Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) vehicles
 Performs crash-rescue and structural firefighting duties for a variety of facilities and where hazardous conditions are such that the expectancy for fire is high and potential for becoming destructive is great
Performs rescue of personnel and a variety of first aid measures to alleviate further injury and prepare the victim(s) for transport to a medical facility
Maintains firefighting equipment and fire station facilities. 
Responds to fire alarms and combats fire requiring the full range of firefighting tasks involving structures, equipment, and other facilities
Performs operational checks/maintenance on fire department apparatus and equipment to ensure operational readiness
Responds to on-site accidents/emergencies to provide Emergency Medical Responder (EMR) care and non-invasive emergency procedures
Perform work at airfields handling aircraft) e.g., fighters, bombers, cargo, passenger) carrying large volumes of fuel, conventional and sometimes nuclear weapons, or highly flammable or explosive cargo; or handling a large number of air move, or a moderate number involving pilot training, or other air moves with high crash or fire potential
Perform pre-fire planning by physically going through structures to become familiar with the layout, fire hazard, and location of fixed fire protection systems
Complies with health, safety, and environmental rules and procedures and performs work in a manner that enhances the safety of the work environment
Employee is required participate in a mandatory physical fitness program
Employee is required to use all safety equipment and clothing provided by management
This position requires the employee to wear a uniform and/or protective clothing weighing up to 50 lbs
This position requires the employee to work under adverse environmental conditions and falls under the respiratory protection program and hearing conservation program
Position requires the ability to discern colors, contrast, and depth
May be required to work in the Fire Alarm Communications Center (FACC) & be certified as a relief dispatcher
Knowledge of hazardous materials emergency response procedures, equipment, and identification
Knowledge to drive and operate firefighting vehicles of significant complexity; of the principles of hydraulics as they pertain to water flow, water pressure, water levels, line (friction) losses, etc.; and of basic and specialized airfield and structural firefighting equipment (fire alarm system operation, fire extinguishing equipment operation, etc.) techniques, and procedures
Knowledge of basic building design, construction, and occupancy; and of the latest changes in aircraft cockpit design, ordnance placement, and cabin layouts to include the operation of hatch or canopy release mechanisms, ejection seat mechanisms, and/or oxygen supply systems
 Knowledge of emergency first aid techniques; and of safety requirements as outlined in applicable safety standards, regulations, and/or technical orders
Skill in operating communications equipment
Ability to maintain good working relations; to communicate orally and in writing
The work is performed in various settings, such as office buildings, warehouses, industrial buildings, or construction sites.  In some areas, the employee may be required to wear protective clothing, such as masks, goggles, gloves, or shields.  The work may involve moderate risks requiring the exercise of safety precautions when working around fuel transfer operations, construction sites, hospitals airfields, etc.
Heavy physical effort is required in the frequent handling of objects such as support equipment weighing 50 lbs or more; may be required to lift/carry personnel such as an adult male (weighing 200 lbs) in emergency situations.  Duties require full use of both arms, both legs and fingers to bend, turn, pull, crawl, kneel, and climb for such tasks as use of aerial ladders, firefighting equipment controls, arranging/connecting hoses, rappelling, operation of fire truck and all types of rescue operations, etc.  Performs work under extremely adverse conditions, including working in conditions immediately dangerous to life and health which generates temperature extremes and dirty environments
Basic Qualifications 
Required to pass a Physical Agility Obstacle course of various Firefighting skills
High School Diploma
Have a current driver’s license
Meet position certifications IAW DOD 6055.06-M
Have the following DOD, Pro-Board or ISAC certifications:
Munitions Fire Fighting course
Emergency Medical Responder (EMR)
Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)
Apparatus Driver Operator – Aerial
Apparatus Driver Operator – Mobile Water Supply
Apparatus Driver Operator – Pumper
Apparatus Driver Operator – Aircraft Rescue & Firefighting
Hazardous Materials (HAZMAT) Operations
Airport Firefighter
Firefighter II
3+ years firefighting experience in an organized fire protection function that provides fire suppression services.  At least two of the 3 years shall have been in an organization that provides aircraft crash, fire and rescue services.
Have a working knowledge of fire suppression, rescue and emergency incident techniques, operation of fire equipment, water distribution and supply requirements. 
Have a working knowledge of the characteristics of aircraft fuel propellants, oxidizers and weapons. 
Preferred Qualifications
Telecommunicator I/II

title: Lead Onshore Pipeline Engineer
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Lead Onshore Pipeline Engineer

"Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR !

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals.

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets."

Job Description- Lead Onshore Pipeline Engineer

Position Title: Lead Onshore Pipeline Engineer
Company: KBR Corporate – In-house Engineering
Location: Abu Dhabi, UAE — KBR Office

Job Purpose

Lead pipeline engineering activities within Concept, FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) and Detail Engineering for Oil & Gas projects.
Ensure high-quality, safe, and timely delivery of pipeline design and related deliverables in adherence with project requirements, international codes, and standards.
Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and coordination across multi-disciplinary teams and interfaces with clients.

Key Job Responsibilities

Lead and independently perform the pipeline engineering scope for Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering phases.
Develop and review pipeline design strategies, standards, and procedures.
Hands-on capability to perform and supervise pipeline calculations, pipeline design basis, mechanical design, routing optimization, stress analysis, support design, crossings design & optimization, buckling assessment & mitigation, buoyancy assessment, location class & valve station selection, hot tap studies, ductile fracture assessment, scrapping requirement assessment, and insulation considerations.
Ensure compliance with applicable codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8, API RP 1101, etc.) and project specifications.
Review and approve technical deliverables such as P&IDs, isometrics, routing drawings, material lists, and design basis memoranda.
Coordinate and interface with process, piping, mechanical, instrumentation, electrical, materials & corrosion, safety, construction, geotechnical, structural and civil teams to resolve technical issues.
Manage change to scope, schedule, and budget, and provide risk assessments and mitigation plans.
Mentor and train junior engineers; provide technical reviews and feedback.
Interface with clients and vendors, supporting technical clarifications and design approvals.
Ensure engineering integrity, quality assurance and document control for all pipeline-related deliverables.
Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives, toolbox talks, and knowledge sharing.
Support field execution and construction activities as needed, including site visits when required and as-built documentation.

Experience

Minimally 15+ years of onshore pipeline engineering experience and proven track record in Concept, FEED and Detail Engineering and EPCM experience in the Oil & Gas industry.
Key Requirement 1: Previous ADNOC EPC experience + familiarity with ADNOC procedures & requirement (procurement, permitting, interfaces, etc.) is highly preferred. 
Key Requirement 2: Highly capable and efficient in preparing (hands-on) all onshore pipeline engineering deliverables independently and simultaneously working on multiple pipeline projects. Owns assigned tasks with high degree of responsibility. Flexibility & adaptability to maneuver dynamic and evolving project environment. 
Key Requirement 3: Experienced in Iraq field development projects. 
Experience in onshore pipeline constructability, procurement process & commissioning is highly desirable.
Familiarity / experience in offshore pipeline and subsea engineering is a bonus.

Education & Qualifications

Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (e.g. Pipeline, Mechanical or similar applicable degree).
Chartered status or professional registration is a plus.
Proven pipeline design software proficiency (eg. AutoPIPE, Caesar II, MathCAD, etc.) is mandatory. 
Proven experience independently and directly managing a group of designers producing project pipeline drawings to meet client requirements.

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of pipeline mechanical design, stress analysis, routing optimization, crossing design (road, rail, river, HDD, open cut, etc.) & optimization, buckling (LB, UHB) assessment & mitigation, and thermal expansion considerations.
Proficient in relevant codes and standards (e.g., ASME B31.4, B31.8; API standards).
Ability to perform stress analysis, material selection, and corrosion considerations.
Knowledge of HSE practices & requirements and risk assessment methodologies applicable to design and construction phases.

Soft Skills

Integrity: upholding engineering integrity amidst challenging priorities.
Leadership: ability to lead, motivate, and develop a multidisciplinary, multicultural team.
Communication: clear and concise communication with internal teams and clients; effective technical writing and presentation skills.
Problem Solving: strong analytical and troubleshooting capabilities.
Project Management: ability to manage scope, schedule, and budget; risk management.
Stakeholder Management: adept at coordinating with clients, vendors, and project partners.
Adaptability: comfortable operating in dynamic project environments and across multiple projects.

What We Offer:

Opportunities for professional development and career advancement in a challenging work environment.
Engaging and collaborative work environment with a commitment to excellence, safety and sustainability.

title: Reliability Engineer
description:
Title:

Reliability Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for Reliability Engineer - To coordinate and execute responsibilities relating to governing and establishing the Total reliability program Framework  throughout the remaining asset lifecycle in Refinery.

Responsibilities:

To prepare framework and methodology for criticality assessment and Reliability improvement program of refinery assets.
To lead and Perform Asset Criticality Analysis for all the refinery assets
To collect all data for criticality assessment, Lead/conduct Asset Criticality assessment workshops, Compilation of workshop finding in suitable reports and populate the data in required format for uploading in SAP with supporting documents.
Champion the implementation of various reliability methodologies for all asset types by establishing reliability programs to sustain operational excellence.
Shall lead the team as the focal point of contact for reviews and technical matters related to reliability culture development in projects and operating facilities with guidance to safeguard the asset reliability throughout the asset lifecycle.
Shall administer and perform the Asset Lifecycle management procedures such as Asset criticality ranking, SAP Taxonomy, Asset Operating Limits [IOW], Asset maintenance development procedures, and Master data developments in SAP, Bill of Materials BOM in SAP, active SAP-PMs Implementation and effectiveness.
Shall initiate and conduct essential studies for facilities and operational asset improvements, while providing specialized technical service in relevant engineering disciplines, acts as a consultant on complex engineering problems, designs, and/or projects, coordinates with plant-wide teams. 
Responsible to adapt lessons learned from benchmark and safety cases identified from events, providing recommendations - in consultation with management to provide continuous assurance methodology is applied to sustain the health of Safety-Critical Equipment’s concerning Total Reliability program are sufficient to mitigate any potential threats arising from changes in major hazard scenarios. 
Shall Work with multidisciplinary teams assigned to analyse specific integrity and performance analysis, and suggest methods for the prevention of chronic failures. Support to review the Total Reliability program KPIs.
Shall report to Project Manager and lead the Reliability section to deliver the periodic outcomes and weekly/fortnightly report on project progress.
Work closely with the project execution team to ensure his complete familiarization and commitment with the Reliability Transformation Program, which will be a key factor for the success of this Reliability Transformation Project.

Qualifications:

Bachelor degree in Mechanical or relevant engineering with sound fundamentals and technical skills in his discipline is required.
The candidate shall have site Reliability background and strong knowledge in Refinery Processes. ​
The candidate shall have training in root cause failure analysis methodology e.g. Apollo Root Cause Analysis by Reality Charting or similar methodology, also should be able to facilitate RCA and ACA process.
Knowledge of SIS and RBI will be added advantage.
Minimum 10 years’ of relevant Experience in Oil / Gas / petrochemical industry. Experience in static and Rotating equipment, instrument and electrical system and understanding their failure modes and potential solutions is desirable.
Experience with operations, maintenance, pre-commissioning, commissioning and Hand-over activities is an advantage. 
Shall be well aware of all the key performance indicators related to reliability of plant operation and be able to support and drive those KPI’s.
Experience in administering the Asset Lifecycle management procedures such as Asset criticality ranking, SAP Taxonomy, Asset Operating Limits [IOW], Asset maintenance development procedures, and Master data developments in SAP, Bill of Materials BOM in SAP, active SAP-PMs Implementation and effectiveness.
Leadership and Team Management
Knowledge of the Oil and Gas Industry.
Experience in Asset Life cycle Management processes.
Implementing predictive maintenance policies and increasing asset availability
Communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a diversified and critical environment.
Data analysis and report writing skills.
Attention to details.
Knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point).
Proficient in verbal and written English.

title: System/Controls Engineer
description:
Title:

System/Controls Engineer

Program Summary

Kord, a wholly owned subsidiary of KBR, is a leader in advanced defense solutions with a strong focus on directed energy and high energy laser (HEL) technologies. Our HEL programs support the U.S. Department of Defense in developing, integrating, testing, and fielding cutting-edge laser weapon systems that enhance national security and deliver decisive battlefield advantages. These efforts require deep technical expertise in controls engineering, systems integration, and real-time performance of laser subsystems under demanding operational conditions.

Job Summary

The System / Controls Engineer will play a critical role in the design, development, integration, and performance verification of control systems that support High Energy Laser weapon platforms. This position involves working across hardware, software, and system-level interfaces to ensure reliable, safe, and high-precision operation of HEL subsystems—including beam control, power and thermal management, safety interlocks, sensors, and command-and-control interfaces.

The engineer will collaborate closely with systems engineers, software developers, mechanical engineers, test teams, and program leadership to advance HEL capabilities from concept through fielding.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Design, develop, and analyze control systems for HEL subsystems (beam control, pointing & tracking, power/thermal control, diagnostics, safety systems, etc.).

· Define system and subsystem requirements, interface control documents (ICDs), and architecture for control and automation functions.

· Implement control algorithms, signal processing routines, and feedback loops to achieve precision laser performance.

· Integrate sensors, actuators, control hardware, and embedded software into HEL testbeds and fielded systems.

· Conduct modeling and simulation of control loops, system dynamics, and performance predictions.

· Support system integration, laboratory testing, field testing, and troubleshooting of HEL prototype and operational systems.

· Analyze system data to identify performance issues, root causes, and optimization opportunities.

· Ensure compliance with DoD standards, safety requirements, and program technical baselines.

· Work with cross-functional engineering teams to support design reviews, risk assessments, and technical decision-making.

· Generate technical documentation, test procedures, test reports, and design artifacts in accordance with program requirements.


Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, Controls Engineering, or related technical discipline.

· Minimum 5 years of experience in systems engineering, controls engineering, embedded systems, or related disciplines.

· Hands-on experience developing and analyzing control systems (PID, model-based control, sensor fusion, real-time control).

· Experience working with sensors, actuators, data acquisition systems, or embedded control hardware.

· Proficiency with modeling and simulation tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, LabVIEW, or similar.

· Ability to interpret engineering drawings, schematics, and interface requirements.

· Strong analytical problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose complex system behaviors.

· Excellent communication skills for interacting with engineers, program management, and government customers.

· U.S. Citizenship required and ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance.


Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree in Engineering or related field.

· Experience with High Energy Laser, directed energy, optical, or precision pointing systems.

· Background in real-time systems, embedded software, FPGA-based control, or high-speed data acquisition.

· An understanding of electro-optical systems, beam control technologies, or thermal/power systems.

· Knowledge of DoD systems engineering processes, requirements development, and verification/validation.

· Experience with computer vision algorithms, image processing, and closed loop video tracking.

· Prior experience supporting Army, Navy, Air Force, or OSD HEL programs.

· Active DoD Secret or Top-Secret clearance.

· Demonstrated ability to lead technical tasks and support multi-disciplinary engineering teams.


KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

title: Construction Manager
location:
locations
Houston, Texas
Washington DC Metro Area
description:
Title:

Construction Manager

Construction Manager 

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and be 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

KBR is in search of a skilled Construction Manager to lead construction projects and task orders (TOs) to recapitalize, complete major repairs, new construction, and augment the existing infrastructure in addition to the required operations and maintenance of our customer’s sites. You will manage a team of specialists, focusing on operational effectiveness, maintenance, safety, and environmental compliance. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong communication skills, analytical acumen, an eye for detail, and a proven ability to make decisions and adhere to strict deadlines.

This is a 24x7 operation which requires provision of on-call support.  Your role transcends conventional limits, placing a premium on the solid availability of essential services. It's imperative that these projects and TOs comply with all applicable codes, standards and regulations.  Your vigilant oversight and proactive strategies are the cornerstones of our commitment to delivering stellar customer service.

What You'll Do

In the role of Construction Manager, your duties will include:

Direct the facilities' construction and maintenance at each site including but not limited to job site document control and distribution of drawings, specifications, and all other technical documents

Directs project construction planning, safety, cost control, and scheduling activities

Interpret drawings and implement specifications for job site queries

Resolves job site technical issues encountered during execution of construction projects

Formulating and enforcing operational and construction standards that support company objectives, contractual requirements and comply with regulatory and environmental standards

Hiring, training, and leading a competent workforce to be versatile and technically savvy

Keeping a close watch on contractual obligations and staying informed of any regulatory changes that impact facility operations

Orchestrating activities to align with the overarching contract requirements and to ensure smooth site operations.

Provide technical support to site operations, guaranteeing the continuity of critical infrastructure operations, with a commitment to reliability for around-the-clock mission support

Communicating effectively with diverse teams, responding to questions, and solving a range of operational issues

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS 

REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess an active Secret security clearance with the ability to obtain a US TS/SCI w/ Poly level clearance.

Bachelor’s degree in a Construction related field; OR Diploma or equivalent AND fifteen (15) years of experience in management-level positions.

5+ years’ experience in Construction Management OR ten (10) years trade experience with at least five (5) years in supervisory or site lead positions.

Experience in managing high dollar projects, directing sub-contractors and skilled workers.

Experience in managing multiple site locations.

Experience in managing small projects in a fast-pace environment, using a variety of laborers and contractors.

Preferred Skills, a plus:

Experienced in managing an A&E staff.

Experience in management of OCONUS personnel.

Experience with Capital construction work within OCONUS locations.

Ability to react quickly to customer needs and changing priorities.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. title: Program Manager
description:
Title:

Program Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Program Summary:

KBR is looking for a motivated, energetic, and established leader with recent experience leading large USAF logistics, maintenance leadership, or sustainment engineering leadership to join our team as a Program Manager.  This is not an entry level Program Manager position.

This position is on Tinker AFB, OK and will require interfacing with government and contractor personnel.

Job Description:

Support the Missile Sustainment Division for the Air Launched Cruise Missile (ALCM) System Program Office (SPO) in managing program activities such as life cycle logistics program planning, proposal pricing, financial management, cost analysis, management techniques, documentation requirements, or network analysis. Candidate must exhibit capability in areas of production of planning documents, preparing and utilizing databases for cost analysis and financial management. Must apply expertise in DOD, Agency, and/or industry standards and engineering requirements, make recommendations to customer for changes to standards and requirements. May be the primary customer contact for assigned area of responsibility.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Duties include but are not limited to: Workload Management - Must have the ability to plan, organize, and reprioritize work to meet the most challenging deadlines.

Compile and review budgets against actual performance, previous budget figures, estimated revenue, and other data sources to control budgets and provide for proper financial decisions.

Aid in developing and implementing strategies to achieve program objectives safely and within agreed time, cost, technical, quality, and other performance criteria.

Develop plans including budgets and schedules to meet contractual/program requirements for several major portions of a program.

Support the customer program manager in executing mission as single point of integrative responsibility needed to ensure that everything in the program is managed effectively to ensure a successful outcome.

Analyze program activities such as acquisition program planning, proposal pricing, financial management, cost analysis, management techniques, documentation requirements, or network analysis.

Develop acquisition strategies/plans and other statutory/regulatory documentation (writing, editing, cross-walking, and compliance checking), briefings and white papers supporting acquisition decisions at each of the milestones.

Participates in the control of costs and schedules on contracts requiring validated cost schedule control system.

Perform analyses and prepare reports in order to ensure that contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and government cost control guidelines.

Participate in the preparation of budgets and schedules for all contract work and perform and/or assist in financial analyses such as funding profiles, sales outlook, and variance analysis.

Ensures adequate funding availability by maintaining accurate records of expenditures, directing preparation of expenditure projections, and submitting timely requests for additional funding to the government.

Incorporate contractual changes into control systems by staying aware of outstanding work against each contract in order to maintain realistic contract cost and schedule baselines.

Develop plans including budgets and schedules to meet contractual/project requirements for several major portions of a program.

Provide support to the PM in program progress reviews and other performance reviews. May also assist in creating/briefing higher level executive agency system acquisition or program summary reports.

Gather and organize information on problems or procedures including present operating procedures.

Analyze data gathered, develops information and considers all available solutions or alternate methods of proceeding.

Organize and documents findings of studies and prepares recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures or organizational changes.

Confer with personnel concerned to assure smooth functioning of newly implemented systems or procedures.

May conduct operational effectiveness reviews to ensure functional or project systems are applied as designed, and functioning satisfactorily.

May develop or update functional or operating manuals outlining established methods of performing work in accordance with organizational policy.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree in Business, Business Management, Finance, Systems Engineering, or related technical discipline.

Minimum of four (4) years’ experience in technical planning and implementation, budget development and administration of projects.

Active security clearance or the ability to obtain a secret security clearance.

Use of MS Office Suite; specifically MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word

Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge and experience with the Department of Defense Instruction (DoDI) 5000 series and Air Force Instruction (AFI) 63-101/20-101. 

Knowledge and experience necessary to manage weapon system specific funding and scheduling using Integrated Budget Documentation and Execution System (IDECS) and Comprehensive Cost and Requirement System (CCaRS).

Knowledge and experience with developing life cycle logistics strategies to include initiating, reviewing, developing, and implementing activities to accomplish service life extensions and execution of test and evaluation. Knowledge areas include depot and field maintenance and supportability concepts, Performance Work Statements (PWSs), Statements of Work (SOW), Data Items Descriptions (DIDs), test procedures and plans, obsolescence and Diminishing Manufacturing Sources and Material Shortages (DMSMS), risk management, and end item delivery and installation.

Knowledge and experience with acquisition reporting, including updating information in the Monthly Acquisition Report (MAR) accessed via the Project Management Resource Tools (PMRT) system, program management reviews, monthly program and risk reporting, and ad hoc taskings for reporting program status.

Certified APDP Level II in Program Management, or industry equivalent, within the past five years.

Extensive knowledge and experience in managing and executing Acquisition Category (ACAT) III acquisition programs or Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation (RDT&E) programs.

Knowledge of Tinker AFB and its mission is a plus.

Use of MS Project is a plus.

Gather and organize information on problems or procedures including present operating procedures.
Analyze data gathered, develops information and considers all available solutions or alternate methods of proceeding.

Title:

Senior Director of Business Development

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future.

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking a Senior Director of Business Development for the Science & Space (S&S) organization. The Senior Director of Business Development will report to the Vice President of Growth for S&S and oversee the Business Development team and efforts for S&S federal government pursuits.

Responsibilities include developing and leading the team of business development managers through early-game phases of the pursuit lifecycle. Emphasis is on ensuring our business development and account managers leverage the KBR early-game BD process to develop early understanding of the procurement environment, generate leads which are addressable by KBR, build trust within the client’s decision-making organization, and promote aggressive and progressive engagement with the customer to increase our pWin early through customer and opportunity shaping activity. Lastly, the Senior Director of Business Development will be responsible for ensuring the team is feeding the pipeline with quality opportunities and maturing them through KBR’s business development process to ensure senior executive insight into, and engagement with, early strategy decision gates which require a high level of commercial acumen to ensure an advantaged KBR solution. The Senior Director of Business Development will manage roughly 5 direct reports.

Responsibilities include overseeing all front-end business development efforts with a focus on mentoring and leading the team of business development managers. This includes ensuring individual BD managers have the requite skills and abilities to operate across the early-game business development cycle. The Senior Director will participate in milestone and color team reviews and provide value in the process to lead enhancements of solutions reflecting the voice of the customer.  The Senior Director will assist individual managers in developing thorough business development and account plans and drive the overall foundation for a compelling approach to market. The high-level objective for this position is to improve commercial acumen and Business Development Excellence of the organization through process improvement, training, strategic thinking, and a disciplined business development approach.

Qualifications

Growth minded individual with a minimum 20 years’ experience with demonstrated success in managing federal government business development teams that consist of 5 or more people that have pursued individual Single Award contracts valued greater than $300M.

• Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Business Administration, or a technical degree

• Demonstrated successes reflecting the ability to grow the business

• Strong skill in all forms of business communication – verbal, writing and executive presence

• Familiarity and experience managing the pipeline and utilizing CRM tools such as Salesforce

• Demonstrated ability to work with senior business and government leaders at all levels, and to provide leadership within the workplace

• Experience with competitive and teaming analysis and strategic pricing/commercial acumen

• Demonstrated ability and interpersonal skills to work with Executives and lead teams

• Experience winning large scale programs over $300M in the federal government

• Experience developing account plans and individual business development pursuit plans for new business opportunities.

• Proven individual BD and/or Capture experience with demonstrated wins.

Basic Compensation:

$226,800.00 - $340,100.00

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Space Suit Design Engineer
description:
Title:

Space Suit Design Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely by supporting the science that informs decision makers and protects Earth.

KBR is seeking a SPACE SUIT DESIGN ENGINEER to support our SPACE SUIT OPERATIONS TEAM for KBR’s Science and Space division on the xEVAS contract. 

The SPACE SUIT DESIGN ENGINEER SPACE SUIT DESIGN ENGINEER will be part of the team that supports the Space Suit Division at KBR on the xEVAS contract. The candidate will work on a collaborative team developing, building and maintaining Space Suits and supporting equipment for low Earth orbit and beyond.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Design, develop, test, handle implementation, and analysis of technical products and systems using applied engineering principles, including solid and fluid mechanics, and heat transfer.
Perform engineering design evaluations.
Procure, assemble, and test advanced prototypes to inform design decisions, refinements, and to demonstrate performance.
Prepare and present designs at various design reviews using MS Word and PowerPoint.
Produce other required design documentation.
Assist in the development of requirements for hardware.
Ensure designs satisfy requirements and demonstrate performance in a thorough verification and validation program.
Support production of hardware, evaluate anomalies and incorporate corrective actions.
Perform trade studies for technology development.
Analyze data and make recommendations for improvement.
Understand nominal and off-nominal operations for a technical system and its interaction(s) with other systems.
Manage multiple issues at one time and develop an integrated solution.
Work with fabrication and manufacturing departments to ensure final design is properly executed in the creation of mechanical products.
Perform other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Must have a bachelor’s degree in the field of mechanical or aerospace engineering, or a related field.
Years of Experience: This position requires 5 to 10 years of experience.
This position requires you to work onsite in Houston, Texas near the Johnson Space Center (77058).
The candidate must possess excellent verbal, written, interpersonal, leadership, and team working skills.
Demonstrated skill in using computer-aided design (CAD) software in design work.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate well with peers and cross-functional teams and external customers.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Hands-on familiarity with production grade manufacturing equipment.
Experience using established engineering principles in the design and development of life critical components for use in extreme environments.
Experience with qualification and acceptance testing.
Good communication skills, verbal and written
Good interpersonal skills

WORK LOCATION

This position is located onsite at customer facility.

STANDARD KBR REQUIREMENTS:

All of KBR’s employee’s must be team players, able to communicate effectively with internal and external customers, able to follow safety and quality policies, able to follow company programs, processes, procedures, practices, requirements, goals, and objectives. In addition, they must also be organized, with good time management skills.

description:
Title:

Master Electrician

Master Electrician

This role will be located at an OCONUS location​ and 100% onsite

Who We Are

KBR Mission Technology Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. We help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is within KBR/NSS Intel division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Who YOU Are

You’re a Master Electrician with extensive expertise and a dedication to excellence, ready to lead complex electrical projects that support critical missions for our customers. With your deep knowledge of electrical systems, safety protocols, and advanced troubleshooting, you ensure that installations and maintenance are executed to the highest standards. Your leadership and technical skill set make you an invaluable resource for tackling complex challenges, adapting to evolving needs, and enhancing operational readiness.

At KBR, you’re a trusted expert, known for your precision, problem-solving abilities, and commitment to safety. You bring strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset, empowering teams to deliver reliable, sustainable solutions that are critical to mission success. Your high standards and meticulous approach to every detail align with KBR’s mission of building a safer, more secure, and sustainable future.

What You'll Do

In the role of Master Electrician, your duties will include:

Must be thoroughly familiar with electrical trade in maintenance of equipment.

Have experience with conducting and working under safe practices and working knowledge of safety standards for electrical equipment maintenance and repair.

Experience in battery maintenance and installation.

Must be able to read blueprints and perform material take-offs from prints.

Must possess leadership skills

Must possess the skills and attitudes to effectively communicate with the customer and subordinates.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award and will be located OCONUS

REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a SECRET clearance with the ability to upgrade to a TS/SCI w/ Poly

Certified Master Electrician from a US/CONUS jurisdiction

(8) Eight years’ experience in maintenance or construction, two (2) of which are in a lead or supervisory role.

US citizenship required

title: Data Scientist / Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Data Scientist / Systems Engineer

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Data Scientist/Systems Engineer

Please note: This position is contingent upon contract award.

Role Overview: KBR is seeking an organized and proactive Data Scientist to support our U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Land Imaging (NLI) Program customer in Reston, VA. This critical role is part of the Requirements, Capabilities, and Analysis for Earth Observation (RCA-EO) contract, which is dedicated to gathering the needs of remote sensing scientists, modeling remote sensing capabilities, and producing comprehensive decision-support analyses. These efforts directly inform the National Land Imaging Program’s strategic investments, particularly concerning the Landsat Mission.

Take on a customer-facing role, fostering and maintaining robust relationships with clients and stakeholders, including federal agency representatives and scientific partners.
Utilize experience in data analytics and data visualization to translate complex datasets and modeling results into actionable insights for program decisions.
Apply critical thinking and creative solutioning to solve emerging challenges in Earth observation requirements and capability assessments.
Lead and mentor cross-functional teams engaged in remote sensing science, capability modeling, and strategic analysis.
Demonstrate experience/education in remote sensing technologies, including satellite systems, to contribute to mission planning and future investment strategies.
Lead network analyses to identify and map stakeholder relationships and support collaborative scientific efforts.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
5+ years of relevant experience in data analytics or related field.
Proven leadership experience leading teams, preferably in government contracting or scientific programs.
Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with the ability to manage complex projects and diverse teams.
Proficiency in advanced data analytics tools and data visualization platforms (PowerBI, Tableau, etc).
Active TS/SCI Clearance or ability achieve a TS/SCI is required to qualify for this position.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in engineering, data analytics, or a related field is preferred.
Solid background in optical remote sensing, satellite modeling, or Earth observation science.
Experience with network analysis and network software (e.g., Neo4j).
Experience with R or other statistical software for data analysis and modeling.
Certifications in data visualization software.
Experience working with artificial intelligence or natural language processing systems.

This position operates out of the Washington, DC metropolitan area and offers the possibility of a hybrid work arrangement.

The RCA-EO contract provides a dynamic opportunity to shape the future of national land imaging and play a pivotal part in the continuing success of the Landsat Mission. If you are passionate about remote sensing and strategic program management, we invite you to apply.

*** Please note: This position is contingent upon contract award. ***

title: Quality Specialist (Contingency Hire)
description:
Title:

Quality Specialist (Contingency Hire)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR will help support the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps at Naval Station Mayport and the Marine Corps Support Facility at Blount Island (MCSF-BI). Our goal is to help their missions run smoothly and successfully. Let’s work together to make a positive impact and achieve results.

Naval Station Mayport is located along the St. Johns River in Duval County, Florida. It covers 3,409 acres and is the third-largest naval surface fleet area in the U.S. Since it opened in 1942, it has become a key hub with a harbor for 34 ships and a runway for most Department of Defense aircraft.

MCSF-BI covers 911 acres on the eastern side of Blount Island, plus an extra 333 acres nearby. This facility is vital for keeping Marine Air-Ground Task Forces ready. MCSF-BI has a deep-water slipway and direct access to the Atlantic, allowing for quick loading and unloading of the largest Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) ships. This helps deploy combat vehicles and supplies.

Job Summary

The Quality Control (QC) Personnel/Associate is a mandatory, full-time, on-site role essential for executing the Contractor's Quality Management System (QMS) across operations at NAVSTA Mayport, Blount Island, and outlying areas. The primary duty of this position is to enforce the Contractor's QMS on the contract. QC Personnel must be present whenever the Contractor is performing work during the Government’s regular working hours.

Please note: This position is contingent upon award.

Roles and Responsibilities

Report directly to the Quality Manager to maintain independence in quality oversight.
Meet or exceed the qualifications and technical expertise of the personnel whose work is being inspected.
Possess a minimum of three (3) years of experience implementing and enforcing QMS programs on contracts of similar size, scope, and complexity.
Complete all required pre-requisite training prior to assignment.
Active Secret Clearance is required. 
The primary duty and responsibility is to enforce the Contractor's QMS on this contract.
Conduct quality oversight and inspections to ensure services comply with QMS standards.
Contribute to the documentation of all scheduled and performed inspections and surveillances, results, and dates and details of corrective and preventive actions.
 Work to ensure all phases of work adhere to the established performance objectives and standards for reliability, usability, and performance

Basic Qualifications

Must have knowledge of quality management systems (QMS) and quality control processes. 
Proficiency in quality assurance methodologies and tools. 
Must have experience in conducting quality audits, inspections, and implementing corrective actions.

Preferred Qualifications

Associate’s degree with a major study in Logistics, Maintenance, Business, or Quality Assurance or equivalent work experience
2-3 years’ experience in administrative, professional, analytical, or other work related to ISO 9001/14001 programs or operations
Experience with the development and implementation of corrective and preventive action, audit, and continuous improvement programs.
Experience with the development and implementation of corrective and preventive action, audit, and continuous improvement programs.
In-depth knowledge of quality and project management tools, concepts, and methodologies.
Certifications such as ASQ, Lean Six Sigma, or Project Management.

description:
Title:

User Engagement & Outreach Representative

User Engagement & Outreach Representative

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This position is contingent upon contract award

We are looking for a User Engagement and Outreach Representative to serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on innovative applications of overhead support, addressing tasks from DoD and IC communities. This role will advocate for the development and integration of new capabilities and tradecraft to tackle the challenges faced by the Combatant Command (CCMD) and its components.

The User Engagement Representative will provide valuable insights into the pressing needs of specific Combatant Command and how the customer’s capabilities can meet those demands. This position will focus on fostering multi-agency, multi-int solutions to various issues while offering support to relevant organizations.

Key Responsibilities:

Capture and prioritize user intelligence needs and requirements, addressing any gaps

Facilitate prompt responses to intelligence requests using customer enterprise solutions

Assist users in communicating their support needs to the Intelligence Community (IC)

Ensure users have knowledge of and access to customer systems and services, and provide tailored training and briefings

Engage with the Department of Defense and IC, leveraging expertise across disciplines

Act as a liaison between forward-placed staff and the customer, integrating fully within host organizations

Assess user needs, recommend actions to utilize customer capabilities effectively, and provide situational awareness of user requirements to the customer and greater IC

Communicate user priorities and shortfalls to relevant customer offices, documenting engagements in government knowledge management tools

Educate users on customer capabilities and ensure awareness of operational status and resource issues

Promote user involvement in shaping ongoing projects and customer forums, and facilitate rapid responses with enterprise solutions

Function as an action officer for customer leadership and manage customer relationships, tracking user needs and metrics

Required Qualifications:

Active TS/SCI clearance with polygraph required

BS degree and 7 years of relevant professional experience (May have HS with 12 years

Must be highly self-motivated with a strong technical and leadership background, demonstrating professionalism and tact under pressure

Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for effective coordination with diverse stakeholders including senior military officials and government personnel

Deep understanding of the intelligence community, with proven experience in technical fundamentals relating to IC collectors, mission control, and processing

Capability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, maintaining a customer-focused approach in community forums

Familiarity with SIGINT and GEOINT systems, along with visualization and collaboration tools that enhance the utility of customer capabilities for users

Desired Qualifications

Masters with 4 years of relevant professional experience

Knowledge of Electro-optical, RADAR, SIGINT, Communications, Mission Management, and Mission processing systems supporting space and ground architecture

Ability to be flexible to handle multiple priorities and to work flexible schedules as necessary

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities

Proficient communications skills and ability to serve as a trusted advisor

title: Sr. Specialist Quality Assurance
description:
Title:

Sr. Specialist Quality Assurance

Quality Policy: Follow established policy

Contract Review: Review, comment and close the open points of contract independently

Project Quality Management System: Identification, documentation and establish PQMS by Inductions, creating awareness among project team.

Project Quality Management Plan: Develop, implement, document and get approval to Project Quality Plan

Quality Procedures: Identify, develop other deliverables for the project like Audit Plan, Audit Procedures etc.,

Reporting: Effective reporting of Project Quality Management system like status of audits, NCR’s, audit reports, KPI's etc.,

Audits: Able to plan, conduct, report and close 1st & 2nd party audits, experience in 3rd party audits. Thorough with Engineering & Procurement quality procedures and audits

Codes & Standards: Exposure, interpretation and ability to impart training on International, Client Quality standards

Quality Tools: Knowledge, experience and ability to impart training on Quality tools like Root Cause Analysis, 5 Whys, Statistical tools, excel graphs, tools etc.,

Corporate QMS: Knowledge, experience in Corporate QMS is an added advantage.

Safety & Environment: Knowledge on International Safety standards like OHSAS 18001, ISO 45001, ISO 14001 is added advantage.

NCR's: Effectively close NCRs with Correction, Root Cause Analysis and Corrective action.

Client Interaction: Experience of direct dealing with National & International Clients is an added advantage.

Management Review: Prepare, conduct MRM, document, identify action points, follow-up and close identified action points.

Lessons Learned: Process of Identifying applicable Lessons Learned, review, verify mitigation action. Process of identifying new lessons learned, moderation

Risk Management: Identify risk in Quality, risk rating, mitigation action, tracking of actions, re-rating, manage residual risk.

Supplier Capability Assessments: Review, understand the Purchase requisitions, referenced procedures, standards etc., conduct desktop and physical supplier capability assessments, re-assessment and reporting closure of SCA.

QUALIFICATIONS - SKILL REQUIREMENTS - Experience Levels

(Additional Requirements):

Qualifications:  

BE/ B Tech. - Engineering Degree (any discipline) or Diploma in Engineering
QMS, ISO 9001:2015, Certified Lead Auditor - Mandatory         
OHSAS, ISO 45001, ISO 14001, Certified Lead Auditor – Preferred
NDE Level II – Preferred
Certified Welding Inspector – Preferred
Other Qualifications- added advantage

Experience:

Min 12 to 15 years of experience.
BE/ B Tech (11 Years Min). - Engineering Degree (any discipline) or Diploma in Engineering (Min 16 Years)
10 Years of QA/QC in Onshore / Offshore that shall include FEED, EPC- Detailed Engineering Mandatory
Extensive exposure to QMS / QA Audits - Mandatory

Soft skills:

Good English communication skills to write and speak
Open minded
Mature/sound judgment
Analytical skills/tenacity
Report writing skills
PBI Dashboards

title: Senior Stakeholder Engagement Advisor
description:
Title:

Senior Stakeholder Engagement Advisor

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The JMETC user support team is in need of a Sr Stakeholder Engagement Advisor with a background in Information Technology within DoD Test and Evaluation to assist the TRMC Digital Engineering, Big Data Knowledge Management and other JMETC projects with stakeholder and end user engagements across the Research Development Test and Evaluation community.

Responsibilities:

·         Applicant will work across existing distributed teams to develop required roadmaps and related artifacts for leveraging TRMC capabilities across diverse user communities. 

·         Works with government to provide technical direction, acting as a liaison between the end users, application developers, and senior leadership within the DoD and across the Test and Training community.

·         Applicant will be responsible for planning and coordinating technical support with the military, civil service and support contractor personnel for Test Resource Management Center Data Strategy.

·         Applicant will monitor and support the pursuit of viable opportunities by supplying the resources and training necessary to assess, screen, and prioritize opportunities to optimize utilization of resources by assisting in defining requirements, developing specifications, developing and implementing timelines and milestones.

·         Applicant is expected to Optimize results for customers as well as the company by establishing goals and objectives for operations and making operational decisions.

·         The position requires supervisory experience and ability to work with military acquisition programs.

·         This position is anticipated to require travel of 25% with possible surges beyond that amount to support end users located at various DoD Ranges and Labs across the United States, Huntsville AL and Washington, DC areas.

·         Active Top-Secret Clearance Required with ability to obtain SCI.

The JMETC program is focused on developing and deploying the processes, architecture, and BD/KM to facilitate cost effective integration of live, virtual, and constructive entities needed to support the DoD acquisition community testing needs utilizing a distributed testing approach. JMETC, TENA and CHEETAS will be integral to testing systems-of-systems applications within a realistic joint mission construct.

REQUIREMENTS  

Masters degree in an Engineering / Technical field or Masters degree in a non-technical field with 20 years of Information Technology leadership experience within DoD.  

Minimum of 20 years’ experience to include the following:

Experience Identifying and communicating best practices throughout the company
Experience with development of technical roadmaps
Experience working with TRMC and OUSD (R&E) or Service Headquarters
Military Acquisition Program knowledge
Experience with Capabilities Based T&E
Experience with Project Management
Knowledge of DoD Risk Management Framework process
Communication and Presentation skill

Knowledge of one or more of the following:

Strategic Relations
Digital Engineering
Knowledge Management within DoD
Testing and Training
DoD Programs and Acquisition process
Enterprise Software Development
Computer operating environments

title: MH-60R Developmental Test Pilot
description:
Title:

MH-60R Developmental Test Pilot

KBR is seeking an MH-60R Developmental Test Pilot to join our team in Patuxent River, Maryland. By joining KBR, you will be a part of the world’s largest independent flight test organization supporting both US-Government and Commercial Agencies.

Our highly talented and experienced aircrew services team has provided over 40 continuous years of Aircrew project support at Patuxent River. As a long-term incumbent and leader in flight test, the selected applicant will work within the NAVAIR test community composed of government, military, contractor, and industry personnel while supporting flight test. Air Test and Evaluation Squadron TWO ONE (HX-21), also known as the "Blackjacks", is a U.S. Navy squadron responsible for developmental flight test and evaluation of rotary-wing and tilt-rotor aircraft, and their associated airborne systems. HX-21's mission is to support all U.S. Navy and Marine Corps training, combat, and combat support missions. 


Role and Responsibilities: 

This position supports HX-21 Developmental Test and Evaluation at the Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division (NAWCAD), NAS Patuxent River, MD
The applicant must be able to perform the duties of an MH-60R/S developmental test pilot and project officer.
The selected candidate will support a wide range of NAWCAD test and evaluation requirements to include test planning meetings, test plan development, event planning, test procedure and card development, flight briefings, test execution, post event support, test reporting, and deficiency reporting.

Basic Qualifications:

Education: Graduate of a rotary wing flight mechanics curriculum from a recognized test pilot school (e.g., U.S. Naval Test Pilot School, Empire Test Pilot School, EPNER Test Pilot School) is required.
Years of Experience: Minimum six (6) years of experience. Two (2) years of rotary wing RDT&E flight experience is required.
Flight Hours: A minimum of 1,500 total flight hours and 800 first pilot hours in rotary wing aircraft are required.
Certification(s)/Designations: Current or previous qualifications as MH-60R/S Helicopter Aircraft Commander and Maintenance/Functional Check Flight (MCF/FCF) pilot are required.
Medical/Training: Candidate must be able to pass the physical and training qualification requirements to provide contract aircrew support, including completion of Navy water survival and aviation physiology training, as well as annual FAA Class II flight physical.
Clearance: Must be a US Citizen. Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance.

Preferred Qualifications: 

Current aircraft qualification and recent experience with rotary wing T&E techniques, concepts, principles, and practices are preferred.
An active secret level security clearance. 

This posting is intended to identify qualified candidates for a position pending government funding and/or customer program needs. Applications may be retained for future consideration and may not be reviewed immediately.

Some travel may be required to support this position.

Basic Compensation: $155,000-$230,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.
